title: [Megathread] The Tropical Isles(4k+ Words, 80+ Images, 60+ positive reactions)
body:
Current Time Taken to make this thread: 11 hours
Version: 1.0
I have enlisted the help of my good friend @M00N to help me with this idea.

This is a new island meant for the late and endgame players. You access this island via a teleport pad located in the wilderness. Accessing this requires Alchemy 20, Combat 25, and all slayers level 6.

Welcome to the Tropical Isles! Here we offer new mobs, new items, new quests, new pets, and more!

When you spawn on the island, you will see a building in front of you called "The Resort", to the left is the Infested Jungle and the Volcano, to the right is the Underwater Cave and the Beach. Here is a general map:




► The Resort
Welcome to the Resort! Here you can refresh yourself with our beverages at the bar. We also have a souvenir shop and a swimming pool!


Spoiler: Bar



Menu:
Orange and Mango Ice Tea - 250,000 Coins
Spicy Pineapple Juice - 1,000,000 Coins
Papaya Smoothie - 750,000
Banana Shake - 100,000
Guava Juice - 250,000
Grapefruit Smoothie - 500,000
Dragon Fruit Delight - 1,000,000
Mixed Smoothie - 2,500,000

(Please keep in mind the god potion will not have these effects)​




































Spoiler: The Souvenir Store



What We Sell:
All Summer Cosmetics - Each 50k
Palm Tree - 100k
Sand - 100k
Mini Volcano - 200k
Snorkel - 1 Mil(Each player can only buy one)
Water Talisman - 400k​
























Spoiler: The Swimming Pool



Can you survive all 10 Swimming Trials?​The swimming trials are 10 trials with rewards. You have to survive in the pool for 30 seconds for each trial. When your breath runs out, you will start taking true damage that is dependent on the trial. While wearing Mastiff Armor, your max health is decreased by 95%. Also if you are wearing full Diver Armor, Shark Scale Armor, or Sponge Armor, you will be blocked from entering the pool. The effect of the "Token of the Sea" Talisman is nerfed by 50%. The legendary Token will now give you +60% breathing time, instead of permanent underwater breathing.

Trial 1: 10 True Damage/s
Trial 2: 30 True Damage/s
Trial 3: 75 True Damage/s
Trial 4: 100 True Damage/s
Trial 5: 200 True Damage/s
Trial 6: 300 True Damage/s
Trial 7: 400 True Damage/s
Trial 8: 500 True Damage/s
Trial 9: 600 True Damage/s
Trial 10: 700 True Damage/s

After beating trial 1, you will be rewarded the "Swimming Medal I." This will get increased for each trial you beat(so Swimming Medal II, III, etc.) and is a common talisman. At Trial 5 and 10, the rarity will upgrade. 












► The Volcano
Welcome to the volcano! Here there are dangerous monsters near perilous lava!


Spoiler: Volcano Escape



Do you wish to attempt to escape the volcano? There will be lots of dangers ahead, be warned!

There will be 5 layers in the volcano.
Once the challenge starts, lava will start rising at the rate of 1 layer per minute. In order to unlock the teleport pad to warp to the next layer, you must defeat all the mobs on said layer. If you die on any layer, you will be teleported to the start. Once the lava reaches the layer you are on, instant death.


Spoiler: Layer 1



On layer one, there will be Magma Zombies and Magma Cubes.

[Lvl 20] Magma Zombie10000 healthDeals 2500 damage per hitHas Speed V potion effectOn hit, apply fire dealing 75 true damage per second, lasts 5 seconds.

[Lvl 25] Magma Cube15000 healthDeals 2000 damage per hitHas Rabbit V potion effectShoots fireballs dealing 100 true damage every 2 seconds
There will be 10 Magma Zombies and 10 Magma Cubes.





Spoiler: Layer 2




[Lvl 30] Magma Grunts20000 healthDeals 3000 damage per hithas a 20% chance to dodge your attacks
There will be 20 Magma Zombies, 15 Magma Cubes, and 10 Magma Grunts





Spoiler: Layer 3




[Lvl 35] Magma Skeletons25000 healthDeals 4000 damage per hitHas a 20% chance to strike twice

[Lvl 35] Magma Soldiers30000 healthDeals 3400 damage per hit30% chance to dodge your attacks, 20% magic and projectile resistance
There will be 20 Magma Grunts, 15 Magma Skeletons, and 15 Magma Soldiers





Spoiler: Layer 4




[Lvl 40] Magma Masters95000 healthdeals 7000 damage per hit50% chance to dodge your attacks and 30% chance to strike twice, 25% magic and projectile resistance
There will be 50 Magma Soldiers, 50 Magma Skeletons, and 30 Magma Masters.





Spoiler: Layer 5




[Lvl 100] Magma Lord7000000 healthdeals 15000 damage per hitHas a 50% chance to dodge your attacks and a 50% chance to strike twice, 50% magic and 30% projectile resistanceIs the boss of the volcano
There will be 1 Magma Lord.
On your fifth time defeating him, he will drop the Magma Core.




After you get this, you won't be able to get it again.


Once you make it out of the volcano, you will be rewarded with the Volcano Talisman.




You can complete the volcano however many times you want, and the prize will be 100k at the end. However each time you reenter the volcano, all the mob's stats are buffed by 3%.



► The Infested Jungle
@M00N will take over from me here. The following is written by him(although formatted by me, screenshots also provided by me):

Welcome to the Infested Jungle, you can explore the temple, but watch out for the monsters!


Spoiler: Mobs




[Lvl 75] Creepy Critters50k Health500 DPSDescription: A silverfish that can climb walls. They spawn on top of the trees and will fall down onto players. They do swarm you so they can get a little deadly for unsuspecting players. (for example, if there are 5 on you, which would be pretty common, it would deal 2.5k dps. This isn't bad, but its still annoying.

[Lvl 100] Jungle Creeper125k HealthWhen near you for 2 seconds, explode for 15k DamageSpecial Passive: explode when their health reaches 0
Extra Ability: After exploding, spawn 5 creeper critters

[Lvl 200] Angry Archeologist50k Health500 DPSPassive: take 90% less damage
Extra Passive: Throws healing potions at itself after 5 secs, healing for 50% of its max health, 30%, 15%, 5%, then it will no longer heal.Description: It's your pal, the angry archeologist from dungeons that takes 9 years to kill!

[Lvl 150] Motherload Spiders50k Health2500 DPSAbility: spawn 20 Creepy Critters on deathDescription: These spiders are freakishly annoying and creepy.

[Lvl 300] Dead Assassin1 Million HealthPassive: Take 50% less damage
Ability: Strafes around you a lotShoots an arrow at you every 3-5 seconds dealing 10k damage.

[Lvl 300] Deathbringer Tiger1.5 Million Health3k Damage, hits 2 times a second, has a 50% chance of striking twice for an estimated 9k DPSPassive: Strafes around you a lot and has immunity to knockback.
Extra Passive: Will eat your voodoo doll if you try to use it on him.






Spoiler: Loot







^ Drops from Motherload Spiders




^ Dropped by various mobs in the jungle




^ recipe:

64 Tarantula Silk64 jungle Essense64 Tarantula Silk64 jungle Essense64 Tarantula Silk64 jungle Essense




^ 1% chance to drop from Deathbringer Tigers




^ Recipe:

64 Enchanted Blaze PowderDeathbringer Teeth64 Enchanted Blaze Powder64 Enchanted Blaze PowderDeathbringer Teeth64 Enchanted Blaze Powder64 Enchanted Blaze Powder64 Enchanted Quartz Blocks64 Enchanted Blaze Powder




^ 1% chance to drop from Dead Assassins




^ Recipe:

64 Tarantula SilkAssassin Core64 Tarantula SilkAssassin Core64 Tarantula SilkAssassin Core

Each of these items can be converted into a dungeon item and 5 starred using Spider Essense
Infested Bow:
Turn to dungeon item: 500
1 star: 50
2 star: 100
3 star: 150
4 star: 200
5 star: 250

Deathbringer Fang:
Turn to dungeon item: 1000
1 star: 100
2 star: 150
3 star: 300
4 star: 600
5 star: 800

Assassins Bow:
Turn to dungeon item: 700
1 star: 150
2 star: 250
3 star: 350
4 star: 450
5 star: 550





Spoiler:  The Temple



The temple will have a pit leading down into a huge ravine. In the ravine, there are a couple of unique features: Inside the ravine, you will have permanent blindness 1! Also, the more you go down the ravine, the more dangerous mobs there are. Since there are no stairs/any way down besides jumping down, it is best to have some sort of flight ability (for example, tara boots or spirit boots to be able to maneuver around and not die from fall damage ) Each mob will stack to its own level.


Spoiler: Mobs



Mobs that spawn are dependent on the y level. The start is on y level 50, and the lowest point is y level 1.

[Lvl 45] Toxic BatTop of ravine stats: 10k health, will bite you dealing 50 true damage. These bites will also infect you with poison, dealing 1000 damage per second lasting 3 seconds.Bottom of ravine stats: 50k health, will bite you dealing 250 true damage. These bites will also infect you with poison dealing 2000 damage per second for 3 seconds.Description: these spawn in the edges of the ravine. You should be fine as long as you stick to the middle of the ravine. They will try to sneak up on you and bite youSpawns in all y levels

[Lvl 100] Flying DemonTop of ravine stats: 100k health, will shoot fireballs at you dealing 2k damage.Bottom of ravine stats: 250k health, will shoot fireballs at you dealing 5k damage.Description: These are common spawns and there will be a lot of them. As the name says, they can fly. They move at the speed of a normal player sprinting meaning you can outrun them. Sadly, they are everywhere, meaning NO ESCAPE!Spawns in all y levels

[Lvl 200] PhantomMiddle of ravine stats: 500k health, will attempt to melee you, dealing 5k damage and freezing you for 1 sec leaving you unable to move or attack or use abilities.Bottom of ravine stats: 1million health, will attempt to melee you dealing 10k damage and freezing you for 1 sec, leaving you unable to move or attack or use abilities.Description: They attack once every 1.25 secs, leaving you a small period of time to escape using an AOTE or similar. If you fail to do so, you will probably get trapped in a loop and die. Other mobs will also swarm you (mainly flying demons), causing getting hit by these to be near-certain death. Thankfully, they only spawn in the middle to bottom of the ravineSpawns in y levels 0-25

[Lvl 150] Void SpiderTop of ravine stats: 75k health, 3k damage. 20% Magic ResistanceBottom of ravine stats: 200k health, 8k damage 40% Magic ResistanceDescription: these spiders infest every single space of block you can see, if you even attempt to land anywhere, you will be swarmed by them. It is suggested to use a spirit scepter to clear them.Spawns in all y levels

[Lvl 500] Giant Void Spider Alpha5 million health, will shoot poison out dealing 200 true damage per sec, shoots spider web out dealing 5k damage and getting you stuck. Melee hits from giant void spider alpha will deal 30k damage. 70% Magic ResistanceThis is the final boss of the infested jungle, The loot is distributed like other boss loot, and after it's death, the ravine will be clear and safe for 5 minutes, allowing relatively weak players to do whatever there.Spawns every 2 hours in y level 0-5






Spoiler: Loot







^ Toxic bat: drops 5(top level) - 10 (bottom level)
Flying demon: drops 1 (top level) - 3 (bottom level)
Phantom: drops 10 (top level)-15 (bottom level)
Void spider: drops 1 (top level) - 2 (bottom level)
Giant void spider alpha: depends on damage placement, can get from 32 - 480




^ uses 160 Creepy Pearls




^ Uses 160 True Pearls




^Recipe:

16 Enchanted True Pearls16 Enchanted True PearlsAspect of the End




^ 10%-20%(depending on what level of ravine) chance to drop from flying demons




^0.1% chance to drop from flying demons




^ 1% chance to drop from void spiders
Can get 0-4 of these depending on your placement for the Giant Void Spider Alpha




^Can get 0-1 from Giant Void Spider Alpha depending on placement




^This is a legendary talisman that has a 0.04% chance of dropping from a Giant Void Spider Alpha






► The Beach
Welcome to the Beach! Besides a place to chill and play with the waves, there are lots of things to do with rewards!


Spoiler: New Questline



Isabelle is going to offer swimming lessons!

However there is a price, she wants "the finest tea on this island".
Once you retrieve that, the lesson will start, and you will be given the "Beginner Token of the Sea."




She needs you to retrieve swimming gear in case you drown.
Once you retrieve it, she will be most pleased with you. Your talisman will be upgraded to "Novice Token of the Sea."




Isabelle wants to test your bravery since the waters are dangerous. She wants you to retrieve a pearl from the darkest part of the island.
Once you retrieve it, your talisman is upgraded to "Intermediate Token of the Sea."




Isabelle warns you there are dangerous mobs in the sea, and wants to see if you are up to the task of surviving. She wants the eggs of a spider.
Once you retrieve it, your talisman will be upgraded to "Refined Token of the Sea."




Isabelle warns you that in the waters, it is extremely dark, and tests you to find the eyes of the spider that lies in the darkest depths.
After that, the talisman will be upgraded to "Advanced Token of the Sea."




Isabelle still feels you are not ready for the monsters that lie in the deep, she wants you to retrieve the core of a dangerous Assassin.
After that, your talisman will be upgraded to "Expert Token of the Sea."




Isabelle is feeling thirsty, and wants the drink with "all the fruits".
After that, your talisman will be upgraded to "Master Token of the Sea."




Isabelle now wants you to retrieve the core of a volcano.
After that, your talisman will be upgraded to "Splendid Token of the Sea."

 


As a final test, Isabelle wants you to get a bow that is infested with bugs.
Once you do that, your talisman will be upgraded to "Champion of the Sea."









Spoiler: Scavenger Hunt



Meet Faith! She is a retired mayor chilling on the beach. In her spare time, she has created a scavenger hunt full of items for you to find! Every hour, there will be an event that spawns 200 items randomly on the beach. All items despawn after 5 minutes.


Spoiler: Items



Sea Shells are the most common. You can get 2-4 per find.




There is a 0.5% chance you can find a crab pet, which is the main pet for this hunt.

[Lvl 100] Crab PetCrit Damage: 50
Intelligence: 25​Sharp Claws
Increases your damage by 10%.​8 Legs
Every 100 strength gain 1 speed and speed cap.​Dig
All common and uncommon rarity loot you get from the Scavenger Hunt is doubled.​

@M00N will take over from me here. The following is written by him(although formatted by me, screenshots also provided by me[map made by Moon]):

The underwater caves are a series of huge caves that are completely underwater. You need to have the Champion of the Sea Talisman to survive this. Here is a map of the caves:





Upon entering the underwater caves, there would be two paths. One leads to the Sea Temple/Entrance to the great Sea Chambers. There are no mobs here at the entrance.


Spoiler: The Fisherman's Cove



The fisherman’s cove would be a spot to fish. Fishing here will grant you 5% more sea creature chance, 10% more fishing speed, and there will be 3 new sea creatures you can fish up here.

title: Compact enchantment gives the bonus xp on mining minions.
body: I had previously thought that it was the magnetic reforge, but after doing some simple math it turns out I was wrong, however, the compact enchantment at level 10 increases mining xp by 10%, this works while you are collecting minions if you hold the pickaxe. I apologize for my previous assumption, but I have done extensive research now and the compact enchantment does in-fact increase mining minion xp.

title: [STORY] The Origin of Zealots, a collab with TheLapisSub01
body:
Disclaimer: This is purely a story and isn't part of any official in-game lore.
Disclaimer 2: This story does not contain any sorts of NSFW whether that be nudity/cursing/blood/gore/death. 

The Origin of Zealots
A 3,200 word story by SpyderMC and @TheLapisSub01 

This story is dedicated to @EnderLordEX as a thank you gift for accepting me and Sub01 into the lore nerds.


Spoiler: Chapter 1 - The Beginning



Long ago, “The End” was a beautiful place. Grasslands and plains greener than imaginable. The lush scenery of plants filled the world.

Everywhere you looked, you could see beautiful colors everywhere. But, everything changed when the admins arrived.

“Hey, Zeal!” I called out to my friend. “Where ya heading?”

“Not anywhere, in particular, just going to explore New Plain City,” he said.

I am known as Humphrey the Enderman. I live in the wonderful town of Plain City. Well, it’s not a city. Plain City is the oldest and most sacred village throughout the world. It is ancient to the point where it was built even before my Grandpa Ernest was born! Recently, my dad and his construction workers have been building another city that is named: “New Plain City”, in honor of Plain City.

I lived under the same roof with Zeal, my childhood friend! His parents were kidnapped when he was born so my parents took him under their wing and adopted him. Although Zeal is shorter than me, he is way older and weaker. Compared to him, it makes me realize how short I am for my age...

Well, for today, Zeal told me that he is going to find a job in New Plain City. I don’t know if he will be able to find one because all the jobs are construction jobs. Mainly for the strong endermen.

“You want me to come along? After all, it’s your first job!”

“Yea sure, you can follow me,” said Zeal.





Spoiler: Chapter 2 - Expansion



“Are we ready to begin Operation 45 6e 64 65 72 6d 61 6e?” a voice said.

“Brother, I told you, we cannot rush the operation, because one small minuscule detail will render the portal useless...” said another voice

“Grrr, just hurry up, we don’t have all day.” said the first voice impatiently.

“Okay! Okay! I’m trying to get everything in commission as fast as possible so just shut your rainbow-colored mouth and keep still!”

BOOOOM!!

“It worked! IT WORKED!!” cried the first voice.

“Go go go! Just step inside the glowing ring and the portal will take us wherever we want to go.” yelled the second voice.

“Ehehehe… AHAHAHA! Operation 45 6e 64 65 72 6d 61 6e is now a success! ”
“HQ did you copy? I repeat, Operation 45 6e 64 65 72 6d 61 6e is a success!”

A whisper could be heard from the radio…

“Yes... We did. Hmmm? You said reports of strange purple insects?”

“Ahaha! Sanitize the insects! Sanitize it!” the 2nd voice cackled.

This day was known as: “The Infiltration of The Portal”

“Wait, and there’s more?” questioned the 3rd voice.

The radio now could be heard announcing to the team:
“Next objective: Project Coloniam Deductam”





Spoiler: Chapter 3 - The Abduction



As I walked with Zeal to New Plain City, a sense of dread fell upon me.
All of my dad’s workers were gone. The noisy work in progress city was dead silent.

“Something weird is happening,” I said.

“Hmm?” mumbled Zeal as he kept on walking towards the city.

“There are no workers here and I get the feeling someone is watching us.”

I turned around and took a look at my surroundings. Even without workers, New Plain City was an ultramodern city with functions I could only dream existed. Their underground tunnels connected every building, with houses twice the size of mine, and even floating gardens. New Plain City would become the greatest city that ever existed and would serve as a huge marketplace and entertainment area.

While I was busy daydreaming, Zeal decided to head another way.

“Humphrey! Humphrey! Are you even listening? I’m gonna go explore and see what places I can work at!” snapped Zeal.

I was fine with this as it meant I could investigate more on a mysterious phenomenon that I felt not too long ago. I headed over to what seemed like a park when suddenly, I heard a cry.

“Help! Somebody help! I’m getti--” and then the voice was silent.

I ran over to where the voice was and saw two strange men in black suits and masks. One was holding a hand over Zeal’s mouth and the other was grabbing his hands and tying them behind his back.

“Hey! Let go of my friend! You’ve made a big mistake coming here!” I yelled.

The two men looked at each other then nodded their heads in agreement and escaped. Haphazardly, the shorter man tripped over a wood bar and dropped to the floor. I took this opportunity and dove at him, ripping his mask and suit off.

One of the men punched me in the face knocking me to the ground. I groaned.

“Zeal?”

I saw out of the corner of my eye that the two men had taken Zeal and were running away. Although I didn’t know it at the time, that would be the last time I would see Zeal.





Spoiler: Chapter 4 - Lockdown



“He’s WHAT?” said my panicking father.
“We need to find these men right away! I will talk to the town elder and we will see what to do about this.”

I had just explained to my parents what happened to Zeal and the two men. My father was confident we could find the two men while my mother wept in her chair.

“H-h-he’s gone?” stammered my mother, not being able to handle the situation.
“He was like a brother to you, not to mention your best friend. As your father said, we definitely must speak with the town Elder.”

“I’ll go with you,” I said volunteering.

“No no, you must stay home and protect the village,” replied my father.

“I was there when it happened so I need to be there with you to explain it!”

“Very well, we shall take you with us to the Elder.” said my mother, wiping a tear from her eye.

We stepped out of our house and walked across to the other side of town to the Elder’s house.

*Knock knock knock*

*A door could be heard being opened.*

“I know what happened last night.” the Elder stated.

“But, how? You weren’t there,” I said, confusingly.

“I know a lot and I see a lot, which is why I am the Town Elder,” she said.

The Elder then asked me to leave and spoke with my parents privately.

After waiting a while, my parents came out of the building. They told me that the Elder had started a lockdown and curfew. From now on, we would have to stay inside the house for 1 hour after dusk. We could also only go outside if it was an emergency. Guards were surrounding the vicinity of the residency to establish security.

I grumbled at the news of this but I knew it was for the best.

At dusk, I went inside the house and sat down reminiscing about the series of events that led up to this moment. If only I had stayed with Zeal moments before he was kidnapped...

*KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK!*

There was a series of knocks at the door.

I was confused because there should’ve been guards out there. I slowly opened the door and right when I could see through the gap between the door, two sets of hands grabbed me and pulled me outside. It was the two men. I cried out in pain as they twisted my arm.

The man with the visor covered my mouth, preventing any sound from escaping. The last thing I saw before passing out was the guard in front of our house, with his shattered helmet and his limp body.





Spoiler: Chapter 5 - Camp



I woke up in a dark room with my legs and arms bound. My vision was hazy.

Where am I? I thought.

Then I recalled what had happened.

I was dragged away by 2 people in white suits. Zeal was taken on the same day. All the construction workers were gone. There was a lockdown. All these thoughts rushed to my head, as a person came approaching me.

“Let me go! Where’s Zeal?!” I demanded.

“Zeal... Hmmm, isn’t that the guy that we took at the construction site?” he said, turning around.

“Apparently...” replied the man with the visor and white suit.

The men walked around and inspected me.
They poked at my small arms with a stick. I flinched every time they got near my neck.

“He’s just like the other one,” the second man stated.

They unbound my arms and pinned them behind my back. Then with a *click*, they locked my hands together with strange black material. They forced me to walk into a room with bars surrounding it. After locking me in, they strolled away.

They started speaking and I pressed my ear against the wall. I made out only a few words.

“invade….population...Plain”

I stopped at that. Population, invasion, Plain, then something in my head clicked. They were going to invade Plain City! Oh no, this was bad. Really Bad.





Spoiler: Chapter 6 - The Invasion



I peeked out of my cell and saw hundreds of soldiers marching outside the window.
Many of them seemed to wield diamond hoes. They also wore diamond chest plates and boots. Every step sounded like a thousand explosions and my ears were ringing.

“Surrender now or face our wrath, we will not hold back!” they chanted, “Surrender now or face our wrath, we will not hold back!”

It was almost like they were made to only say that. After a while, my ears blocked out the chants. If this army was going to invade Plain City, the guards there stood no chance.

I knew that something must be done.
What was the point of staying in my cell and wasting my time?

Wait, they haven’t emptied my pockets.
I remembered that I brought my pencil for note-taking like usual.
It seems like there is a lock as well, securing the door to my cell!

Without any hesitation, I attempted to pick the lock, with little hopes of unlocking it.

Click!

I never imagined that a pencil would be successful in unlocking a lock.

The security alarms rang.
“Stop right there, prisoner!”

I paid them no attention as the last of the soldiers advanced through the building and into the plains.

“I have to run...” I thought to myself…

I must warn Plain City... 
I must make haste…

However, as I ran through the prison, I noticed some strange incubators.

There was a sign that read: ”Project 45 6e 64 65 72 6d 61 6e”

Among the tanks, a person just like me was incubated…

I shuddered at the thought of me becoming like the person…

I tried to hide as a phone in a nearby room rang.

“Yes? I see. We shall begin the operation. Prepare the Mass Transit System now.”

Have they already arrived at Plain City?
How do they even cover such a long distance in a short period?

Heavy footsteps resounded out of the room.
The person in a white suit with a helmet walked out the room and towards the exit, carrying a radio...

I heard him cackling while answering the radio saying:
“Ahahaha! Start the Mass Transit System.”

I watched in horror as the sky turned purple.

He noticed me and with an evil laugh said:
“You see boy, you can’t prevent this. After all, it's for the sake of our race and improving the sanitary conditions of our brethren.”

As he concluded his sentence, a deep tremoring sound echoed through the air.

And with a zap, the whole city disappeared.





Spoiler: Chapter 7 - Operation 45 6e 64 65 72 6d 61 6e



After Plain City disappeared, I was traumatized. What happened to everyone and everything inside of it? Were they dead? What about my parents? And the town Elder! I collapsed to the ground in a sob.

“Now let’s get you back to your cell,” said the man as he grabbed me by my arm and dragged me back to my cell, “and this time we’ll search you.”

This time, I didn’t fight back. I couldn’t, I felt paralyzed. After seeing my home get erased from existence, I had no energy. I only felt sadness and grief.

They locked me into my cell again but this time, they took all my belongings and burned them. They also put a guard in front of my cell to make sure I didn’t escape.

After the second day, I lost track of time and everything began to blend. My sight became fuzzy and I became light-headed.

Then, the guard said something that surprised me.

“The master wishes to talk to you,” he said in a scraggly voice.

He walked into my cell and tied my hands together again with the black material and walked me into a room with all black walls. There was a very grand dark oak table and at the very end sat a man wearing the white suit and helmet.

“Tell me, have you heard about Operation 45 6e 64 65 72 6d 61 6e?” he asked.

“Uhhh, no what’s that?” I lied.

“Do you think I’m that stupid? I can tell when you’re lying,” he said.

“Anyway, Operation 45 6e 64 65 72 61 6e is about rebuilding that wretched town, the one you guys call Plain City, and reconstructing the species of endermen!” he said, an evil smile across his face.

“You see, we’ve already started the process and there's nothing you can do to stop it!”

“You’ve seen those incubator tanks, you’ve seen the endermen floating inside of them. Those hideous excuses for endermen are going to be changed, transformed into a bigger, stronger, and more powerful species,” he said.

He walked over to the other side of the table where I sat, grabbed my neck, and dragged me with him. I could barely breathe. He brought me to a room with a bunch of strange redstone devices and looked me in the eye.

“You see this? This is how we are going to change your species, your pathetic species will be reborn, rebuilt, and remade into the strongest beings the world has ever seen!”

“Brother!” another voice called from across the hallway, “Where are you? Oh there you are, I see you are giving our “guest” a tour.”

“Quiet fool, leave me alone,” the man with the helmet said.

“Where are my parents, where is my family, WHERE IS THE REST OF PLAIN CITY?” I shouted.

“I knew you were going to say that,” he said, “Come, follow me.”

He brought me down a flight of stairs and led me into a dark hallway. There were dozens if not hundreds of rooms, each of them with an iron door and a guard guarding them. In each cell was someone from Plain City. I saw them stare at me with tears, begging for me to rescue them but we all knew there was nothing I could do.

My hands were still bound behind my back and even if they weren’t, the guards outnumbered me 50 to 1. The man then led me back up the stairs into the room with the incubation chambers.

“Once these endermen come in contact with oxygen, they will begin the evolution process and become enhanced endermen!” he said with a cackle.

Then, he opened one of the tanks full of green liquid. Surprisingly, the liquid didn’t flow out like other liquids. The enderman inside of the tank stumbled out with a dazed look.

“Where am-,” he paused and fell.

“Is he okay?” I said.

“Oh don’t worry, he’s fine, my state of the art scientists perfected the formula a thousand times!” he boasted.

Then, the enderman stood up straight and his limbs began to grow. His arms doubled and his height tripled. He seems a lot bulkier than before.

The former enderman kneeled and said in a monotone voice, “It is my pleasure to serve you, O Great One.”

“Rise,” said the man in the white suit, “so I may take a better look at you.”

The enderman stood up and walked closer. Then, the man in the white suit grabbed my arm and compared it to the other enderman’s. His arm was like a steel bar while mine was like a noodle.

“Now, we shall repeat this process and make every enderman better!” he said.

I heard the sound of liquids rushing in and people screaming. My brethren! I ripped myself out of his grip and went dashing towards the room that held the people of Plain City.

It was too late.

By the time I got there, several rooms were filled with a green liquid and they didn’t seem to be able to break free. A tear rolled down my face as guards ran up to me and tackled me to the ground.





Spoiler: Chapter 8 - The Origin of Zealots



Error! Error! Error!

An alarm blared as the rooms got full of the liquid,

Error! Error! Problem X93nk2! Initiating self-destruction sequence!

“Nooooo!” cried the man in the white suit.
He fell to his knees clenching his suit, “You, you ruined everything!”

I would’ve felt pretty happy if it weren’t for the fact that the alarm said “Initiating self-destruction sequence!” I looked over and saw a blinking red light.

BOOM!

In every room, there was an explosion and the force knocked everyone down. The whole facility was on fire and it was a mad dash to escape. I kicked some of the guards in the face and ran out of the building. With the sight of this scene, I cried.

My family, my friends, everyone I knew, they’re all gone, killed by the explosion...

Suddenly, I heard a growl. It was the man in the white suit’s brother. He gripped a sword so hard I thought it might break.

“You monster! You destroyed the facility, killed your town, and ruined my brother’s entire career!” he snarled.

“What? No that’s not what happened,” I said but he wasn’t listening.

He slashed me with his sword. He stabbed and swung his sword like a madman. The blade grazed my arm and almost hit my shoulder as I attempted to dodge the strike. I winced in pain.

I grabbed a nearby stick and attempted to block some of his attacks. The stick was broken in the process but I was able to surprise him by hurling the remains of the stick and started to climb the tree. In confusion, he climbed after me.

I jumped off and landed right on him. One could agree that it was a risky move as I almost skewered myself. I knocked him off the tree and snatched his sword along the way. After making sure he was unconscious, I escaped with the sword in my hand.

This tale is perhaps, a mystery, or even a tragedy.
And with that, I conclude with a farewell...





Spoiler: Afterwards



And that my friends, is the origin of zealots. I decided to name them Zealots after my friend Zeal, one of the first stolen. Those few days still haunt me to this day but I have learned that the past is the past and there is no point in groveling for my city my ENTIRE life.



Thank you guys for reading this story! You might've been able to catch some Easter Eggs within the story. If you didn't notice them, they are in the spoiler below.


Spoiler: Easter Eggs



1. Operation 45 6e 64 65 72 6d 61 6e is hexadecimal for Operation Enderman
2. The two characters that we have not been told the names of are actually Minikloon and Dctr. The main hint that the 1st character was Minikloon is when the 2nd character says "Shut your rainbow-colored mouth" which is a nod at Minikloon's skin. The main hint for Dctr wasn't so simple. We mentioned that the 2nd character, Dctr wanted to "sanatize" the insects. Also, we said that he had a helmet and Dctr's minecraft skin is an astronaut with, you guessed it, a helmet.

title: Underrated Skyblock Forum User Shoutouts
body:
Underrated Skyblock Forum User Shoutouts
Self-explanatory, a list of underrated forum users and why I think they're good.

These are in no particular order.


@AShinyGiratina One of the best-known 2019 forums users. A pokemon fan and very active and nice user in general. They never ****posted and were always contributive.@Zhirst One of the best-known 2019 forums users, as well as an active current user. They reply with humorous comments to posts. They do not ****post or postfarm, and they try to help others when possible.@notnotmelonOne of the very first well-known forums users. They are the creator of one of the very first talisman optimizer bots in skyblock. Obviously, this makes them an extremely talented programmer as well as a helpful member of the community.@CosoTM Talented idea thread maker. Well-known for a high-effort thread which unfortunately was moved to the ideas and feedback section. Continues making ideas which are intriguing to read.@ImFr0st Talented idea thread maker. They do not excessively bump their posts after the thread has been seen by a majority of regular forums users. All of their ideas are original and intruiguing. They are also known as the founder of the Hypixel Non Patrol.@rm_rf_slash Hardcore slayer grinder. Known for being the go-to melon minion expert as well as upgrading their poor overflux orb into a plasmaflux (although I did not let the latter affect the scoring). They are a very nice person in general.@MrBoron Talented idea thread maker. Known partially for owning the Boomicial Minecraft account as well as THIS extremely effortful thread, a massive collection of ideas and suggestions.@Mightykloon Talented idea thread maker. Known for making high-effort and surprisingly realistic suggestion threads. They are the owner of Skyblock Sandbox server, in which many people can create custom items to help their ideas come true.@ticklesTalented idea thread maker and gifted builder. Known for extremely high-effort slayer idea threads among many others. They are also extremely nice and supportive, and give advice to whoever needs it.@roseywolfgirl Obsessed with Scarf (the dungeon boss). Consistently makes humorous and entertaining posts. They are also a very nice user in general.@Flameicle Replies with humorous comments to posts yet they do not ****post or postfarm, and they try to help others when possible. Also has a very nice profile picture, Link Dio.@SoshJam They are extremely nice and supportive, and give advice to whoever needs it. Also on the redstone collection leaderboards.@MeltedMagma Very well-progressed player who knows what they are talking about. An experienced user who is knowledgeable about the game and willing to help others.@Thomas9072 A high level player who knows what they are talking about. They consistently and selflessly give advice and guidance on the forums.@The99thTroll Talented idea thread maker. Not especially known for their idea threads in particular, but for being an extremely nice person in general. They selflessly give out positive reactions in their threads as well. Somewhat known as a Splatoon fan.

That's all.
This is an alt account so none of your opinions matter, so don't bother replying.
If you weren't on the list, you are either overrated or irrelevant.
Just joking, but these are the ones who came to mind first.

Oh, who am I kidding?
Everyone is human and thus everyone is a terrible being, whether on this list or not. Have a nice day.

title: The "You spawn it. You get it." initiative (IMPORTANT) (PLEASE READ) (+180 Positive reactions!)
body:
Disclaimer: if you're wondering about boss trading please read the entire thread as I address this issue


Don't you love it when a huge crowd of nons in unstable crowd your broodfather and steal all the combat XP you literally just paid for
or when someone kills the special zealot you spawned after 1500 zealot kills.
The list goes on and on...

I sure don't. And I hope people find it annoying also

This is why I'm suggesting the completely optional "You spawn it. You get it" initiative. This setting, toggleable in the skyblock menu, completely prevents anyone from attacking the mob that you spawned, fished, whatever it may be. This allows you to:
1. Secure all the drops through telekinesis which eliminates having to hope your mob was stolen near you
2. Stops all stealing of combat XP from slayer bosses and their minibosses (probably even worse!), an issue I've seen many, many times in the spider's den. It's crazy to me how people can steal the combat XP you literally just paid for.
3. Gives you the satisfaction of that potential rare drop jingle, whether that be from a special zealot or powerful mob.

This option will be in the settings menu of the skyblock menu. It is completely optional as people may want help with beating a t4 boss for example. And that's completely fine. However, I think this addition will give many players, like me, the independence they so long for as well as getting rid of the issues I mentioned previously

Thanks for reading, if you disagree please let me know your thoughts.

title: I think the lonely philosopher is a furry.
body:
Screenshot


Captured with Lightshot




prnt.sc





Look at this person. 

Lets analyze whether or not they are a furry.

1: Loneliness: Being a furry has a lot to do with the amount of time you spend online, and your willingness to stand out. Given that he is a philsopher who is also lonely, I think it is safe to say that this person is extremely introverted. Introverts who spend a lot of time on the internet often are furries, so that is one point. 

2: Location: The most suspect piece of this puzzle that is the location of which the lonely philosopher chooses to reside. He lives in a tower of the ruins, however, it is suspect because of the sheer number of dogs living in the castle. And while it might be just because of the fantastic setting for thinkin gin the castle, you have to love dogs to live with them, and as a furry myself, I have to say that that is completely true. 

3: Choice of profession: The philosopher contemplates life for a living, and often those of whom choose to think end up in strange states. Perhaps that is why the lonely philosopher is there, contemplating life. He is a furry, and he loves it.

I have taken an elective of psychology last year, and with all the knowledge that I accumalated over those 5 classes, I believe that it is safe to assume that the lonely philosopher is a furry.

title: Why The Devs Were Wrong To Disable Sapling Placement. (60 positive reactions)
body:
As some of you may know, there has been a foraging method going around that allowed you to plant trees on your island and make up to a million foraging exp an hour. It involved placing saplings with a builder's wand and then farming the trees that grew.
Today, many of us awoke to see this message.




This was an unfair removal.
The builders wand did everything it was supposed to. Placing saplings was an intended feature.

Unlike Ghast Farming, which was macroable, this was not. It took effort to build the farm, plant, and destroy the trees. I see no reason for the admins to remove this as it is has pretty much the exactly the same effect as a Replenish enchanted hoe had on farming.

Bring back Sapling Placement.

Edit: I'm going to try to spread this as much as possible so there's a bigger possibility admins can see.
My message to admins: Please consider reversing your shadow nerf on sapling placement, it harms more people than you think, it invalidates hours of effort. A nerf would be better received.

Edit two: I'm going to add suggestions for nerfs here so that maybe admins will reconsider adding it!
@Sir_Bacon_2020 suggested to keep it in the game, but nerf the exp gain.
@Kashapo suggested to not nerf the exp, but instead make the saplings grow slower.
@Athyestic suggested that the trees grow according to the Terraria rules, such as: " There must be at least three open tiles between two Saplings or only one will grow into a tree. " so that there are not as many trees.

title: Why would admins NERF farming so hard in a farming update
body:
I think many players are enjoying the new farming event rn. But do you know that farming actually get nerfed so hard after the event is released?

So from the patch notes, admins changed all the farming bonus from multiplicative to additive. And this change is an INSANE nerf assume that all bonuses are multiplicative before.

Quick comparison here. For a maxed farming player b4 the patch, the max crop multiplier is 300%(farming 50) * 162.5%(harvesting 5) *125%(leg elephant) = 609.375% around 610% here(blessed reforge was **** b4 so I didn't count it). But for a maxed farming player rn, the max crop multiplier is 3.4(farming 60)+0.625(harvesting 5)+50%(leg elephant)+0.25(turbo V)+1.46(10mil collection tier 3 hoe)=623.5% + 2%*gold medals invested in the new perks.

So the new rate is slightly higher than the old one. But you have to spend tens of millions of coin to upgrade your gears and many hours to grind the extra 10 lvls and 10mil collection to barely surpass the original drop chance. And if you missed any of the new stuff, for example you don't have extra farming lvls, then you would only have 583.5% which is still lower than the original chance even though you have already maxed everything else. An even worse case is that assume someone didn't get anything from the new event. Then his drop chance will be lowered to 3+0.625+0.5 = 4.125 That's like a 30% nerf to drops

Srsly why tf would the admins change the drop mechanism like this

title: [idea] Suggestion to change SA armor's Piece bonuses
body:
Lets look at the old one: Its basically giving strength and speed and stuff after teleportation. Don't get me wrong, its useful, but kinda boring and stuff. 

I'd MUCH rather have it be this: -3 seconds on shadow fury cooldown per piece. IN total, that's -12 second meaning shadow fury cooldown would be 3 secs. HOW COOL WOULD THAT BE? 

I SO want to have 3 sec cooldown shadow fury. 

this is good because 
1. Its Fun, but not too OP. 2bh the shadow fury is really fun to use but it is basically just aote but more automatic lol. To balance being used with livid dagger though, make it so that you can't swap swords anymore. Or make it so you can, either way IDRC 
2. It would make shadow fury more relevant. Now there's a point in getting a more expensive sword than livid dagger that's harder too use and has less dps most of the time! 
3. The old ability messed with mana. If you had SA boots, it would regen 10 mana or something like that. Pretty pog, right? WRONG. IF you used crystal armor to recharge and then swapped to SA, the boots would reset your mana, meaning deleting over 1k mana. BRUH 


IMO This would be really fun, I would love to have 3 sec cooldown shadow fury. <3

title: Dude on my island, how to get rid of them.
body:
Note: I've already talked about how I've been scammed in a previous thread I posted. I want actual answers here, not "Haha L, stupid, that's why I don't have any friends or a social life lmao." Cmon. I trust in your ability to actually read for once.
Previous thread for context: https://hypixel.net/threads/getting-co-op-scammed-it-sucks.3452738/
I accidentally let someone onto my island. I complained on the forums, and some helpful people posted tips on building 2 obsidian boxes(one on default spawn, one for hub portal) and filling it with cave spiders. I thought that worked, until I found this morning that my 2 snow minions are gone, and my storage has been rifled through. Damn.

The problem: They changed their spawn, completely bypassing the obsidian boxes. They also might've bought an intimidation talisman from the market, stopping the cave spiders. They also login during my sleep hours, so me doing a stakeout to find their spawn point is out of the question.

My options, and I don't have much: 
- Block everything with obby. Not permanent, they can just find some way to get a diamond pickaxe and mine right through.
- Put everything into an ender chest. Also not permanent, I need an actual storage
- Get a mod to help. Impossible. Mods are useless.

So that leads me here. I need some help guys. I probably don't have much time until they decide to lavacast my island or something.

title: [SUGGESTION] The Century Cake Hat
body:
Hello, I had the idea of the Century cake hat. So, as most of you know, there is a Simon ncp in the hub giving away Century Cakes for the 100th year of skyblock which give you small buffs but can be useful. So, I had the idea of the century cake hat which, when you collect your buff from the cakes, and you wear the hat, you get double the buffs. (Note: you do not need to wear the hat at all times to get double the buff, only when claiming your cake buff)
Crafting Recipe (I have a few ideas for the recipes):

Crafting idea #1: You have to combine all 9 cakes in the crafting table for the hat

Crafting idea #2 (I like this one the most) : They could add a new item called cake mix which you could have maybe a 1/50 chance of getting from claiming you cakes and you would use 9 to create the hat

Crafting idea #3: This idea is kinda dumb and kinda too late to do but at Simon, there is a chance of getting the hat instead of the cake

Hope you guys like the idea, please tell me what you think

title: Melon Minions
body: I recently logged on after a day's worth of being offline and 3 our of my 25 active melon minions only have little to nothing compared to the other 22 minions. to put in perspective, my 22 minions have each have 70 enchanted melons and 7 enchanted diamonds cause of diamond spreading. The other three only has 1 enchanted melon and like 40 regular diamonds. it was as if they were no longer active once i logged off. I am on a solo profile and just recently changed my minecraft account's password so no one other than myself has access to the account. my other 4 minions seem fine as well. I am having trouble finding the bug reports page to report this for the melon minions but I'm unable to find it at this time. Although this is a minor inconvenience, I don't expect any compensation and all I want is this to be fixed for any future inconvenience for anyone.

title: [x16][1.8.x-1.14.x] Vanilla+ SkyBlock Resource Pack [v1.44] [1,000+ TEXTURES / Dungeon Textures]
body:
​ Features
- 1,000+ Textures!
- Single pack that works in any Hypixel version!
- NEW: Potion textures! (Requires OptiFine L5*)
- NEW: Block textures! (Super Compactor, etc) (Requires OptiFine L5*)
- NEW: First resource pack to have textures for All 7 Dragons!
- Textures for All Melee Weapons and Smite Displays on all them!
- Textures for All Bows!
- Textures for All Armors (and animated Emerald Armor)!
- Textures for All Fishing Rods!
- Textures for All Tools (grappling hook, flint shovel, all sticks...)!
- Textures for All Minion Upgrades and Slots (fuel, upgrades, etc)!
- Textures for All rare books (Growth VI, Dragon Hunter, etc)!
- Textures for All custom SkyBlock items (Crystal Fragment, Day Crystal, etc)!
- Textures for All custom resources (Revenant Flesh, Tarantula Silk, etc)!
- Textures for All custom high level Books! (Vampirism VI, Life Steal IV, etc)
- A bunch of animated textures (Midas' Sword, AotE, Magical Soup, etc)!
- Enchantment and Max Level Enchantment Preview icons in the Enchantment Table!
- Visual enchantment displays for all tools above iron!
- Custom SkyBlock UI!
- Custom Melon/Pumpkin stem colors for grinders!
- 1 easteregg : O
- Even more stuff that you should see for yourself!

For mob textures, check out this mod!

Screenshots





















Pack v1.15 Video Spotlight by AgroMC


Spoiler










More Screenshots


Spoiler































Even More Screenshots


Spoiler



Enchantment Preview icons in the Enchantment Table that also show if the enchantment is at it's max level






Visual enchantment displays for all tools above iron












Custom UI





Textures for All Armor-Set Icons and Models (2 including full growth/thorns/protection Visual Enchantment Displays
Notice how thorns starts getting displayed once you add it:











​


Inspiration


Spoiler



The main idea and one or two textures were inspired by these two other really nice SkyBlock resource packs:
https://hypixel.net/threads/non-official-hypixels-skyblock-resource-pack-pre-release.2125791/
https://hypixel.net/threads/skyblock-resource-pack-fishing-update.2103515/

and thanks to buhpoi for the mention/ideas too
https://hypixel.net/threads/my-hypixel-skyblock-resource-pack.2168924/#post-15904734


Known issues



Spoiler



- Items don't show custom textures while in the 'create auction' slot (really hard to fix)
- Custom textures disappear while any selling NPC screen is open in 1.13
- Most level 6 armor enchants won't be recognized as max level and won't be displayed in the item icon
- Sometimes enchantment displays on item icons won't appear, for some reason?
- Prismarine Blade looks silly in third person in all Minecraft versions except 1.11.x (mostly fixed)
- Custom sword models might not work properly in versions above 1.8.9?
- Java Regex isn't working in 1.14 for some reason. Smells like a bug tbh, but could be just me being bad at 'coding'. This makes stuff like Collection Progress Bar and Midas' Sword only display one texture and look less fancy.


Coming Soon?



Spoiler



The following might or might not be added in near feature:
(Feel free to comment below if you want me to give priority to anything)
- Items that will be added in future updates of SkyBlock
- More visual displays for power on bows?
- More visual displays for enchantments on armor?
- ???


Changelog & Info


Spoiler



List of all vanilla textures changed:
(Unlike CIT (name-based textures for custom SkyBlock items), those should be overridden if you put another resource pack above this one in the Resource Packs menu. This is good so you can intentionally toggle or remove them)


Spoiler



- Health and Mob-food bars
- Pumpkin and Melon stems
- Villager Spawn Egg Color* (color.properties makes villager eggs white so I can color the Jerry Egg :S)
- Mooshroom Spawn Egg Color*
- Water Bottle
- Awkward Potion



Changelog

v1.44-2 (Hotfix/"Coldfix") - Just two fixes or something to show that I'm still alive
- Fixed Treacherous Shredder not casting
- Attempted to make sure Stone Chestplate works because someone complained, but I didnt find the issue. If you're still having it in this version, tell me your mc version and complain below
- Maybe fixed something else pretty tiny, I forgot

v1.44 - Dungeon stuff
- Added most dungeon items from the beta. Does not include dungeons GUI, might or might not be added in the future
- Finished adding Adaptive Armor recently. Adaptive Armor made mostly by @8KCoffeeWizard
- Some bugfixes from the beta. I'm hoping this is stable enough now to be the main version of the pack.
- If this pack doesn't get updated anymore, it means I've quit SkyBlock after it became p2w

v1.43 - Tarantula fix again, GUI improvements
- Fixed Tarantula Armor again
- Added Wardrobe icons
- Added stat icons under Skyblock Menu > Your SkyBlock Profile (your head)
- Added Pet Score Rewards icon
- If I added anything else, I forgot

v1.42 - Fixes, added most missing stuff
- Spent like 1h fixing 3d weapon models in 1.15. (1.8 json models make 0 sense in 1.15 and vice versa. I basically had to remake them from scratch via trial and error)
Thank you, Minecraft compatibility, you're great (no)

v1.07 - Added SkyBlock Menu icon, added Speedster Chestplate (I got lazy and didn't add the rest nor other armor, sorry lol), added Fancy Sword, updated the Enchantment Previews to the new textures with a background
v1.06 - Added Promising tools, Shredder, fixed Spiders' boots, added all minion upgrades including E. Lava Bucket (except block ones that are impossible to add), added all talismans (like Experience Artifact and Crystals)
v1.05 - Random bugfixes and internal improvements, added all fishing rods (crap, I forgot Shredder), Creeper Pants and Spiders' boots
v1.04 - Fixed Magma Leggings icon being different than the model, fixed a major bug with enchantment displays on Lapis and Cactus armor, improved Blaze Chestplate texture
v1.03 - Fixed Execute V not displaying, fixed Magma Bow, added Blaze and Growth armor main textures (enchantments may be added in the future).
v1.02 - Fixed bugs caused by v0.6 SkyBlock and added textures for the new Telekinesis and Hot Potato
v1.01 - Made it actually work in 1.8, lol
v1.0 - Initial Release

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.



www.mediafire.com




> > Download v1.44-2 for OptiFine L6 (or equivalent) < <

IMPORTANT (HOW TO INSTALL and WARNINGS):
- Requires latest OptiFine (with Custom Items and Random Mobs settings turned On)
- Works in ALL Minecraft versions* except 1.15+ due to OptiFine being half-assed. Ignore the warning!
*It will work on 1.15 when/if OptiFine fixes CIT packs. Not on my end.

"BUT MY PACK DOESN'T WORK"
Troubleshooting:


Spoiler



If nothing works on the pack

Ignore the "Incompatible" warning when activating the pack
Make sure you have OptiFine
Make sure you have Custom Items setting On (Video Settings > Quality)
Make sure you have the resource pack in the right side of your resource packs list
If you are on 1.15, that's probably OptiFine's fault for being incomplete in that version
If horses look invisible (Caused by: 1.8.9 OptiFine L5+)

This is a "major" bug in OptiFine L5. Note that this bug causes your MC log files to be pretty big because of the missing texture spam, so you'll want to watch out.
To fix the bug, turn Random Mobs off or downgrade OptiFine to the i7 version. These are the only ways to fix it, sadly.
If items don't work in your hand or similar (Caused by: Orange's 1.7 Animations Mod)

Replace Orange's 1.7 Animations with OldAnimationsMod and/or Fully remove it (disabling won't help)
If blocks/potions look pink&black or are all weirdly colored (Caused by: 1.8.9 OptiFine i7)

If it your potions like this:





Update your OptiFine or download an older version of the pack
If using Badlion or similar (outdated optifine, not compatible with potions), download an older version of the pack
If custom dragons or mobs don't work

Turn the "Random Mobs" setting on
Note an OptiFine bug made me disable custom mobs in the non-i7 version of the resource pack. Might get fixed and re-enabled when optifine updates.
If bows or fishing rods don't pull/cast (Caused by: 1.8.9 OptiFine L5)

Upgrade your OptiFine to L6! Otherwise:
OptiFine bug :c can't do anything to fix it on that OptiFine version
Downgrading your OptiFine will fix it but break custom Blocks and Potions instead
If rods lose their custom texture in third person (Caused by: OptiFine)

All or most versions of OptiFine seem to have this issue. Can't do much, currently. They should still work in first person, at least.
If emissive textures don't work (Caused by: wrong settings OR 1.8.9 OptiFine)

Turn the "Emissive Textures" setting on
1.8 OptiFine also currently does not support those on custom items
If something doesn't work in 1.13+

Might be an actual bug with the pack, 1.13+ hasn't been very tested. Please report, I'm gradually fixing 1.13+.




<My Resource Pack/Spreadsheet's Discord Server if you really want>

title: submerged bat person vs submerged shark scale
body:
so I'm proposing submerged bat person gear for fishing in the spooky festival, because of the ability, submerged bat person would give 2.9SC chance per piece, whereas submerged shark scale gives 3.4SC chance per piece, so shark scale beats bat person on sc chance however bat person gives +5% (or +10 because it says it twice, differently-also idk if its tripled by the event) chance to find candy. this isn't a major advantage however it can still be useful.

however, the main advantage of bat person is that it costs around 1.3m + deep sea orbs, whereas shark scale costs around 20m + deep sea orbs, making bat person much cheaper (even compared to divers which cost around 5.5m)

the one potential downside is that the description for the bat person armour says its tripled while the is a spooky festival, not while the fear mongarer is there, meaning it might not work the whole time spooky fishing is available

title: QOL idea: Inventory "Wardrobe"
body:
I'm sure this idea has been posted multiple times before, and that im not the first person to think of this, but Imma post it anyway 

As many of you know, the "Wardrobe" update came out a few months ago, letting you store armor sets in your nether star, so you could switch armor from anywhere at a click of a button without taking up any space in your inventory or ender chest. Well, I propose to you a most likely not very original idea but still one i want to make people aware about. The Inventory "Wardrobe"! It's the same concept as the wardrobe we currently have, storing armor sets and quickly switching to them without taking up any space, the only difference is that instead of it being armor sets you can switch between, its Inventory Layouts. As said, its the same concept as the armor wardrobe (multiple layouts, you get more depending on your rank), But with the Inventory Layout you get a 3 x 9 grid to place items/tools in, including the 1 x 9 at the bottom (hotbar). The reason i wanted to post this here is because i think it would save a lot of valuable time, as for example, if youre in a dungeon run but you have a mage set up instead of a different class. By a click of a button, youre ready to go, without having to leave a lobby because you maybe forgot an item or two. It could also be good for farm building, if youre tired of running from your island and back to the hub 10,000 times to get dirt, you can fill up your Layouts so it would require many less trips to the hub. (and yes, i know that we just got a farming update which makes it easier to build farms, but the traveling problem still remains)

I hope you agree with me and this idea, and maybe if you share it to someone you know to spread awareness, it may be included in the game.

Thank you for your time 

Edit: If you have any ideas you would like to add to this concept, feel free to comment it

title: [IDEA] Make InfiniDirt Wand work with Builder's Wand
body:
Here's the idea:

Using the builder's wand to make farms is a pain, as you run out of dirt in about 4 seconds.
Recently, the InfiniDirt Wand was added, where you can spend 2 coins to place infinite amounts of dirt.

My Suggestion:
Make it so that when you put the InfiniDirt Wand into the Builder's Wand storage, it has an unlimited supply of dirt and it just slowly drains your purse as you place.
This would make life so much easier, as 95% of the time spent building farms is at the builder NPC, and not at the farm itself.

title: [Maths] How many coins is a technoplane worth?
body:
Well, some background, yesterday night, my technoplane youtooz finally arrived. So, lets see how much it's worth. 

1. How much is a technoplane youtooz worth? 


Spoiler



Checking this website which sells youtoozes and stuff, lets see: https://stockx.com/youtooz-technoplane-vinyl-figure-red-baron 
Last sale is 139 usd, which is approximately 140 dollars. 
"but Mooooon, youtoozes are only 30 dollars!" Well your wrong because they are a limited edition thing which means the prices rise and blah blah blah nerd sh*t, but essentially, your an idiot! (jk jk, ily)


2. How many gems is that? 


Spoiler



So lets see how to do 140 dollars with the biggest amount of bundles: 
100 dollars: 16400 gems 
25 dollars: 3600 gems
10 dollars: 1390 gems 
5 dollars: 675 gems 
That adds up to exactly 140 dollars! 
So lets add up those gems: 22065


3. How many cookies is that? 


Spoiler



One cookie is 325 gems, so how many cookies is that? 
67.89, lets jut say 68





Spoiler: How many coins is that? 



Each cookie is 1,097,608.2 coins according to Stonks.gg rn. Lets multiply that by 68! thats 74,637,357 coins!



So, POGGIES! Nearly 75 million coins, wow

title: Economics of Snow Minions (Updated)
body:
About two weeks ago, I made a thread on the Economics of Snow Minions. Click here to view it. As I am not completely well-versed in Skyblock, I made some mistakes and incorrect assumptions, most notably I assumed that:
- Supply was infinite
- Current prices of snow minions were stable

After making the thread, several people noted that snow minion supply does exist, and that the price of them has been increasing in the recent past. I am making this thread to correct my mistakes and form a better judgment for the future of snow minions.

I made a separate thread because I like to keep the old one as a record and show that I am not perfect and I don't know everything. I plan to make more of these types of threads across different gamemodes, but I will make sure to be more knowledgeable about the game prior to making a post about it.

So without further ado, here is the updated version of the economics of snow minions:



Currently, snow minions are fairly costly, especially for newer players. A tier 1 snow minion typically costs between 500,000 and 700,000 coins when traded between players.

Why is it so expensive?
Because supply is low and demand is high. Supply is low because the only way to create a new snow minion is by receiving it from a gift box. Demand is high because it is a profitable investment, so people want it.

What will happen to its price?
Currently, the price of a snow minion is rising, possibly due to inflation. If inflation is the sole determinant of the rise in price, this means that the real value of the snow minion is still the same. However, inflation on Hypixel is not very high, which I will get to later, so there has to be another factor(s) involved. The only ways to raise real price levels are to increase demand or decrease supply. Supply is definitely increasing because I don't believe many people would be throwing their snow minions into the void. An increase in supply means that the quantity is increasing but the price is decreasing, so demand has to be exceeding supply. If my analysis is correct, demand for snow minions is increasing dramatically, probably because there is a greater supply and people are slowly getting richer, which leads to inflation. This trend will likely continue unless it naturally self-adjusts or the admins introduce fiscal policy.

Self-Adjustment?
In the short run, demand seems to increase faster than supply, moving the entire graph to the right overall, causing an increase in real GDP. However, as time passes, the economy will slowly adjust itself, since the snow minion economy is doing very well. Supply will continue to increase, meaning demand will slow down, since more people will own snow minions.

Fiscal Policy?
Fiscal policy is basically government intervention, or in this case, updates. New updates could cause positive or negative changes for snow minions. If a new minion is added that is better than a snow minion, the snow minion will devalue. If new items are added that are crafted with snow, the snow minion will increase in value, but if new items are added that are not crafted with snow, the snow minion will (potentially) devalue as other minions might increase in value. It is always a good idea to pay attention to updates and new features to understand the change on prices of any item.

What about inflation?
There does seem to be a general increase in the GDP of the server. As players generally become more wealthy, they will be willing to spend more and purchase more prestigious, valuable, and expensive items. This causes the market value of certain normal goods to rise, making it more difficult for newer players to be able to progress. As a result, if the price of a snow minion raises nominally, newer players might not be able to purchase snow minions. This thread explains inflation in Skyblock and the issue surrounding it. He also provides some possible solutions to the inflation issue.

Conclusion
It is hard to tell what will happen to the price of snow minions. There are many ways to look at it, and I only provided a few. This isn't because I'm uneducated and don't know what I'm talking about, but because this is a specific situation being generalized by general economic concepts. Even real-life economists have hard times telling the direction of an economy (such as now during the COVID-19 pandemic) because economic activities are influenced by so many factors, causing it to be very unpredictable. The Skyblock economy does function similarly to a real economy, as it should - it is an economy that will generally follow economic principles and generalizations. I believe that the price of the snow minions will fall by a little bit, but not by much, because the inflation rate does not seem to be high, but it is there. Overall, more people will eventually own snow minions and can cause the depreciation in their value as a whole. My estimate is that a year from now, ceteris parabis, now minions will be worth about the same, more or less, since many factors that can equalize each other are at play.

Note
I might be completely wrong! Snow minions could increase to 2,000,000 coins in a year because of inflation, updates, or other factors. Or, they could depreciate to 100,000 coins because of low demand, updates, or other factors. It is unclear, but it still is an interesting topic worth noting. What do you think about this? Make sure to vote in the poll! Also, do you want me to make more real-life application threads for Skyblock?

title: Panther Armor (something fun for Tanks!)
body:
Plenty of tanks have said that their class needs a re-work. That's surely true. But they also need new items--and, maybe more importantly, *fun* items. 

Every class except tank and healer have some fun items: bonemerangs for archers, flower of truth and livid dagger for berserkers, and, well, almost every new item for mages. But unless I'm mistaken, there's no fun, tank-specific item. SkyBlock needs to change that!

Here's one idea: Panther Armor. (It's a rip-off of Black Panther's skin in the MCU--but SkyBlock has no aversion to borrowing ideas from other universes, so I don't think that should be a problem.

Like Black Panther's skin, the cool thing about Panther Armor is that it stores up energy, up to a certain point, every time its wearer gets hit. When the wearer decides to release this built-up energy, it would do a certain amount of damage to all of the mobs in a five-block radius, divided by the number of mobs in that radius. (If there were five mobs, the total amount of damage would be divided among those five; if there were only one, that mob would receive all the damage. A nice perk for yellow rooms, to take just one example.) 

The damage cap would scale with the wearer's tank class level; as a rough starting point, let's say a level 30 tank could unleash 3m damage, a level 20 tank could unleash 2m damage, and so on. (The alternative would be to have the damage cap scale faster: 1m at level 10, 2m at level 15, 3m at level 20, and so on.) It should do enough damage that other classes immediately begin complaining about the need to balance the tank class. (Needless to say, only tanks should be allowed to wear it.)

I think this would be a fun item for tanks to have, and it fits with their class-specifics (namely, they're the class that takes damage, and they're also a pretty thoughtful, strategically minded class). 

I would be interested to hear what tanks think of this. If nothing else, I would encourage tanks to offer suggestions about what would make their experience more fun!
