title: [Idea] Thanksgiving Mayor (15+ positive reactions)
body:
Let me introduce you to Agate the Thanksgiving Mayor

1. Perk - Black Friday
Every Items from the farmer merchant are 50% cheaper.
(I know that perk is not that good like Farming Minions worke 50% faster but I guess every Mayor needs atleast one crap perk)

2. Perk - Happy Hoe-ing
Double farming Skill xp.

3. Perk - Thangsgiving Feast [Event]
During the Event which takes place for the whole mid-autumn Agate sells Thangsgiving related items like:


Spoiler: Thanksgiving Talisman



You first get the talisman in common an like the Beastmaster Crest you can upgrade it to a higher rarity for a better Donation Bonus [5%/10%/15%/20%/30%]










Spoiler: Agriculturist Hoe



Like the Rod of the Sea your get this Hoe in a lower rarity with less Item Abilities and during the Thanksgiving Feats the Hoe can be upgraded.










Spoiler: Turkey Pet



A combination of the Bat pet and the Flying Fish pet for the Thanksgiving Feast.










Spoiler: Agriculturist Armor



Armor Set for Farmin Skill exp grind.






















Spoiler: Potato Spreading



Like Diamond Spreading but with potatoes in memory of the Great Potato War










Spoiler: Pet Items



Something useful if your Elephant pet is already Level 100






So basically if you give this Item to a Pet it becomes a farming pet in terms of Pet exp gain.










Spoiler: Fertilizer Enchant



Like Expertise for a Hoe










Spoiler: Melon Launcher



Melons > Snowballs







But to buy the Items you need Thanksgiving Tokens which you get when you donate crops to Agate during the Feats. And depending on how many things get donated in total by all players more items unlock in the shop of the Agate. Reaching the Donations Goals for the 7th Dontagen stage should be easily manageable for the community but to reach the 10th Donation Stage the community has to work together.

title: Should essence be added to bazar? (100 positive reactions)
body:
Well I haven’t heard any1 talk about it and I’m surprised, I think it’s a good idea but I’m not sure, also I’m lazy so I’ll just put pros and cons and have you vote.

PROS:

1.Dungeons becomes more profitable.

2.You can’t get scammed by selling.

3.You don’t need lots and can sell the little you have.

4.you can star your gear easier

5. The essence shop will be more usable

idk if you have any thing else I should add tell me.


CONS:
idk


So I saw a few argument and I responded to them, now I’ll copy and paste it here.

I see people saying some stuff and adding some stuff that would be bad. I’ll address them here.

in terms of lowering the price, no. Why?

more people can sell=lower price
More people can buy=higher price

lower price+higher price~same price

but...
Rn you can’t buy essence and use it in dungeons shop, so there for it will ACTUALLY make the prices go up.

Som1 else said you can but yourself through dungeons, no just no.
Firstly you can buy already stared items, but yes it will give you acces to some buffs but then.. honestly you won’t become good at dungeons with catacombs 12 just cuz you have all essence buffs maxed. And by that point you will have spent so much on essence that you will be doing dungeons in unstable.

another good idea multiple people said was having another npc sell it. I think that’s a good idea since essence isn’t a item.

yet another idea som1 said was having it so that you have to obtained the essence, that would also be good cuz then you have to grind, even if it’s a little, at least something to buy.

another of my own ideas is maybe having a catacombs req but each essence.

all these 3 ideas won’t be on bazar but I do think that the box would function similar


Poll:





Poll don’t bump, just vote after reading my thread


https://hypixel.net/threads/should-essence-be-added-to-bazar.3442086/ Read, then vote. please don’t bump this poll. Also I will maybe make a third poll.

title: Guide to Killing Legendary Griffin Mobs
body:
As a follow up to my guide about all of the drops and how to get them, I felt like I should make a guide on how to kill the incredibly difficult Legendary Griffin mobs.

Here is the guide to the drops: https://hypixel.net/threads/all-myt...-40-positive-reactions.3417737/#post-24258730


Here it is!

Gear
Armor: You are going to want to go with a Reaper Mask, and a combination of T12 Perfect and Necromancer Armor.

Sword: There is really only 1 viable sword for this, and that is the Sword of Revelations.

Other Gear: You will want a Manaflux/Overflux Power Orb, an Ornate/Florid Zombie Sword, and a Wand of Restoration.


Mobs
Minos Hunter: This shouldn't be super difficult, just whack it a few times, and it should die pretty easily.

Siamese Lynxes: Same thing, just switch between hitting each Lynx.

Minotaur: Again, same idea. Try to get it into a corner where you can constantly hit it. This might be more difficult, but just use your Power Orb, Zombie Sword, and Wand, and you should be okay.

Gaia Construct: Hit it a few times, and then jump over it, and hit it again. Repeat until it's dead.

Minos Champion: Try to lure it into a corner, and hit it with your Sword of Revelations. Be sure to use your Power Orb, Zombie Sword, and Wand on this one, as it is extremely challenging.

Minos Inquisitor: This I just don't know. Not many people can kill it. You will have to have extremely high skills, lots of talismans, and the best gear possible to even have a chance of killing it. If you are trying to take one down, assemble a team of high tier players, and you might be able to do it. Good luck killing this thing. It is a beast.



Anyway, that's all the tips I can give. I hope this helped!
Good luck out there!​

title: How I (maybe) made your life on skyblock mildly annoyed/inconvenienced
body:
So on one bright day, I'm looking at the bazaar. Now I had just got done watching the video where techno flexes his crystal frags. And i got curious what they were even used for. After a little bit of googling I found that they are used for catalyst, which were going for about 25k a piece. BUT the thing is it was all the way at endstone 9, and crystal frags were going for around 20k a piece. So I get to endstone 9, and then advertise that I'm buying crystal frags (on ah and from adverts), making them into catalysts, and selling them on the bazaar. Now when I started I was the ONLY person doing this from what I could tell. Now this method made me around 2.5-3m and hour if i really tried. Now after like 10 days of doing this, people start to catch on to what I was doing. Then they started to refuse to sell for only 20k, making my method worthless. Then everyone was like "woah, i can make money off of what this dude is doing" and now all your end lobby's are spammed with "BuYiNg CrYsTaL FrAgS 4Ok!" 

TL;DR
I am the frag man
I am sorry

Credit to LlamaBlade for this "I ruined skyblock" idea, this was my version of it though

title: Dungeon Behavior Guide
body:
So i got into dungeons and its pretty cool - from my experience i have gathered some advices:


if u need a carry - look for a queue with s/s+
s/s+ stands for 'safe' - means the people feel safe to carry other players and are happy to do so

to get to know the other players better tell them about ur plans getting cata 14 to use some dungeon item
if u have questions about skyblock - ask them while running - u have some experts at hand - use ur time wisely!
if u cant do a puzzle just try it - the chances are high to solve it!
teleport between players and snatch the secrets - they might miss them without ur help!
its not bad to die in blood room - just stay in there, u will get revived
if u see someone in good gear - tell them they r rich - they need to hear it from others!
send f requests to the other players - so u can talk about the runs later with ur friends
on speed-runs: let the timer in starting room run out without getting ready - ur mates will be thankful for the short break
stand inside the chests at end of run - to show which chest u gonna choose
spam ez at end of run - there are players who dont know about this crazy feature at all!
to get the most xp - choose the highest floor u can get carried for free, most are happy to do a solo run for 4 ghosts
after u got out of a run u have to start a new dungeon asap, dont waste time, errors can be ignored
ask for drops - u will help the others keeping their inv clean
surprise the other players - start a higher/lower floor as written in queue

i know i miss some points but i hope i am helpful

if u have any suggestions just post them

title: My solution to 1.0.0
body:
A lot of people are saying they don't want a reset and some people say they want a reset because then they can progress along with everyone else. My solution to this would be a separate world. Nothing has changed from the old one except everyone starts again on an even playing field without having their progress wiped. So you can switch between the old world and new world as you please. The different worlds have their own AHs Bazaars, leaderboards etc. In order to implement this i think it could be when starting a new profile, you would have an option to select which world you would like to be in or something like that. I think this would be a good solution idk if this has been suggested before I'm not claiming it as an original idea but I haven't seen it. All I've seen is everyone gets wiped or new players are at a disadvantage. 

Edited for clarity

title: New Jungle Dungeon Idea - the Mystical Mountain [MEGATHREAD] - 0.1 (Lore & Entrance Floor)
body:
This is my idea for a potential new dungeon in Skyblock.

Summary

Just how the Catacombs focuses mainly on zombies and skeletons, the Mystical Mountain focuses on spiders, slimes, and plants. Adds a new type of essence, “Magical Essence”. Instead of withers and necromancers, there’s spiders and druids.

New Ophelia Items

The Catacombs has three series of items you can buy from Ophelia: The Healer's helmets, the mage's goggles, and the archer's bows. So for the new dungeon, I felt it was only right to include items for the Tanks and Berserkers out there.



Spoiler: Druid's Mask




Herbalist’s Mask (Entrance)





Agromancer’s Mask (F4)



 

Floramancer‘s Mask (F7)



 

Druid’s Mask (F10)









Spoiler: Cactus' Sword




Cactus’ Thorn (Entrance)



 

Cactus’ Spike (F4)



 

Cactus’ Dagger (F7)



 

Cactus’ Sword (F10)







Bosses



Spoiler: Bosses + Lore



Entrance Floor - Menvar - God of Knowledge - Has no form. Only visible part of them is an eyeball in the back of the blood room that watches players - Probably stronger than all the other bosses but not much is known about her. Summons spiders and evil plants.

Floor 1 - Erragor - Baby Druid - NPC - Enthusiastic new druid. Eager to prove themselves in battle. Summons weak spiders and plants.

Floor 2 - Agrathon - Acolyte Druid - NPC - Beginner Druid. Started learning two years ago and considers himself a master. Uses an excessive amount of Flytraps, because he thinks they look cool.

Floor 3 - Tetraphine - Enlightened Druid - Slime - Oddball Druid. Spends most of his time sitting in a garden. Claims that he is one with his plants. Doesn’t summon any plants, but attacks you directly using plant-related abilities.

Floor 4 - Solus - Professional Druid - NPC - Long-Time Druid. Sells plants for a living. Claims he thinks it’s lame but secretly loves his career. Uses a wide variety of houseplants.

Floor 5 - Retson - Cardinal Druid - Slime - Religious leader of the Druids. Greatly respected Druid. Claims he’s a pacifist, so he has his plants attack you instead (under his command, of course). Uses extensions of his own body to attack, through plants.

Floor 6 - Grechavich - King Druid - NPC - King of the Druids. A very happy-go-lucky king. Enjoys sunbathing and going on long walks. Cares deeply about his plants, so they’ve become very strong and connected. Uses only a small number of very strong plants.

Floor 7 - Hamon - Spiderling - Cave Spider - Just born. Determined to prove themselves to the Spider Queen and become the next Spider Lord. Fairly arrogant. Doesn’t summon anything, just him and his best friends.

Floor 8 - Ziggur - Spider Gladiator - Spider NPC - Very strong. Wants to rise to power, but respects his leader. Fights like he would in an arena, using weapons, traps, and animals to his advantage.

Floor 9 - Zygoth - Spider Lord - Spider - Heir to the throne. Fairly brash, but cares deeply for the Spider Empire. Thinks slimes look funny, so he calls on them to fight for him.

Floor 10 - Esmerelda - Spider Queen - Spider - Elderly spider. Not a big supporter of free speech. Claims she’s too old to fight you, so she summons her army to fight for her.



Monsters



Spoiler: Entrance Floor Mobs




Baby Slime
Weak slime mob. Jumps at you and does little damage.

Adult Slime
Medium strength slime mob. Has high hp but low damage.

Evil Grass
Basic plant. Spawns in large groups. Low damage and health, and fairly slow.

Angry Flower
Fast plant. Has low health but does decent damage.

Possessed Cactus
Shoots spikes at you. Has very low damage, but deals damage to its attacker when hit by a melee attack.

Ent (summoned mob)
Summoned when you chop down a tree. Has medium health and medium damage.

Dryad (miniboss)
Attacks you with a sword. Has very high hp but low damage.

Pea plant
Slow, low hp. Shoots peas at you that do high damage from far distances (very original idea)

Spiderling
Low hp, low damage, slow. Runs at you in hordes.

Jumping Spider
Jumps at you. Does medium damage, but high damage on jumps.

Angry Spider
Runs at you. Does medium damage and moves quickly, but has low hp.







Spoiler: New Floor 1 Mobs




Bouncy Slime

Leaps at you from a far distance. Doesn’t do lots of damage, but knocks you back.

Nesting Spider

Shoots webs that temporarily paralyze you.






Spoiler: New Floor 2 Mobs




Cruel Rose

Shoots thorns at you. Thorns cause you to bleed, losing a small amount of health per second.






Spoiler: New Floor 3 Mobs




Poison Spider

Has a special attack where the spider poisons you, making you slower and weaker. Can only attack like this once. Otherwise is like a normal angry spider. Spawns rarely. Takes reduced ranged damage.

Silverback Spider

Silverfish. Spawns in hordes. Is slow and does low damage. Has low HP. replaces the spiderling.

Crazed Cactus

Shoots thorns and spikes. Does moderate damage and has low HP. Deals damage to its attacker when hit by a melee attack. Replaces the Possessed Cactus.






Spoiler: New Floor 4 Mobs




Naiad (miniboss)

Shoots water beams at you using a staff. Does high damage but has low HP.

Angry Slime

Slime with medium damage and medium health. Replaces the Baby Slime.

Crazed Flower

Faster, stronger Angry Flower. Replaces the Angry Flower.

Tree Spirit

Tanky mob. Does low damage and moves slowly, but has very high hp. Takes reduced magic damage.

Living Bush

Tanky mob with decent damage. Only attacks when someone steps on it.

Elder Slime

Tanky mob with medium damage. Replaces the Adult Slime.






Spoiler: New Floor 5 Mobs




Living Vines

Weak mob that spawns in small hordes. Replaces the Evil Grass.

Beanstalk

Shoots high-damage beans at you. Deals high damage, but can only throw them once every three seconds. Hits you with its fists and does medium damage. Has high HP.

Spiky Rose

Shoots thorns at you. Thorns cause you to bleed, losing a small amount of health per second. Replaces the Cruel Rose.






Spoiler: New Floor 6 Mobs




Devil’s Rose

Shoots flames at you. Slow mob with high hp and high defence. Takes reduced magic damage.

Enraged Slime

Fast mob that does high damage. Has medium HP. Replaces the Elder Slime.

Furious Spider

Stronger Angry Spider. Replaces Angry Spider.

Furious Cactus

Shoots poisonous spikes. They slow and poison the victim and do high damage. Replaces the Crazed Cactus.






Spoiler: New Floor 7 Mobs




Spider Soldier

Strong spider that follows you wherever you go until it dies.

Wheat Stalk

Teleports to you and hits you once, then teleports away. Dies in one hit, but does high damage.

Golden Beanstalk

Stronger Beanstalk. Rare spawn.






Spoiler: New Floor 8 Mobs




Leaping Spider

High damage high speed monster. Replaces the Jumping Spider.

Master Slime

High HP medium damage slime. Replaces the Enraged Slime.

Giant Slime

High HP high damage slime. Rare spawn chance.

Cactus Lord

Shoots poisonous high damage spikes. Takes reduced ranged damage and deals damage when hit by a melee attack.






Spoiler: New Floor 9 Mobs




Spider Beast

Very strong spider. Does high damage and has high hp, but moves very slowly.

Crawling Moss

Medium strength mob. Spawns in large hordes. Replaces the Living Vines.

Plant Deity

High damage high speed mob. Replaces the Angry Flower.






Spoiler: New Floor 10 Mobs




Magical Beanstalk

Replaces all Beanstalk spawns. High damage and high health mob. Takes reduced magic damage.

Massive Slime

High HP high damage slime. Replaces Giant Slime. Rare spawn chance.

King Slime

High damage medium HP slime. Replaces the Master Slime.

Demon Rose

Shoots fire. Deals extremely high damage but has low HP. Takes reduced magic damage. Replaces the Devil’s Rose.




Entrance Boss Fight



Spoiler: Entrance Floor Boss Fight



Entrance Floor - Menvar - Goddess of Knowledge - Has no form. Only visible part of them is an eyeball in the back of the blood room that watches players - Probably stronger than all the other bosses but not much is known about her. Summons spiders and evil plants.

Dialogue: Welcome to my temple. This is where I spend all my time. I’ve been watching your progress, and you are nothing like the other explorers. I trust that this will be an interesting battle.
*Summons the first wave of mobs. They are weak plants that rise from the ground.*
Menvar’s Plants (entrance):

Angry Algae x7

Low damage high hp mob. Slow.

Beastly Bamboo x3

Low hp medium damage mob. Regenerates fast when not attacked. Fairly speedy.

Cruel Cabbage x2

Medium damage medium HP mob.

Hellish Hemp x2

Poisons its victim.

Evil Iceberg

Slows its victims. Medium hp medium damage. Slow moving.
Dialogue: Fascinating. It’s not over yet, though. Meet my next collection.
*Summons the second wave of mobs. These are medium strength spiders that fall from the sky.*
Menvar’s Spiders (entrance):

Vicious Spider x5

Medium HP medium damage spider.

Speedy Spider x3

Low HP high damage spider. Very fast.

Devilish Spider x2

High HP medium damage spider.
Dialogue: I’m impressed. You may pass. I expect to see you again soon.
End of boss fight.



That's it for now! I think this would be cool, but I know that the admins don't intend to create any new dungeons for a while. I just wanted to share this and get feedback.

title: how you used to be able to upgrade the rarity of a talisman twice
body:
For the first week or so of dungeons being out, there was a bug that if you fished in dungeons, the gear drops from sea creatures (sea witch, water hydra, sea emporer, etc.) would have a random score from 0 to 50, like dungeon drops do.
Proof of this is on TimeDeo's profile, where he has a 30/50 shredder.





Now what does this mean?
If you get a 50/50 item, the rarity will be upgraded one tier. This means you can get a legendary fish affinity talisman, which is a drop from the Water Hydra. This means that if you got one of these while this bug worked, you can get more stats than anyone else.
Therefore, it is impossible to max your accessories without having one of these.
\o/


Edit: Not sure if any of these were created, but it was possible to do so

title: Century Cakes
body:
Century Cakes are a new item celebrating the 100th year of Skyblock. You may be asking, what the heck are Century Cakes, how do they work, and what types are there?

You get a Century Cake from the Simon NPC near the Community Center in the hub. You get a random color, and each one has a different bonus.

All cake buffs last 48 hours, and can be refreshed by just eating the cake again. Century Cakes are all furniture items with no durability, you can eat them as much as you want and they won't be consumed. There are also "cake souls", which are mythic rarity. There is a very small chance to get one from eating a Century Cake, and they are different colors depending on which cake you got it from. Their use is currently unknown.

The types are:
Crab-Colored Century Cake: Gives +10 Health
aPunch Century Cake: Gives +2 Strength
Latest Update Century Cake: Gives +2 Ferocity
Potato-Style Century Cake: Gives +10 Speed
Pet Rock Century Cake: +3 Defense
Barry Century Cake: +5 Intelligence
Sea Emperor Century Cake: +1 Sea Creature Chance
Streamer's Century Cake: +1 Pet Luck
Century Cake of the Next Dungeon Floor: +1 Magic Find

There is currently very little confirmed information about Century Cakes, and I will continue to update the post as we learn more.

Bat person talisman - + 3 stacks

bat pet - 1 stack + 1 stack per rarity above common, and 1 extra stack if it’s a lvl 100 legendary pet

it has the samespecial abilities of the bat blade, but it’s second ability had a base chance of 10 instead.

title: Tired of cookie P2W players being accused for irl trade
body:
Hi,

I am tired of legit cookie P2W players being accused for IRL trade and being reported. Just because our stats does not add up (such as good armor and weap but low skill XP) doesn't mean we must be IRL traders.

My legit P2W friends and I have been accused numerous times by some random dudes, searching us up on skylea and accusing us for IRL trade and reporting us. An easy way to solve this issue is by adding the fame rank to the SkyBlock public API, that way the websites such as skylea can display it. Fame rank directly reflects how much cookie you have bought using gems, and therefore a way to indicate whether you are an IRL trader or a legit cookie trader.

My IGN is always PotatoMaster101. If you see me in a lobby, please don't come up to me and be like "you are very sus, are you IRL trading?". Below is a screenshot of my fame rank to prove my legit cookie P2W:




(as a note, my goal is to hit 100mil fame)

As a P2W player, I am supporting the Hypixel server. Without donation from players, there will be no Hypixel. There are numerous forms of donations - such as ranks, mystery boxes, boosters, and most recent SkyBlock Gems.

You can say I am wasting my money or I am stupid for paying or blah blah blah, but I will not mind it. I just cannot tolerate people reporting legit P2W players as IRL traders and trying to get them banned.

Thanks,
PotatoMaster101

title: [IDEA] Demolition Wand
body: This item can be bought at the bits shop. The Demolition Wand is like the build's wand but the other way around. It destroys anything that it used on and all the blocks will go inside it like the builder's wand's storage. To use this item you would right click on a block and any other block connected to the Wand would be instantly deleted and go inside the storage. But you would need to double click on the blocks to delete them. Please notify me if you are going to include this item into the game. Please do!

So I had thought of something for mage class An Epic Dungeon Item called The Spell Book the item would be an enchanted book dropped from f6,f7 and f8.

title: [IDEA] Whetstone and Diamond Whetstone
body:
The Whetstone is an epic item that is obtained as a rare find in the Dark Auction. In the Dark Auction, there is a 1/50 chance for a rare find to appear. Rare finds go for much higher because they are so rare. The Whetstone when used grants +50% crit damage to swords. It applies the Sharpened upgrade.

Diamond Whetstone is a legendary item that is obtained as a super rare find in the Dark Auction. In the Dark Auction, there is a 1/100 chance for a super rare find to appear. The Diamond Whetstone when used grants +100% crit damage to a sword, granting it the Diamond Sharpened upgrade. Keep in mind that it does apply an anvil use. It also can only be used when you have already used the normal Whetstone, making it an upgrade to an upgrade.

title: [IDEA] Lost Head of Herobrine, best damage pet in game?? (only 1 on server with a huge scavenger hunt to find)
body:
The Lost Head of Herobrine is a corrupted pet (obfuscated text instead of rarity name). There can only be one of them on the server, and I will elaborate on obtaining further. It gives +1 strength, +1% crit damage, +0.5% crit chance, and +1 intelligence per level. It's abilities are:
Teleportation - increases the range of the Aspect of the End's instant transmission by 1% per level
Curse - Inflict max level of every debuff to whatever you hit
Stalk- Gain +1 base damage to an enemy per level after hitting it (does stack)
Immortality - Outside of dungeons, you cannot die. The least amount of health you can have is 1, and once you get hit with 1 health, you get teleported to the spawn of the map you are in. You do not lose coins, potion effects, or anything else. You still stay at 1 health, but it can be healed with items like regeneration potions or a zombie sword. When you are saved, a message in chat says to you: "The rage of an unknown force has refused to let you pass on to the afterlife. For now you live." This is put at the last priority if you have a Saving Grace or a Remnant of the Eye. If the ability is activated in Dungeons, it says "Somehow, the force of a thousand souls could not save you. Complete the Dungeon to reactivate your curse."
Conclusion: By far this is the best dps pet, but it is also by far the rarest. Also, this is very 2013 lmao

Obtaining: You can obtain this by completing the Water Puzzle in dungeons in under 1 minute. Once you open the chest, it grants you the mysterious key. A message in chat says to you: "A strange key... Maybe you should speak to someone who knows about strange objects." If you talk to Maddox the Slayer with this in your hand, he will say: "What? What am I supposed to do with this?" If you hand him a Locked Safe, which has a 1/5000 chance of being fished up, he will say: "Oh. You want me to unlock it for you. Here." He will then hand you an Unlocked Safe and an Emerald Key. You can then discard the Unlocked Safe, as it doesn't do anything. Once the Emerald Key is in your inventory, a message in chat says to you: "Something is telling you that you need to speak to someone who loves emeralds. If you speak to Romero when he is at the Emerald Altar with the Emerald Key in your hand, he will say: "Hey! A key! I love keys. And it's made out of Emerald! Even better!" If you try to mine the Emerald Altar, he says: "Oh. You want me to unlock that. Got it." He will then try to unlock the emerald altar, and it will explode, dealing 50,000 true damage. This is only possible to survive while wearing Mastiff Armor. If you die, the whole challenge gets reset and the Key gets voided. If you do survive, Romero says: "Wow! That was a big explosion. Are you OK? Luckily I am, because I am an NPC. Anyway, could you hand this chunk of the altar to Juliette? I'm sure she would love it!" A message in chat then says to you: "I'm sure she would not. Take it to someone who has experience with the mine, someone that could examine it for you." If you hand it to Juliette, the quest will progress as normal and you will lose your Emerald Chunk. If you bring it to the Lazy Miner, he will say: "Wowie! That's one nice emerald. Here, take this strange orb I found while mining, I don't know what to do with it." If you hand that in to mayor Notch (a rare mayor that runs a special shop that sells special unique items), he will say: "Watch your back." You will then be stuck in place, and if you turn behind you, Herobrine will run towards you at a fast speed and kill you. When you respawn, you will respawn in a room with Herobrine's head on the floor. If you right click it, you will obtain the first and only Lost Head of Herobrine pet on the server. Congratulations!

title: [Guide] How to enter END game as quickly as possible!
body:
Video Link:

https://m.youtube.com/channel/UCgl_XCClf1AM2BwehPRVSag

tl:dr of video

So first, let’s define what late and end game players are.

Late Game

Strong Dragon Armor or Mastiff or Tarantula Armor

AND

AOTD/Pigmans/Thick Tacticians

Around 25m+ in net worth

End Game

Superior Dragon Armor/Perfect X-XII

50mil Midas

OR 75m+ in net worth

Thus with the generic definitions out of the way, let’s get started with the money making methods.

1. Zealot grinding

Really straightforward, the OG of the OG of grinding methods.

You have 2 strategies for this method.

1.) Young/Speed strategy Essentially get young dragon armor + AOTD/Pigmans/Thick Tacticians and use the extra speed to kill zealots quickly.

2.) Explosive Strategy Get a sword that does 13,000 damage and an explosive bow. Shoot the arrow near the zealot and swap your to your main sword to make the explosive bow deal the damage of your main sword. Allowing you to shoot zealots from just a pillar without moving.

2.) Auction Flipping

Basically, buy items for cheap during off peak hours or during spooky events. And sell them during peak hours for extra coins to profit!

It’s hard to learn at the start but it’s easy to master the profits once you’re experienced. I have a more specific rundown in this method in my video since I don’t want this post to be 3 pages Long.

3.) Slayer grinding

My favourite of the bunch, just grind T3 Tarantula, T4 Sven or T3 Sven for profits.

Grind the base materials, buy slaves to help you click enchanted materials. Craft the silk/gold teeth and craft them into items to sell on the AH for profits.

T4 Sven will give less profits than T3 Tarantula and T3 Sven but for T4 Sven, you’re gunning for the hope of an Overflux capacitor.

4.) Dragon grinding

Recommended:

Tarantula/ Tarantula Helmet + 3/4 strong

DH 3+, Power 6, HPB Runaan’s bow

50mil Midas/End sword with DH 5 (optional)

10m+ to bid on eyes

Simple strategy, Do the best damage, hope for Strong/Superior dragons, if a boomer dragon spawns, hope for an AOTD.

Sell to the Ah and profit.

Once you have the money, you now have 4 paths to choose for your end game road.

1.) Hoarder

Just store coins, don’t buy anything, simple.

2.) superior + 50mil Midas

Just get a superior dragon set and a 50mil Midas. The best path in the meta at the moment.

3.) Off-Meta/Collector

Basically you just invest in items which you believe may see use in the future, such as Perfect 12, Scythe, Overflux and mosquito bow.

Some players in this path also go on to collect every item in hypixel skyblock such as Diver’s armor, and Yeti Sword

4.) Skill Grinder/All-minion slots

The title explains it. Basically, you spend your coins on materials to upgrade your minions to help you get more skill EXP and you buy skill EXP potions to speed up the process.

And with that, I hope I helped to explain the late-end game bridge you guys may want to consider traveling! If there are any improvements please comment down below or in the YouTube comments, I’ll try to respond to them as soon as possible.

title: Explosives for Archers!
body:
(I mentioned this in my little Avengers post, but no one is going to see it there, so I thought I would discuss it separately.)

Simple idea: Skyblock should add explosives to the archer's bag of tricks. This would fit with archers' play style, and honestly it would just be fun. (I don't play archer, by the way.)

Here are some thoughts about what that could look like:

(1) Archers could place an explosive and then use a detonator to ignite it from a certain distance. (Ranged weapons, get it?) The detonator would have like a 30-second cool down.

(2) Blast radius would scale with archer-class level--maybe an additional half-block per level.

(3) "Expertise" would scale with class level, too. The idea here is that explosives would always have a chance of damaging the archer's teammates (the risk of friendly fire), but that chance would decrease as they gained experience=levels. (Maybe it starts at 50% and decreases by one percent per level.)

(4) There would be several types of explosives they could use. For example: (a) a fire-bomb that does uniform damage to all mobs within a certain radius; (b) an ice-bomb that freezes all mobs within a certain radius; (c) a shrapnel bomb that does a massive amount of damage to a handful of mobs in a certain radius; and, my favorite, (d) a sword-swapping bomb that does their sword's amount of damage to every mob in a certain radius.

(5) Explosives would be usable only in dungeons and only by archers. The last thing we need is to accidentally give mages another OP weapon that was originally intended for another class. 

(6) The explosives should be massively unbalanced when they first come out and then get nerfed a week later. (Kidding.)

What do you think?

Disclaimer: This title is a little clickbait, I'm not going to accuse directly this guy since I have not enough proofs. I'm just sharing my story to make a comparison.

I recently watched a video of what appears to be the worst nightmare that can happen to a skyblock player:




if you haven't watched it yet, watch it and then continue reading...

Hoping to find comments in my favor and not be the only lucky one:
This thing also happened to me 3 times and it is always fixed simply by going to the hub or to my island.
It has been around for several months, even before the dungeons.

Don't you think it's strange to record the screen in such a normal situation? Moreover, the video does not show the moments after the loss, very suspicious, if I had been him I would have shown everything clearly.
In addition to the fact that he made a public post and from what I read he did not report the bug in the appropriate section, continuing to bump the post and tag admins.
Forgive my ignorance but neither I and the people around me use or talk about what you call: shadowplay.

I'm just giving these details (which aren't that small) about this situation.
I expect the staff to investigate the fact thoroughly.

Having said that I want to clarify that I do not know this player my opinion is completely impartial, so I can not claim that he is a dishonest player or anything else.

title: I need a bit of help on finding a player or group of players
body:
Recently my account has been hacked into, and whoever hacked into it likely ended up hacking inside of uhc champions, and got my account banned, seeing as I was in the uhc lobby when the ban was over. I don't blame watch dog for banning them, actually im rather glad that whoever was on my account couldn't do anything else on my main server. However, they ended up doing something much worse than changing my name and getting me banned. They basically stole all of my inventory inside of skyblock, which consisted of two sets of dragon armour (unstable and holy), both an aotd and aote, as well as around 300,000 coins from my bank, although not entirely sure why they'd steal that small amount. 



Here in this screenshot its easy to tell that im wearing some form of dragon armour (this was the holy set), and all of the weapons and tools are seen in the hotbar. However, when I logged on today after the ban was over, this is what my inventory looks like after I managed to get another aote




And before someone says, what if you put all of your stuff in another chest? Well, first things first, I'm asking for help on if we could possibly find this group of people, or person. I want whoever this person is to get banned, going off of the fact they stole months of progress. Other thing is, I wouldn't create a post if I was looking for a refund on my items, and im pretty sure hypixel doesnt even do that.
While I know it's not that much information to use, this is all i've gathered:

Whoever managed to hack into my account did so on October 6, and played on it until the password was changed
This player is likely english speaking, but at the same time chinese speaking due to them having changed my language on the server.
Whoever this person is, they changed my name from Asquidwithnoname to ModNMSL
This person plays on hypixel in some form or way, seeing as they stole all of my items as well as hacking inside of uhc champions (although I have no idea if they hacked in any other game)
If you have any idea on if this could be a specific player, or group of players please let me know.
One final thing, if you have seen the account ModNMSL, be it in either skyblock, or any other game, please let me know. And if said account hacked on you in any other gamemode, I appologize greatly for this. While I have no control over if someone uses a hack client inside of a game, I can appologize for their actions.

title: Sugar cane vs Pumpkin after Blessed Reforge Update
body:
Info:
Over the last little while I have been farming a lot, and by a lot I am about to hit farming 46 (yes I know not even 50 lol). For the past months on my island I had had 4 layers of pumpkin and 2 1/2 layers of sugar cane and recently the interest of finding the difference in the most efficient crop became interesting to me. Now this was further amplified after the implementation of the blessed reforge for hoe's in Skyblock near the blacksmith merchant in the hub. For you I have simply done the math for you and will also add in a few things to "note" underneath the math as to help yourself when choosing which crop to chose. all finding were with a level 80 epic rabbit for those who cant get max lvl pets quickly meaning all xp gains can be increased by a total of 6% more xp with a level 100

Tools Used:
Sugarcane - Diamond Hoe (Blessed Reforge)
Pumpkins - Treecapitator

Sugar Cane Stats (260% speed)
Sugar cane 1 row: 2,357.6 xp

Sugar cane total rows on 1 layer = 55 x 2,357.6 = 129,668xp per layer

sugar cane time per layer = 16 mins 30 secs

Sugar cane xp per minute = 129,668/16.5 = 7,858.6 xp

Sugar cane xp per hour = (60/16.5 = 3.6) = 129,668 x 3.6 = 466,804.8 xp


Pumpkin Stats (260% speed)
pumpkin 1 layer: 2,474.2 xp

Pumpkin total rows on 1 layer = 35 x 2,474.2 = 86,597 per layer

Pumpkin time per layer = 10min 31 seconds

Pumpkin xp per minute = 86,597/10.5 = 8,247.3 xp

Pumpkin xp per hour = (60/10.5 = 5.7) = 86,597 x 5.7 = 493,602.9

Time for Farming 50: (Total xp required from lvl 0-50 = 55,172,425 xp)

Sugar Cane:
118.1 Hours

(With lvl 100 rabbit pet - 111.02 hours)

Pumpkin:
111.7 Hours

(With level 100 rabbit pet - 105.01 hours)

Difference:
The difference in the 2 crops can be seen with pumpkin getting up to 26,798.1 xp more than sugar cane per hour therefore making it the most optimal crop to achieve farming 50 in the quickest time period

Points To Note:
- Sugar cane will make a lot more money so if you need money and are willing to spend only 7 hours more farming then cane is 100% worth for you

- In my test I had to theoretically find the total xp per hour on a layer basis, however if you actually want to achieve this level of efficiency for pumpkins you need 6 layers w/ water as that regrows 99.73% of the entire farm each run.

- The speed percentages the runs were done at are not actually the most optimal but the most efficient if you will be doing both farms, as you can farm them consistently without missing any crops at 260% speed. Most optimal for pumpkin is 265% w/ good ping and cane is 261%.

- All testing was conducted with the use of the lvl 80 rabbit, god potion (item) and cookie boost

Hope this helped you guys/girls out... Happy farming

title: Current Healer Items Suck - Read Before You Give Advice
body:
I'm just making this so I can quote it whenever someone (who isn't a healer) tells me to use some stuff because it's "good". No big need to reply or react.
TLDR: a lot of "good" items are not good.

PETS
The healer class itself + the mender fedora gives OVERKILL healing. I can heal about 45% of my max health in ONE SECOND with just my circle and overflux.

Ghoul: It buffs what is already very strong. A strong pet, but completely unnecessary, which is why it is bad.
Amplified Healing (+25% healing): You don't need +25% on something that can heal you to full in 2 seconds.
Zombie Arm (+50% range and healing to zombie sword): Zombie sword gives absolute garbage healing to other players (only ~70 hp base), while it can heal over half your max health at once to yourself- again, overkill.
Reaper Soul (+100% health/lifespan of reaper scythe zombies): Do I even need to explain? Reaper scythe was reworked and this ability currently does nothing.

Jellyfish: The healing/buffs it gives are negligible.
Radiant Regeneration (+100% natural regeneration, +10hp/s to others): Double natural regeneration to yourself is unnecessary (because natural regeneration is weak). +10hp/s to others does nothing when "others" have 5k hp.
Hungry Healer (Enchanted Gapple effect given to nearby players every 10s for every 1000 hp you heal): The only relevant buffs are 5 defense and 80 absorption. The stats are too little to do anything.
Powerful Potions (+100% effectiveness of healing/mana pots): Splash potions are useless in dungeons. You can only use one, anyway.

Griffin: I haven't used this, but the way the healing mechanic works doesn't seem to great. Also, the healer class's base healing is enough healing already.
Odyssey (Mythology): Not used for dungeons.
Legendary Constitution (Regen 7, Strength 8): Good for damage, although not for healing.
Perpetual Empathy (Heal others for 20% damage you receive): You must take damage, meaning you must use jingle bells, which drains your mana fast. Jingle bells also do not take boss agro for long.
King of Kings (+15% strength when above 85% hp): Good for damage, although not for healing.

So healers are forced to use damage/tank pets.


WEAPONS
There are only 3 that can somewhat be used for healer. Two are garbage and the last one doesn't even work.

Adaptive Blade: Just bad.
Damage: Terrible base stats.
+5 hp/s to allies: Negligible healing. Even worse than jellyfish.
+20% hp regen: Natural regen is too weak.

Florid Zombie Sword: Unnecessary.
Damage: It's not a damage weapon.
Increased healing over ornate: Zombie swords aren't meant for healing to other players, and that tiny increase in healing to yourself won't do anything.
2 extra charges: If you ever end up relying on those to survive, you're dead once they run out.

Fel Sword: Too bugged to work, but good damage. Very cheap, so that's a plus, but it doesn't do what it's supposed to do.
Damage: Exceptional, it is better than a 50 mil Midas when maxed.
-10s wish cool down: Bugged and doesn't even work. I tested.
+10% healing circle healing: Would be good, but is bugged. I tested.


ARMOR
The healing helmets are pretty powerful. But they do make healer more than 25% armor-locked, because helmets have the most powerful abilities of all armor pieces.

Mender Helmet: Outclassed by zombie heart.
Zombie heart doubles all regeneration to yourself as well (instead of just healing to teammates), at the cost of only -30 hp.

Mender Fedora: Good item. Only one complaint.
It does not double healing given to yourself by other players. Only doubles healing given to yourself by yourself.


UTILITY ITEMS
Plasmaflux Power Orb: Few complaints. Good item but extremely overpriced for the tiny stat increases it provides. Read this thread for an in-depth comparison.

Overflux Power Orb: No complaints. Good item and the price dropped recently.

Mana Flux Power Orb: No complaints. Good item, almost on-par with overflux, and very cheap.

Radiant Power Orb: No healer should ever be using this, but it's decent I guess.

Lesser Orb of Healing: Massive mana drain. Only useful for mage healers. Also doesn't even work in dungeons.
50 mana/second is HUGE. And it only heals 5% of the target's max hp, which is tiny compared to what healing circle + aura does (healing circle + aura also has 0 mana cost).
You can't even put ultimate wise on it.
For comparison:
I can heal someone from 0 to full in 4-5 seconds with a healing circle + aura, for 0 mana.
With this orb, I would need the same time (because healer class buffs + helmet), but 200-250 mana.


REFORGES
Empowered (Titanic with +10% healing): Good reforge, but again- like ghoul, just unnecessary.
You don't need a +10% on a combo that heals people to full in 2 seconds.



What do healers need? Some more support items that shield others, because we have more than enough healing.

title: (repost) Updated - convientnce items
body:
Items that would improve life on Hypixel Skyblock (I believe):
- Village Affinity (ring/artifact): Ring- removes the personal bank cooldown while in the Village, Auction House, or Bazaar. Increases Speed by +25%, while in the Village. Village Affinity Artifact: Allows you to spend $$$ directly from your bank on the ah, while in the auction house, gives buff from village affinity ring, gives +100% speed while in the Village.

- Reforge Bag: Allows you to reforge multiple items at once, costing the cumulative amount of all of the items. When using Accessories, gives the discount present in the Accessory Bag on all of the accessories in the bag. Can hold a double chest full of items, but only reforgable items can be held in it and no player may have more than 1 in his/her inventory.

- Piggy bank patch: (costs 8 enchanted pork): when right-clicked, repair the active piggy bank in your inv by 1.

- Wardrobe totem: Left-Click: switches the current set you are wearing one to the right, and does not work if you aren't wearing a set. Right-Click: opens the wardrobe menu.

Cleaning stone - costs $500 from the guy who sells all those reforge stones, and is free to apply. Removes all of the items enchantments and anvil uses, as well as refunds any fuming potato books used on the item (or it just deletes em but I feel like that is too expensive/mean)

(not an item but) Sac of sacs settings: allow you to disable items going into your sacs, withdraw/deposit all items from and into sacs, and has a setting where all items coming from minions do not go into sacs.

Please tell me what you think in the comments!

title: Werewolf Set for Healer (Part 2)
body:
This is a followup thread to this one https://hypixel.net/threads/werewolf-set-for-healers.3490864/#post-24918040

And now after using it for some time now I can say it's a worthwhile set, however it doesn't overpower normal healer setups

Pros:
-Allows for higher healing dps (burst healing is ornate sword w/o charges and cooldown)
-Range is exceptionally large for healing; 25 blocks (it's literally larger than the radius of a Plasmaflux which is 20 like wtf)

Cons:
-Healing applies to teammates only
-Healing is delayed a bit due to ferocity actually having to do damage first
-A enemy is needed to farm "hits" off of to trigger full set bonus otherwise normal circle and orb is all you got
-Atm only one setup is possible to efficiently make use of the full set bonus* 
*Full werewolf, high lvl tiger, livid dagger, or any sword with vicious 5

Notes:
-Healing done by ferocity is doubled if teammates healed is wearing any mender helmet or reaper mask
-Healing done by the full set bonus is also affected by the healing bonus of healer class, ghoul pet, healing orbs (Overflux/Plasmaflux) etc.
-Full set bonus can be trigger by FoT ability, Bonemerang (randomly works) and bow hits provided your ferocity is high enough

Conclusion:
The set is good, it's fun, but it drops off immediately the second you're not attacking something thus an aggressive playstyle is somewhat forced. It can be used by berserker and tank as a stand-in healer and the effectiveness does increase when multiple teammates are running it but only during boss fights such F5 and F6 (terracottas). One upside to all this if you still manage to die while being burst healed, you only have yourself to blame soo gg healers another "don't blame me" free pass

title: [Guide] How to place with endstone protectors
body:
Ever wanted to make money? Well placing on endstone protectors certainly does that as it does not require a fee like slayers and has some of the most valuable drops. So without further a due, I have made a guide to help you place and get these drops:

Preparing
Potions: Potions are great for dealing damage, as they provide significant boosts to your damage and other stats. Also if you have low skills or not many talismans, they can help make up for that, but I would really recommend having good talismans with good reforges such as itchy, strong, and godly

Crit iv(Crit chance is most helpful here)
Pet luck iv
strength viii
adrenaline(gives speed and absorption so you don't die)
Spirit iv(Speed and crit damage are helpful)
Armor: Try something with a lot of strength as strength is very useful, tarantula is good for the full set ability, as is 3/4 strong and tara helm, or superior if you can afford it. Make sure your armor is reforged to strong or godly for maximum damage
Weapon: Aotd works fine, midas and yeti are good if you can afford too. Make sure you have crit vi, as it is somewhat cheap and is useful. Never forget hpbs as without them, your damage is significantly reduced
Pets: I personally use the phoenix because with the fourth flair ability I can easily place the high amount of strength is also useful, dragon pet obviously works, as does tiger and lion, enderman is not so good, so I would recommend a different pet.

Strategy
Try to get the protector to go towards the back of the alter, then getting up at about the level it's head it at so it can't hit you and your hits can't be blocked by others, and hit as much as you can. I also find the phoenix fourth flair ability helps a good deal, with my crit, I can place first by just 1 hit with the ability lol- thats 300-700k with the ability, my crit is 20-70k depending on weapon, armor, talismans, and stuff. Also make sure you aim for the protectors chest/torso it nearly always registers your hit if you it it there also make sure you shift while fighting it, I find that it helps for some reason. Also make sure you get at least 100 zealot kills so you can get good loot. And don't forget your pots. Make sure you do not die as this can set you back hundreds of thousands of damage, to prevent dying, try to carry an ornate zombie sword with you.

Good rewards
Things that the endstone protector drops that are very good include the tier boost core and the golem pet. Both sell for high amounts, I would recommend selling them over using them. To get good rewards you must kill a high amount of zealots contributing to spawning the boss, 100 is best if you can.

About me
So I have made a large fortune from endstone protectors, my most notable moment is when I received 3 tier boost cores in a row, this made me a ton of money, so rather than grinding zealots for eyes, grind them for good rewards for endstone protectors. I have low skill levels and I only have about 40 talismans, but my strategy makes up for those losses, therefore make sure you focus on your strategy more than anything as it helps the most.

Hope this helps you next time you fight an endstone protector, 

Good luck,
Swap_MC

title: [Guide] How to avoid scammers of all types
body:
I have seen many posts about people getting scammed in skyblock, and I personally have been scammed a couple times. To help you not to be scammed I have created this thread in hopes to inform you of the most popular scams out there in skyblock to prevent it from happening to you. Here are some of the most popular scams:

1. Coop scam
-You add someone who seems nice to your island for help, for instance you need help making a pumpkin farm, and they kick you or steal your stuff. 
One way you can combat this is to either do it yourself even though it will take some time, you can invite a friend you know in real life or somebody you really trust and know they won't try to harm you. Avoid players you have just met or met only on hypixel.

-You add someone to you skyblock island because you want to make a coop and they end up stealing your stuff or kicking you.
To combat this scam you can use the same tactics as the first I listed.

-Griefing- A player in you coop gets mad or wants to make you upset so they ruin your island/account by throwing stuff in the void, giving away stuff or just blowing things up. 
This is very hard to defend against. Precautions you can take are things like keeping your valuables on you or making sure this 'friend' who is your coop is really reliable. Don't just take their word for it, if you don't know them and get scammed, it's YOUR fault.



2. Item/trade scam
-You are trading for an item but what they claim to have given you isn't what it seemed or they switch the item right before you accept the trade.
To prevent this from happening, always check the trade, make sure they are giving you what they say, if not, cancel the trade immediately, sometimes you may get them to actually trade the second time, but other times, they will try and scam you again. Be prepared for this and never trade all your stuff without a backup to get you started again if you lose all your stuff.

-You are trading but do not know the value of your item(s)/the other person's item(s) 
To make sure this doesn't happen, always check the auction house or bazaar for the item you are trading and look at ending soon to see how much the item commonly goes for or ask your guild/friends, it might actually be more profitable to sell the item elsewhere, so always take that time to look.

-The backpack scam- one of the most common scams in the hubs. 
There are two ways I know of for combating this. You can try installing a texture pack/mod(https://hypixel.net/threads/forge-1...view-your-skyblock-backpack-contents.2198897/) to see items inside backpacks, or you can refuse to buy items in the backpack and say you want to be able to see the items you are trading for not in the backpack. Never trade for a backpack unless you know for sure what's in it. It's always ok to refuse to trade.

-New player scam- Someone claims to be a new player and asks for items or money. 
Generally you should just ignore this if you aren't sure. If you know that they are actually new, only give them items that can help them but won't cost you too much such as lapis or miner armor. Also if someone is asking for stuff this probably means they actually know what they are doing so don't necessarily give them stuff. If you want to help new players, look for people on the hub island wearing lapis or something, you can also check the gold mines and the deep caverns to help someone because often end/midgame players don't spend much time in the mines.


I would love to hear what you think.  If you come across anymore scams or have any edits or advice you would like added, comment below, thanks for reading this, I hope it helps you.

title: New farming update leaks and my thoughts!
body:
So, Minikloon just released a new farming update video showing many new utility items you can use while building and planting farms.






The video shows many different items:
Infinidirt wand: Allows you to place dirt for 2 coins on your private island, and seems to have a pretty big range that you can place the blocks in.
Prismapump: pumps water that is poured around it, seen filling up a decent length of 1 block wide ditches.
Hoe of great tilling: tills a 5x5 area of dirt, works around water and anything else
Basket of seeds: instantly place down a row of seeds or crops, seen covering a big distance and working with wet and dry farmland. Stores seeds just like the builder wand

And.... that's it. Honestly, I wasn't impressed. Let's talk about each of these items and potential problems they may have.

The first item is the infinidirt wand, and my main problem with this is that it is basically useless. You can buy dirt from the builder for the same price, place one, and then use the builders wand to place infinite of it as long as it is in the inventory. It would be nice if it were to place, say a 5x5 area of dirt if you upgrade it or something, but at it's current state I see this to be a pretty useless or maybe optional item.
The next is Prismapump, and I LOVE THE PRISMAPUMP!!! It gives some use to prismarine, makes the grueling task of placing water easier, and is a very good item. I do hope that this is reusable, and I hope it can go the whole 160 blocks of the island. Other than that, this is pretty nice and I do hope that if it isn't reusable that it isn't that expensive.
Now, the hoe of great tilling. I love the hoe of great tilling, and I have no problem with it.
The last is the Basket of seeds, and the main problem with this is that it might replace replenish. I feel with potato and carrot farming, you could farm a row, and then turn back and place with the basket of seed. I feel that this would make replenish decently bad, since it is expensive and their may be a cheaper alternative.

Tis tis all for now, and just like the last leak, I feel these have a lot of things that need to be changed before the update is fully released.

title: I did it. I finished maxing the ALMIGHTY MELON HELMET (again)!
body:
Yup, it's that time again!
After saying under a month ago (in this post) that I finally finished maxing the melon helmet, the devs went and added more enchants.
Go figure.
No loss, this just gives me an excuse to waste more coins! I present to you:

The Ultimate Almighty Mega Supreme Overlord Ultimate Omega Ultimate Melon Helmet of doom! 






If you want an explanation of why I used Bank V and Godly reforge, I explained it all in my last post. For convenience's sake, I'll do a TL: DR (edit: before it said TLR lmao) of why I chose those.


Bank V: They keep adding new ultimate enchants, it would be really hard to keep up with all of them. Instead, I just added the meme ultimate enchant and called it a day.
Godly reforge (instead of Renowned): Godly is a legacy reforge now (impossible to get), so I kept it.

Now, let's get into the $Money$
Wanna see how much money I spent on this?

I thought so.

Keep in mind that this is about the price that all of these items cost at the time I bought them, or my best estimate that I can find by looking at graphs of item data.

Godly reforge: ~1000 coins
10 Hot Potato Books: ~1.2m coins
5 Fuming Potato Books: ~5.1m coins
Recombobulator: ~5.8m
Bank V Book: ~30k
Thorns 3 Book: ~1k
Growth 6 and Protection 6 Books: ~12m
Growth 7 and Protection 7 Books (to go over the original g6p6 books): ~28m
Respiration 3 Book: ~1k
Aqua Affinity Book: ~1k
Big Brain V Book: ~10m
Rejuvenate V Book: ~500k
Total: ~62,634,000 coins
also, sorry if I've spent more than your networth on a leather helmet (I'm not actually sorry)

My biggest regret throughout this whole process was being hasty when adding my fuming books. Now, I have to use anvil uses to add new books. However, I'll make it work 

please stop adding enchantments admins I beg please please please

Huge thanks to everyone who has donated to help make this possible, you all are about as almighty as the helmet is!
maybe a little less, it is pretty h*cking almighty you've gotta admit

For now, this is The Ultimate Almighty Mega Supreme Overlord Ultimate Omega Ultimate Melon Helmet of doom! (until they add growth 17,000 and prot 17,000)

So I had thought of something for mage class An Epic Dungeon Item called The Spell Book the item would be an enchanted book dropped from f6,f7 and f8.

It would have 5 different spells I will list below It would be cycled by Left-Clicking and it would be activated by Right-Clicking.

1.Rush:Gives all players within an 8 block radius 15 strength and 25 speed for 20 seconds with a 1 Minute and 30 seconds cooldown.
Mana Cost 150
2.Barrier:It would basically be the barrier Scarf and The Professor have but it only lasts for 10 seconds and has a 2 Minute cooldown.
Mana Cost 400
3.WitherLord: Shoots 3 wither skulls at enemies in an 8 block radius with a 1 second cooldown.
Mana Cost 50
4.Heal.Heals all players in an 10 block radius to max health with a 30 second cooldown (basically a worse version of wish)
Mana Cost 50
5.EarthQuake: It would be similar to the yeti sword ability but instead of sending the terrain far it would have very little distance but do massive damage and have a 10 second cooldown.
Mana Cost 125

Getting this from a dungeon chest would be rare maybe a 5% chance and it would cost 2Mil maybe.

title: Overflux vs plasmaflux is it worth for its price (no reactions so far lol)
body:
plasma stats:
125% more base mana regen
3% of max hp regen
all heals by 7.5%
35 strength


owoflux:
100% base mana regen
2.5% of max hp
5% all heals
25 strength


now we shall be averaging the boosts from owo to plasma all together and adding that to price so we can get a rough estimate if worth it and what price it is and is not

25% increase more regen on mana
40% increase more strength
50% increase all heals
20% increase in the percentage of max hp

it is clearly better but is it worth it we will be calculating an average of all percentages to give a score of increase and scale it to price
it is a
33.75% increase
28.333333333333 not counting all heals cuz that is occasional
addition these as percentages to 50 mill or price of owo flux

the price of value in stats is 68.725 mill for all increase stats from owoflux
64.150 mill not counting the all heals witch is barely used other then the swords
if anything more the price is not worth for stats

What's so special is that it allows you to fully personalize its elements to become your very own minion tier list based on your profile, which include minion tiers, form of products (even in e-block form!), whether or not diamond spreadings are equipped, and more.















Events Timer

title: [COLOSSEUM REVAMP]
body:
The colosseum in skyblock hasn't been getting many updates/leaks/anything tbh, I think there needs to be some sort of pvp thing.

Idea 1: Betting

People can bet coins, say I bet 500k that I'll win a duel (could apply to items, too) against some guy, and he accepts. You get a standard classic duel kit, but with a few twists, like maybe a magic tool instead of a bow that shoots a laser than does 2 hearts, and instead of a rod it could be a snowball launcher from Jerry Event. Whoever wins the duel gets 500k from the opponent. This can be good for people that are just starting out, or end game players who just wanna risk it all. It won't be too big of an economy crash because you can only bet what you have, and you probably only should be able to 1v1 once or twice a day, because if you could do it infinitely it'll break everything.

Idea 2: Tournaments

Like the bedwars tournament or the Blitz tournament, players will participate in a Colosseum tournament. Everyone has standard items as stated above, and the higher of a placement you get, the more items you get. Players will compete to get limited items and prizes that only will exist once there. There is a specific mayor called "Sparter" that makes a 24 hour long tournament for the skyblock players to compete in, and is a very rare mayor like Scorpius. If you place in the top 5 thousand, you win 500k coins, a cosmetic trophy, and a set of Chariot Armor, and the buffs of Chariot Armor are:

+25 crit damage for each armor piece, +150 hp, 100 defense, and 10 speed. Everything gets buffed twice as much when riding on an animal.

If you are top 1 thousand, you earn 750k coins and a talisman called Spartan Artifact, being a legendary talisman, and it's ability is: "When killing a mob, gain 2 strength for 5 seconds. This will stack up to 50."

If top 500, gain 1m coins and a special staff called "Spartan Cannon", which stats are:

+200 dmg
+100 str
+50 crit damage

Item ability: When you left click, shoots a cannon ball that does 10,000 magic damage.

If top 100, gain 5m coins and an enchant called "Conqueror's Sight V" which can be applied to the helmet, and multiplies the effects of all swords by 1.2.

If top 10, gain the reforge stone known as "Spartan Sapphire" and earn 10m coins. The stone buffs swords by giving 100 damage and 100 strength, making it the best reforge.

If top player, gain the sword called "Sword of the Spartans" and 40m coins, and the sword does 400 damage and 300 strength, completely outranking everything else. This player also gets a special name tag called "I AM SPARTA" on the side of their name in tab.

I'll add more ideas if I think of any, thanks for reading, and also, I don't have photoshop or anything like that so I can't make pictures demonstrating the items.

title: Dragon update idea
body:
Hello! 
I have noticed that dragons have kind off become a little boring at this point. There are less people doing dragons and the summoning eye prices have gone down. So i have thought of a couple of ideas that might make dragons more entertaining.
1: dragon hunter armor:
this could be a new drop that dragons can give you(instead of the aotd or reforge stone)
it would give you some strength and crit damage, as well as making you double jump. It would also add 75 base damage to the 
Dragon hunter sword:
this would be a sword around about as strong as an aotd, but it would deal extra damage to dragons, and it also would have an ability that would make you deal double the damage on the third hit.
I also thought it might be cool to have dragons be able to drop a dragon egg, that you can place on your island.
a dragon egg would give you the stat that the armor would give you (unstable crit chance, strong gives strength etc)
as well as making dragons stronger. make every end crystal heal them 1million health IF the crystal stays alive for 5 seconds. and make the attacks stronger.
also make dragons immune to ferocity and make damaging pots worthless against them
These are just some examples of what i think could make dragons more interesting. Some of these might be to overpowered or underpowered, so if you see something that should be different, please tell me. (Also sorry for my bad English)
Stay save everyone

title: Dungeon Classes as Avengers (and a little Umbrella Academy)
body:
The other day I realized that mages were a lot like Ironman, and that got me thinking...each dungeon class is a lot like one of the Avengers. To wit:

MAGES are like Ironman. Their play style depends on using the most expensive gadgets to beat the bad guys. They're sometimes prone to arrogance, but at the end of the day you're really glad to have them on your side.

TANKS are like Professor Hulk. They are basically indestructible, though they don't do as much damage as they would if they let themselves go berserk (that is, be like regular Hulk). In my experience, they tend to be the most thoughtful, introspective players. (As evidence of this, see the really good recent post in which a tank analyzes their class's problems and makes a plea for them to be solved.)

HEALERS are like Vision/Jarvis. They are the smartest class, in my estimation, since they are always juggling several variables in order to determine how to maximize their team's chances of success. They are also the most selfless class, in a non-showy way.

ARCHERS are like Hawkeye (duh), but that's a little too on-the-nose. So I'll say that they are like the Winter Soldier--highly skilled assassins who can take out any target. (Side note: SkyBlock should add more explosives to archers' bag of tricks--they can set up explosives and then stand on a ledge somewhere with a detonator. How fun would that be?! SkyBlock, make this happen!)

Finally, BERSERKERS are like Captain America (if they use the Flower of Truth=Cap's shield), Black Panther (if they use Livid Dagger=attack speed!), or regular Hulk (if they use Giant's Sword). In general, they're probably closest to Captain America, since they're good at dealing with loads of lower-powered bad guys but need a team to beat the big bosses. And they tend to feel a sort of rivalry with Ironman/mages!

I guess I'm a little bored. And I miss the MCU. Come back soon, world!

P.S. The Umbrella Academy only works for certain classes: Tanks are Luther, Archers are Diego, and Healers are Five. I don't see a good parallel for Mages or Berserkers, though some mages think they're Vanya...

title: [Idea] Colosseum Trials
body:
#1 Parkour:
Parkour across a course in:
5 minutes - Rabbit's Tail (+1 speed)
2 minutes - Speeder's Dagger (+60 speed while held)
1 minute - Sparklight (A nether star. No uses are notable)
30 seconds - Fluorescent Algae (Mastiff Helmet Upgrade, gain 10 hp per 100 strength (base = 100 strength))

#2 PvP
Do as much damage to your opponent as possible (1-minute bot):
1k damage - Strongarm Talisman (+1 strength)
60k damage - Strongarm Ring (+3 strength, requires talisman)
500k damage - Strongarm Artifact (+5 strength, requires ring)
4 mil damage - Strongarm Relic (+8 strength, requires artifact)

#3 Click Practice
Yeah, the same thing but it's based on the number of hits (1 minute no hit delay, ferocity counts)
50 clicks - Tiger's Paw (+1 ferocity)
100 clicks - Demon Lance (+100 damage, +20% attack speed)
250 clicks - Maddox's Phone Number (picked this up on the ground, used to craft Maddox batphone)
500 clicks - Demon Talon (+3 ferocity, requires paw)
