title: The Issue with City Projects (High Effort)
body:
So City Projects were pretty scuffed the first time around. But everything was fixed with the second set right? Well partially...

While the second set of City Projects has been progressing significantly faster than the first, there is a new issue with the contributions. The much higher contribution requirements worked exceptionally well for about the first week, with both projects receiving approximately 40,000 daily contributions. People were donating 3 or even 4 times a day to get these new perks, especially the Maddox discount. But while this worked for the smaller Farmer House project, an issue arose with the Bartender project. Everyone who was donating for the Maddox Discount REACHED their requirements. And just like that, contributions have slowed to a halt. The project is receiving around 15,000 daily contributions, or even less. The main driving force of the previous contributors have stopped donating, and the project will take another whole week to finish at this rate.

So now that we know the issue, what's the solution? While staff could set separate donation requirements for the discounts and perks for each City Project based on projected active donators. this strategy would require a lot of effort to maintain, and could be inaccurate. Instead, I believe staff should set these contribution requirements as PERCENTAGES of the total contributions. For example, the 4th perk on the Bartender's Brewery required 24 individual donations, and the total project requires 650,000 donations. This was a little too small in my opinion, as it only costs about 100,000 coins a day to contribute all 4 times, and donations stopped rolling in consistently around 85% completion (550,000/650,000 total). With the new system admins would look at the number of active contributors for each project, and set a requirement say to be within the top 80%, 60%, 40%, and 20% of contributors. Now instead of everyone stopping at 85% completion, players would be forced to compete all the way until the end of the project. Overall this would upset some people, as it would undoubtedly make the 4th perk harder to obtain, but I believe this competition would make City Projects more engaging, raise general community interest, and keep those contributions flowing in!

TLDR: City projects stopping because contribution goals are reached. By changing to a percentage based system, players will donate for the entirety of the project, making the projects quicker, and raising community interest.

title: Community Projects - Renovations
body:
Renovations​
Once a community project is complete, once in a while, it needs to have renovations. As of right now, the community projects are unfair for new players - if you miss out on this opportunity, it's 10% slayer cost reduction, which adds up overtime. And once you miss it, you're never going to be able to get it back. I propose renovations every 2-3 months. I can imagine the build team making the place about to be renovated look cracked and rusty. These will add new features, and enable new players to gain the same perks. When the building is fully completed, then all previous perks will be removed (for that building) and will be replaced with the new perks. For instance:

The Blacksmith Workplace is getting rusty. Help renovate it to gain access to special perks!
4 --> Access the shop 1 day earlier.
8 --> Access the shop 2 days earlier.
16 --> Shop items are 5% cheaper.
24 --> Reforging is 5% cheaper (including the cost to apply reforge stones)

New Shop Items:
- Bloodlust I (named after the UHC sword, also works the same way as expertise and compact): Gain 1 strength for 5 seconds after any enemy kill. Also gain 1% more combat xp. 50 kills to level up! - 4000 bits
- Bunny's Legs: Grants 50 attack speed and 5 ferocity on legendary weapons, provides swift reforge, requires mining 10 to use, only appears in shop after killing 250 bunnies, costs 100,000 coins to apply - 250,000 coins.
Bunny legs are rare, since bunnies are extremely hard to catch. I wonder who caught it.
- Tiger Claws: Grants 50 strength, 5 crit chance, 20 ferocity on legendary weapons (I'm too lazy to do the rest and tell me if this needs balancing), provides clawed reforge, requires mining 25 to use, costs 1,000,000 to apply - 2,500,000 coins.
It is said that tigers had one of the strongest claws. But how did this end up here?
- Reforge talisman: obtained after reforging 100 different items, reforging is 1% cheaper (uncommon) - 250,000 coins
- Reforge ring: obtained after reforging 250 different items, reforging is 2% cheaper (rare) - 500,000 coins and Reforge talisman
- Reforge artifact: obtained after reforging 500 different items, reforging is 3% cheaper (epic) - 1,000,000 coins and Reforge ring
All items reforged prior to this count.

This could go on for the slayer community project, and perhaps give a new type of slayer or a tier 5 spider. And perhaps for the farm one, adding more stuff to farming collections.

I feel like renovations will make it easier for admins to pump out small content updates, which favors old players, and help new players gain access to the perks which they are missing out on (just imagine if you missed out on the 10% slayer cost reduction permanently, wouldn't that suck?).

Also, I propose two more components to each building, but keep the 24 hour cooldown. This makes it so that instead of having to contribute for 6 days, you only have to contribute for 4. Neat!

Feel free to tell me any suggestions!

TL;DR: Basically renovations add new features and give new perks but take away the old ones.

title: Why i think zealot grinding is a bad money making method [CONTROVERSIAL]
body:
So everybody says zealot grinding is a good money making method and I would agree with them but i cant.

So here's why zealot grinding is bad
1. Fully based on luck
2. It costs a lot to actually have good stuff to do it
3. Everybody does it thus zealots are harder to get

Now let's talk about the reasons
1. We all know that once you reach 420 zealots your chance of getting one goes up by 10% that's not big buff I once spent 2-3 hours getting to 1123 and finally got one

2. The new meta with grinding efficiently is having an fscythe with full set of wise dragon armor wise armor is going for 2mil rn and an fscythe is going for 7mil add those up and that equals 9mil you can be spending that 9 mil on dungeons gear
So you have to spend about 9mil to make zealot grinding effective

3. This one ties into #2 and that's everybody does zealot grinding most the people that grind zealots use the setup I said earlier so if you dont have that setup you're going to have a bad time
The advantage of having the setup I said is its ranged so you dont actually have to go up to the zealot

Thanks for reading also inb4 just mad cause bad

title: My thoughts on the farming update leaks!
body:
So recently, Minikloon posted some stuff on his twitter. He deleted it, but you can see both leaks in this video.






So, the main problem about this update is the increase to the farming cap. This is seen in the first leak, and it seems that the top 5% of people who collect the most of a specific item get a increase to there farming level. From the picture, it seems that the new cap will be around 55. At the current exp table, it seems this would be a minimum of 20,000,000 more to get to farming 55, if we are guessing that it will be the same exp per level to get from 49 to 50 (which probaly won't be true, since it increases every level so far). So, this is going to be bad. This is a lot of exp, and even if you have enough exp, it probaly won't be easy to get a chance at unlocking these levels.
The next problem is the farming sweats. There are a lot of people who have farming 50, and these players will have a HUGE advantage in this event. This will make getting the new tickets to buy the items that are added to the farm merchant locked behind either having farming 50 or the ability to play for 5 days and 4 hours straight without sleeping and stopping. As a person with a busy schedule, this means that it is almost impossible for me to ever get these special items, since I can only play for around 2/3 hours a day. This is horrible, since the only way to get these farming levels is to grind for the whole event.
The next problem is in the second tweet, where he says, and I quote "Earn tickets from participating in Jacob's contests. Spend them on better hoes and make farms in one nanosecond" There are two things about this tweet I need to talk about.
The first is that these items will cost Jacob's tickets, which can only be gotten in the collection event. That means this situation is basically the rich get richer. If you win one of these events, you can get better at the event. This makes it harder for new players that join after the first few of these events, since they won't have easy access to these helpful items. I really hope that these Jacob's tickets are sold at the bazaar, since that would help new players be able to do better in these events.
The next thing is that you can build farms in a nanosecond. The only way I can see this possible is a almost ctrl c ctrl v type of item, which is horrible. This would make the builder wand completely useless, and makes people who build farms for a living have no purpose. This would help making farms better, but I feel that they could have done this better. Maybe they could have added something that placed water faster, or made something that would help the builder wand with farms (like making them possible to place crops).

In total, I think that they need to do quite a few things before this update is released.

title: I lost 120M coins to a new dungeon wipe bug
body:
On monday I was in the middle of a floor 6 dungeon run when suddenly i was kicked from the lobby with an error message I've never seen before (screenshot) and after the party leader warped me back into the dungeon, I got multiple messages in chat saying several of my items failed to load, after that the dungeon crashed and the whole party was kicked. I took screenshots of the error messages and when clicking to join my island, I noticed multiple items missing from my inventory including a 5 star maxed fabled shadow fury, flower of truth with the same upgrades as the sword, my 5 star florid zombie sword and my full set of shadow assassin armor complete with 5 stars, rejuv 5 and fully upgraded using livid fragments.
I made a bug report and dmed an admin about this and got zero replies so I am making this post to raise awareness about the bug and to know if there are any other victims or theories about the cause. I am NOT asking for my money back from no one except admins nor expect it since I'm not a youtuber/known player, and what I mainly want is for this bug and similar inventory wipes to be fixed.

title: The Problem with Dungeons.
body:
So, Dungeons has a big problem - and it's why I do Zealots for money. Still.

So what is this problem?

It's not accessible to level 14-17 players.

Let me explain:

Levels 1-5 have F1, F2, maybe F3. There are loads of parties.
Levels 5-10 have F2, F3, maybe F4. There are again, plenty of parties.
Levels 10-14 have F4, and fail at F5 and F6. Plenty of parties for this.

But, I'm Catacombs XVII (17) and I want to do F6 for the EXP and money. The thing is, despite my almost 27 skill avg, 300k slayer exp, and over 200mil networth (sky.lea.moe/stats/Cybermarb/coconut) and the fact that I can, with a good party, beat F6 - all parties are either bunches of level 13-14 players trying to get someone to carry them, level 18-23 people doing pretty well, or 23+ tryhards destroying Sadan.

So - how am I supposed to do Dungeons? I have to spend usually 20+ minutes monitoring the Party Finder to find a party.

title: Idea for hypixel?
body:
Since the Dark Auction exists, i think a seperate auction house should exist.

Starting simply, you can use coins to buy dragon armor/frags, and the dragon container.

benefits of the 'Dragon Auction' could help players who keep getting frags/losing cash on dragons to actually get items they want. It will also balance out the inflation of the economy by introducing something interesting.

One of the negatives is that the price cap is set to frags price of bazaar, so if superior frags are 250k/frag, and chestplates cost 80 frags, the price cap would be set to 20,000,000 for a chestplate. This effectively would make fragments much more viable, but able to be afforded by people who had low prices, instead of actually having to bid on random things, like chestplates, but now they dont have to compete during this.

If you support my idea, go ahead give it a yes in the poll, but if not, give it a no.

The dragon container allows players to sell dragon items to the Dragon Auction. This allows players to convert 10 frags to 1 enchanted gold ingot. If not enough players give 10 frags to the Dragon Auction, it will only have the Dragon Container instead.

title: Just a list of Skyblock Item ideas.
body:
I wanted to have a list of ideas, it'd be really nice if they were added, but I also want to know what the community says about them.
Also, items that I made posts about were tweaked, to be less OP.

1. Metronome
Well, you might have seen my earlier post about the Metronome, you'd know what I'm talking about. Have you ever just wanted more Pokemon references? Or maybe you want that sweet, sweet Molten wave, but just don't have 100mil in the bank. Or perhaps you just like to gamble. Whatever the case, this may be the item for you (if you have a surprising amount of luck).

The Metronome is an item that, when used, uses a random skill for the cost of 50 mana, that's fine and dandy, until we get to the real meat. Not only can you casts randomized spells, but the metronome can also be deadly, along with spells, the spells can backfire and deal a random% of your max HP, the spells have a 10% chance of backfire, but that still means you should be careful. And, if you're anything like my older brother, stay away from this item. (My older brother is so unlucky, that others around him just get luckier)


Spoiler: Crafting Recipe










2. Sacrificial Dagger
The Sacrificial Dagger is an item that I wrote about, but I renamed it and balanced it up. Have you ever just played Persona 3 and wanted to summon your own persona? Well, sucks it's not a gun, it's a dagger. Only true gamers would get that reference. Maybe you want to do self harm because you didn't get the reference. Or perhaps you just need a way to be a tank, but also be useful. Here's an item you should be interested in!

The Sacrificial Dagger is a dungeon weapon that has +100 dmg and +90 Str, however, the ability is what you want, for a mere 35% of your max HP + a Healing drought (Cannot heal) for 10 seconds and a 15 second cooldown, you can deal massive amounts of damage to every monster within 10 blocks (10 meters), of course the damage scales with your HP, 10 times, to be exact. So while mages deal like 10k damage with this, seasoned tanks'll dish out way more than 500k, outdamage those mages.

3. Condensed Joy
Condensed Joy is a Reforge stone that, when applied to armor, gives the "Jolly" prefix, +10 speed, +35 HP, and 1% more Gifts During Gift Attack. You can get it by, you guessed it, opening gifts. There's really nothing more to say about this item.

4. Werewolf Talisman/Ring/Artifact
Hey, hey, hey! I bet you like Ferocity with Werewolf armor! But what if you want MORE Ferocity, this is the item for you! The Werewolf Talisman/Ring/Artifact gives +2/+4/+8 Ferocity with the rarities Uncommon/Rare/Epic. Although, quite expensive, that's normally how Skyblock works.


Spoiler: Crafting Recipes



PS, All the "leather" is Werewolf skin, I don't have a texture for it yet.














5. Jerry Blaster
If you've ever played Gungeon, you'll likely know what this does. Have you ever just wanted to destroy Minibosses and regular Bosses, but you don't want to harm their underlings.. for whatever reason. Or maybe you just want to kill a boss on your own. Or perhaps you like meme items. Whatever the case, this Jerry Item will sure put a Jerry on your Jerry! Jerry.

The Jerry Blaster is a dungeon item that shoots Jerrys at enemies, dealing 1 damage at the cost of 1 HP. Y'see, the Jerry Blaster has a not-so-secret ability that is displayed on the item's lore, It can deal ridiculous damage to Bosses and Minibosses, though it may not be of use to people about floor 2, that's why damage scales depending on the floor dealing 10k more damage than before. It also requires Catacombs 10.

Please reply any changes I should make, so these items aren't ridiculously OP or UP.

title: [IDEA] Floor 9 Storm Boss Fight
body:
As we're waiting for the next floors to come out, I've decided to make some ideas for the upcoming floor 9 boss, storm. I chose storm due to him having the most clear theme yet can be made into many things. Hope you enjoy!


Spoiler: The wall of text



Actually, reading would be boring and won't show the ideas as clearly. Why not some actual gameplay?










Spoiler: FIGHT BREAKDOWN



This fight features storm, the elementalist, with 4 unique phases, each with different abilities!
The fight takes place in a large arena, surrounded by mountains and covered with clouds. It is outdoor to let storm use his weather powers to its best!
I recommend watching the video before reading these!


Spoiler: Phase 1 - The Disciples



Storm greets you, then summons 5 disciples to fight you.
Each disciple has 10mil HP has has 3 different abilties:
- Teleport around the arena
- Summon a streak of lightning which moves forward
- Summon 2 streaks of lightning which moves diagonally.
While you can easily heal against this, getting hit multiple times in a row can be fatal especially if healer is not in reach. The lightning streaks move in a straight line and can be avoided to minimize taking damage.





Spoiler: Phase 2 - The Storm



Storms now fights you himself. A mechanic is introduced: From now on, getting hit by any attacks will prevent any forms of healing except for Wish for 15 seconds. Players should avoid getting hit at all costs!
Storm himself has 200mil HP and phase ends when he has 100mil HP. This phase features 4 abilities and a summon:
- Teleport randomly around the arena, indicated by line of particles. Players near him or his destination will take damage.
- Fires 5 evenly spread energy bolt forward.
- Rapidly fires a somewhat inaccurate barrage of energy bolts
- Creates waves of white energy which slowly homings into players.
- Summons Lightning Elementals which can jump around and deal damage when landing. They only have 500k HP and should easily be taken care of.
Starting from this phase, things start becoming different. Attacks will not hurt as much but will slowly wear down players until they die, preventing recovery if they are not careful.





Spoiler: Phase 3 - The Seasons



Storm fully recovers hp and shift into the next phase. This phase ends when he reaches 20mil HP.
He now introduces another restriction on the players: When using a movement abilty such as aote or grappling hook, all your movement abilties will be disabled for the next 5 seconds. Players have to be very careful about their positioning to minimize damage taken.
He transform into a seasonal elemental who cycle through seasons of the year and uses many abilities based on the season he is in. The cycle are in this order with these abilties:
Spring Downpour:
- Fires a constant stream of water.
- Summons many water geysers which constantly deals damage after a delay.
- Summons a large storm cloud which rains down mine orbs. Mines doesn't explode instantly so players can detonate them and run away safely
Summer Heatwave:
- Fires a spread of flame.
- Create heat clouds which slowly chases player and constantly deal damage.
- Summons a firestorm cloud, raining fireballs which creates massive explosions.
Autumn Windcurrent:
- Fires a gust shot which pushes players back
- Creates a line of autumn wind which moves forward, then dashes to the end of the line, slashing anyone in the way. This is repeated several times.
- Creates a tornado which slowly draws in players, dealing fatal damage to anyone in it and randomly firing leaf projectiles outwards.
Winter Hailfall:
- Lobs a large snowball which creates a lingering field of ice, slowing players.
- Fires a large ice bolt which splits into many smaller ones as it travels.
- Summons a blizzard which makes giant hail cubes fall down on players for a duration.
The attacks in this phase can be used in tandem and can be challenging for many. The movement restriction also makes it much harder to run away from attacks and makes using items like AOTE much more strategic. But this isn't the end yet.





Spoiler: Phase 4 - The Tempest



Storm once again fully heals. He commends you on making this far, but this will be the end for you!
He is now surrounded by "Cloud Shield", rendering most attacks on his useless while it is active. Tempest Clouds also starts spawning throughout the arena, zapping the ground at a nearby player's location after a delay.
This phase features 5 more different attacks which can demolish players not paying attention:
- Transforms into a ball of dark cloud, dashing around players leaving Remnants which explodes when players are nearby, dealing massive damage.
- Call several pairs of Tempest Wolves which charges towards player very quickly.
- Summons Tempest Shadow which chases players and perform a swipe attack when a player is nearby.
- Creates a shockwave followed by 8 waves of energy.
Occassionally he will fire a beam at one of the clouds, attempting to supercharge it. After 6 seconds, the cloud becomes black cloud which can strike repeatedly, leaving a static field which damages players walking through it.
Any attacks on the cloud that is currently being charged will make the cloud burst and send the charge right back at storm, exposing him to all attacks for a while! Players must be very quick to response to it or the phase can last for an extended amount of time.
Now, defeat storm!

Thanks for reading and hope you enjoyed!

title: My first effort post: The Combat Island (WIP only first level done)
body:
Hello everyone!
This is my first effort post so please mind the errors.



Spoiler: Introduction



So here is the idea. Currently dungeons and the end are the only places that provide significant minibosses that actually put up a fight, (the ender dragon and the golem just get pummeled too so that hardly counts) I am suggesting a new island dedicated to combat. This island would also help find content for those who hate doing this with other people as each boss is fought solo. Now this might sound just like dungeons but here is the thing, it is similar to the ender dragon and dungeons combined. Read on to find out.







Spoiler: The Island Layout



The island would look like a giant sandwich (just warning you this aspect of the island will need significant improvements as I am extremely bad at coming up with designs). Each layer of the island would require a different combat level and gets harder as you go. Each layer would have a different biome with different mobs on it.





Spoiler: “The Enderman’s Lair”






Spoiler: The mobs



Each biome would have different mobs as stated before. The first biome would be for people with combat 5 and higher. It contains enderman with 1500 health. Each time you kill an enderman it has a 1 percent chance of dropping a piece of the ender king.


Spoiler: The Ender King



You would need to obtain all 4 pieces of the ender king to summon him. The pieces would be as follows: The Ender Crown, The Robe of Strength, The Robe of Wisdom, The Robe of Steel, The Robe of Nutrition, The Leggings of Height (help I’m not creative, I can’t come up with something for his pants), and The Boots of Speed. Each Robe will give the boss a different ability. The boss has 50k health and deals 1000 damage per hit (is affected by defense) When the boss reaches 50 percent health, the nearest 15 enderman agro on you.


Spoiler: The Robes/The Boss Fight



The Robe of Strength: Every time his health lowers by ¼ he will do a charge attack dealing 50 percent of your health, normal damage buffed by 50 percent. The Robe of Wisdom: Sword is replaced by a staff, melee damage nerfed by 50 percent, When attacking, the boss shoots fireballs at you dealing 10 percent more than normal melee damage. Every time this boss’s health drops by ¼ he summons lightning, dealing ¼ of your health but disabling defense for 10 seconds. When he reaches 50 percent health he summons clones who look exactly like him (taken from Livid) But each clone only deals 30 percent normal damage. The Robe of Steel: This boss is based off of the protector dragon, except it will not be so underwhelming, each hit you deal to this boss deals 5 percent of that hit back to you, Every time his health drops by ¼ he takes 25 percent less damage. The last and final boss The Robe of Nutrition has 300 percent health and pretty much just that.





Spoiler: The Loot Tables



Each boss drops 3-16 enchanted eyes of ender
Each boss has a 10 percent chance to drop an orb of its kind (more on that later)
Each boss has a 1 percent chance to drop an aspect of the end
Each boss has a 0.001 percent chance to drop an ender slayer 7 book


Spoiler: Orbs



Each orb can be applied to the Raider’s Axe. The Strength Orb: Adds 30 strength and 30 damage, The Wisdom Orb: Gives +200 intelligence and adds the ability to teleport 4 blocks on right click, The Lead Orb: Gives 75 defense, and finally, The Healthy Orb: This orb gives 200 health. Each orb can be added in a normal anvil for 0 xp. Once all of the Orbs have been applied the axe becomes the Marauder’s axe, which adds 50 crit damage and 50 crit chance.














This is still a work in progress suggestions and constructive criticism is encouraged, the next level will be similar to gym battles in Pokémon.

title: Suggestion: Minion Wardrobe
body:
I have an idea that will allow players to easily optimize their minions to their current situation with nearly zero hassle. Allowing players to use different minion setups for different situations with ease.

Basically, you will have a minion wardrobe menu in your nether star (or some item) that has four options, choose minion setup, create minion setup, delete minion setup, and minion bag. By clicking create minion setup, the game will remember the positions and minion upgrades of all the minions on your island and will save that data. You will name the setup and from that point on you can access that setup from the choose minion setup section of the menu. Using the same name as another saved minion setup will overwrite that setup.

Now let's say you decide to navigate to choose minion setup and select a different minion setup (or the default un-deletable no minions active setup). First, all your active minions and the minion upgrades your minions were holding will go into your minion bag. Minion storages will not be collected, they will simply become inactive, but will reactivate if a minion is placed next to them. All the items in your minions will be collected and put into your minion materials bag, the player will never be able to interact with this bag. Then, items will be taken out of your minion bag to create the newly selected minion setup. If possible, materials from your minion materials bag will be deposited into minions of that corresponding type continuously until your minions materials bag is empty. For example, if you have 64 stacks of enchanted redstone blocks in your minions materials bag and you place a redstone minion, that minion will be instantaneously filled with enchanted redstone blocks until your minions materials bag is empty. Minions that are full will never be filled up by this bag though, even if they have automated shipping.

If you don't have the materials in your minion bag to make the new minion setup or if the positions of your minions in the new minion setup are obstructed then you will default to the no minions active setup and get an error message. The tier of your minions will not be accounted for when deciding whether or not you have adequate materials in your minion bag, simply the highest tier minions available will be used. When you switch minion setups every minion on your island will instantly break all the blocks they can reach and interact with (without getting the materials) in order to make room for the new minion setup.

The player can always take items out of and put items in their minion bag at will, and the minion bag will ideally have enough space so that space will never be a problem. If your minion bag is full when you change minion setups the items will be put into your storage bag until room is made in your minion bag. The way the player interacts with delete minion setup is pretty self explanatory so I won't explain it.

title: Is Tiger Pet OP Now?
body:
With the addition of ferocity, the tiger pet was changed from a Level 100 legendary having 20% to strike twice (20% more damage on average) to 100 ferocity. Assuming you have 0 other ferocity bonuses, this literally DOUBLES your damage. If you have 100 ferocity without the pet, it gives 50% more damage. If you have 200 without the pet, it gives 33% more damage. This is much more powerful than the old ability. Only with 400 ferocity without the pet will it give 20% more damage.

Afaik, it is hard to increase ferocity to 100 without this pet, so it should give more than 50% extra damage. From the description on the patch notes, it seems like this extra damage is multiplicative with bonuses like attack speed, strength, and crit damage.

Am I missing something, or has no big youtuber exposed this and blew up the price yet?

title: [Lore] [14/14] Catacombs Dungeon Journals
body:
I currently have 14 out of the 14 total dungeon journals completed, I will be updating this thread constantly for any new journals I get. Feel free to use this thread for lore discussion and bumps are appreciated as well <3

Year 1531


Spoiler: Karyelle’s Diary













































Important Events:

Dark magic is discovered within the Catacombs
The undead have presumably been ransacking tombs
Mage Association is introduced
Year 1531


Spoiler: The Study: Blavier of Myles





































Important Events:

Mage Association begins conducting experiments on the undead within the Catacombs
Zombies are discovered to have abnormal regeneration and desire for human flesh
Zombies can give birth to baby zombies
Both zombies were exterminated
Year 1531


Spoiler: The Expedition: Volume 1





















Important Events:

The king sends a garrison of soldiers and mages to investigate the Catacombs
Year 1531


Spoiler: Uncanny Remains

































Important Events:

The Wither King is introduced
Year 1531


Spoiler: The Expedition: Volume 2

























Important Events:

The garrison rests in a crypt
The tombs are discovered to be looted and ransacked
Year 1531


Spoiler: Grim Adversity









































Important Events:

Albert, a soldier is killed by a unidentified creature
Year 1531


Spoiler: The Expedition: Volume 3













































Important Events:

A wither skeleton takes out 3 soldiers in the garrison
The Wither King’s name is revealed: Kaeman
Year 1531


Spoiler: The Expedition: Volume 4

















































Important Events:

The garrison decides to end the expedition and return home
They are ambushed by a swarm of undead, resulting in a desperate battle
A soldier becomes possessed by some unknown entity
The writer appears to have been killed
Year 1531


Spoiler: The Walls





































































































Important Events:

General Dan is killed by a Wither
The rest of the garrison is presumably killed, while the writer escapes
The writer becomes lost as the walls are constantly shifting
He ends up going insane from the Catacombs
Year 1531


Spoiler: The Eye





































Important Events:

The writer, Sadan encounters The Watcher
He seems to be the only one that can sense it, most likely from his necromancer traits
The Watcher presumably convinces Sadan to join the Wither Lord
Year 1531


Spoiler: Aftermath

























Important Events:

The journal is told from an undead perspective
The Wither from The Expedition V4 is revealed to be Necron
Solomon was captured
Year 1138


Spoiler: The Apprentice 





























Important Events:

Necron is revealed to have been a human studying at the Academy
The journal is most likely told from from a friend of Necron
He wants to find out what happened to his parents 17 years ago
Believes forbidden magic to be the key to his questions
Year 1143


Spoiler: The Follower





























































Important Events:

The Calamity was the cause of deaths for many parents including Lathrop, and most likely Necron and Scarf as well
A breach was opened by the Calamity at the top of the hub mountain
The Watcher and Lathrop have a strong connection to the breach, which is probably where the Watcher originated from
Year 1138


Spoiler: The Apprentice, Part 2





























































Important Events:

The dean of the Mage Academy is revealed to be main character's father
Some unknown individual gives them a dark spell, possibly scroll from the Dean’s vault
The person ponders using the invisibility spell to break into the vault.

Video summarizing the lore:

title: How To Start Skyblock As A Beginner!
body:
This is how you start skyblock as a beginner! The 1st step is to do /hub and then go slightly to the right and up and start farming some wheat. Sell that wheat to get a rookie hoe at the farm merchant (to the right of spawn, don't go too far), and keep farming wheat until you are farming 7. This should take about 8 minutes if you are doing it right. Next, craft 5 hay bales to craft the farming tailsman with 4 seeds and 5 hay bales.


Spoiler: Recipe



https://hypixel-skyblock.fandom.com/wiki/Farming_Talisman (scroll down for recipe



Sell all the leftover wheat and seeds, and buy a pickaxe at the mining merchant (go to the left of spawn, not to far though, and go up until you see a miner on your right side). You want to buy a promising pickaxe, and then go to the coal mine! Mine the coal as it gives more mining exp. After you get mining 1, go to the gold mine portal and mine coal (just mine there, there's more coal and space) until you are mining 7. Sell all of the cobble coal iron and gold (if u mined other things). 

Now, you should buy a jungle axe at the auction house (it's the biggest building close to spawn). It should cost about 1k-20k because some people like to bully new players. OR you can buy a promising axe at the lumber merchant (go through the bazaar and keep walking forward.) now start mining trees till you are foraging 7. 

Now you unlocked the bazaar, you should focus on combat! Go to the weaponsmith and buy an undead sword. Now you have to unlock the deep caverns, a spooky place if you don't know how to block hit without armor. The deep caverns portal is located in the gold mine. Go to the spawn of the gold mine and just keep running forward.

Now you have unlocked the deep caverns. You should try to find the lapis quarry and not use the glitch because you might lose the coins or get warned or banned. But if you want to use the glitch, check out this video (even though i don't recommend doing it):


Spoiler: Glitch Video










now start selling lapis armor pieces until you get enough money to buy ender armor! also get combat 14.
welp thats the end of my somewhat effort post

TL;DR: get farming, foraging and mining 7, grind lapis pieces

title: entirety of skyblock forums in one sentence
body: I did this with the SkyBlock minigame and after realizing that @Dumplingsushi is also going to do this, I must do it myself, so here is a very long sentence covering the entirety of SkyBlock forums, basically I have no idea what to talk about since this is just forums, there's nothing interesting to talk about 3 hours for, so let's just cover the forums and subforums, so SkyBlock forums are for questions, ****posts, suggestions, polls, etc all (supposed to be) skyblock related, of course, there's always ****posters or bad people who necropost everywhere, make dumb posts, etc so yeah that's sorta bad, anyhow (I'm going to say anyhow like 80 times so be prepared), there's also other subforums, including Creative Corner (place for SkyBlock art stuff, but tons of people post random stuff on here including skyblock ideas so actual artists get ticked off), it's full of really good art though, so you should really check it out, leave a helpful comment and reaction, follow a few artists while you're at it, anyhow, other than that, there's also the Ideas and Feedback section, where you can put skyblock ideas along with tons of other ideas, however, no one goes to this subforum, so if your idea thread is moved from SkyBlock forums to Ideas and Feedback, then you won't expect any replies or reactions for a looooooooooooooooooong time, other than that, there's also patch notes where admins upload patch notes (covering any new updates), then there's the Island Showcase where people upload pictures displaying their epic builds or islands, also there's a ton of ****posts there that aren't good islands, anyhow, there's also Guides and Strategies, where people upload the following: 1) guides 2) strategies 3) more random ****posts by people who can't read, there's also Bug Reports where you can upload bugs, and yeah, I guess that's about it, if I didn't cover a certain subforum, then it's because it's either not part of skyblock or it's irrelevant, so yeah, I think that's all of skyblock forums, I guess other things to talk about would be the fact that skyblock forums are full of pain and dangerous people and circumstances so keep that in mind, okay bye.

title: Possible Farming item idea (The Mega Hoe)
body:
So I imagine this item to be some sort of diamond hoe but instead of doing one block at a time it hoes the 5 blocks in front (possibly more) so island farming would be easier. An example of where this would be useful is in pumpkin or potato farming where you gotta hoe a large portion of your platform to plant seeds and it takes hours to get the whole platform done. I understand that to more advanced players this doesn't mean much but to beginners this would be a huge help 

Also another item you could add on the side is an automatic dirt platform (There is already a stone platform item so i imagine this isn't too big of a request)

Let me know what you think, this is my first post

title: Pet help?
body:
I'm having a hard time with managing pets so I wondering if I could get help.
These are the rankings of the pets I see right now for each section
(E) Early game, (M) Mid game, (END) end game
Foraging: (#1) Ocelot (M), (#2) Monkey (END)
Farming: (#1) Rabbit (E), (#2) Elephant (END), (#3) Pig (M)
Mining: (#1) Silverfish (M), (#2) Endermite (M)
Fishing: (#1) Dolphin (E), (#2) Squid (END), (#3) Flying Fish (M)
Alchemy: Only the Parrot pet is worthy of being in this category (END)
Combat: (Remember that this is off the ones that I have experienced not the general ones that are in the game)
Mage- Sheep (M)
Melee- (#1) Wither Skeleton (M), (#2) Griffin (END),(#3) Tiger (E), (#4) Wolf (M), (#5) Enderman (E), (#6) Lion (E)
Grinding- Black Cat (END)

title: [IDEA] Demolition Wand
body: This item can be bought at the bits shop. The Demolition Wand is like the build's wand but the other way around. It destroys anything that it used on and all the blocks will go inside it like the builder's wand's storage. To use this item you would right click on a block and any other block connected to the Wand would be instantly deleted and go inside the storage. title: How to make an Afk Pool (Both Types)
body:
This is the most commonly used pool the water flow moves the player in a circle making it seem as if the player is swimming preventing a kick due to being afk.






Below is a less commonly used type of afk pool, by utilizing water flow and the unique height advantage of a fence or cobblestone wall. It forces the player to jump repeatedly disallowing a kick due to afk by tricking the system into believing the player is active.
NOTE!!! I DO NOT RECCOMEND THIS ONE. Watchdog has been banning people for clicking constantly without moving, So players that have been placing weights on their mouses or keyboards etc, have been getting banned cause hypixel out of the blue changed their rule on this. I feel the jumping is in effect similar to this so use at own risk with this one. Also please note that block height changes and player character height changes have affected this pool in later versions optimal versions are 1.7-1.8.9.

In Ground View





Out Of Ground View

title: [Idea] Catacombs Minion
body:
Disclaimer: This minion, even at t11, will pale in comparison to manual runs, and you will never get special drops from chests
The catacombs minion is a drop from storm. It rarely comes in obsidian/bedrock chests and costs 3M to open.
It produces 3 items: Inflatable Jerries, Traps, and Decoys.
To upgrade it you need essence.
At t1 it's 960 seconds between actions.

title: Dungeon scams and how to not
body:
1) Dungeon carries
Check their sky.shiiyu.moe profile to make sure they actually can do the floor
Try not to get carries from rndom people, it is best to either get someone in your guild orjoin a discord server and ask there as usually tose things are moderated and they will be exposed helping to prevent others from getting scammed

2) Essence
Always ask for collat and make sure u know how much ur item is worth
If they dont offer collat then dont trust them
Make sure you check in the trades menu to see if they are actually giving the item requested for as collat, everytime you do so

3) To good to be true offers
One time i got scammed (not much only 400k) for a dungeon carry and after giving the scammer te money, he offered to upgrade one of my dungeon items for free. There's no such thing as free lunch. Often by making these "too good to be true" offers they catch you off guard as the "nice guy" and you let your guard down and don't check. Remember to ALWAYS ALWAYS ask for collateral. Having scrrenshots are not enough. (no i didnt fall for this one tho)

thank you for coming to my TED talk. That will be $14.99 thank you, jk.
Dont get scammed

title: 1 idea and 2 ****post [effort]
body:
I made a poll. And in the poll you saw 4 choices. Since poll was a tie, im going to make one of each one. I am very cool. I decided I want to be liked instead of dislike. I wil try make good post instead of bad post. I made idea ****post and good ****post. I am going to make PRO post from now on to become PRO. This was an effort post leave a like pls.
View attachment 2089917
Here are the posts i made hope u like 




Spoiler: idea






Spoiler: The Dark Depths



U thought this was gonna be good. Sike


Spoiler: Actually click this :)



This is an idea I have had for quite a while now and pertains to a new farming/foraging island. The areas of combat, mining, and fishing have pretty much become oversaturated with ideas and I couldn't seem to find any reason of coming up with an idea for those. Instead I choose to take a look at foraging as not much has been done after the park update and minor changes to tools and such. This is a wip. I will add more info.

The Dark Depths (please reply with a better name this sounds ****) is a new foraging/farming island that is farther behind the park and is a bit farther away from every other island. This is going to be important to the lore later. In this, night vision is disabled and the island grows continuously darker as you go further into the forest. Here is a small map that I made to display my visions for this sort of island:


Spoiler: Plans



These are kinda **** but I did them quite fast. Ill make these more detailed later
View attachment 2087879
This is the overview of the island
View attachment 2087882


The green part towards the center of the island is going to be a forest similar to the park with the game mechanics but is going to be much larger and dense. There will be a path going inside the forest all the way to the back that is surrounded by like 2 layers of unbreakable trees (to keep the effect) and will grow darker until you reach a cave in the mountain. This would be a quest spot to a new npc and lead to a sort of underground coliseum (similar to the thorn one but undergrounded and run down with vines everywhere. This in itself is going to be important for later but ill explain foraging and farming stuff first.


Spoiler: Forest



Keeping with the dark forest theme and whatnot the trees that can be broken will have a small chance to spawn a new set of mobs. These would give both foraging and combat xp and would be quite challenging. The trees themselves will be similar to the trees in the dark oak place of the part but much larger, taking several treecap hits to break just one tree. There would also be mushrooms everywhere for farming xp and some new stuff explained in the farming xp part. Not much will change in relation to treecutting other than the mobs:


Spoiler: Forestry mobs



These mobs would spawn when cutting trees randomly. Not all would be hostile.
Entrapped fairy
Fairy trapped deep in the core of the tree by dark magic hundreds of years ago
Will give you some valuable loot in return such as 250k-1m coins and some essence.

Trueborn Protector
This is basically an iron golem that spawns when breaking a tree.
Does a ton of damage (not going to say here for balancing's sake) and the only way to hurt it is to spawn undead woodsmen. This has a low chance of spawning.

Woodsmen
These spawn a bit more often then trueborn protector's and when killed drop their souls. This is a piece of wood and can spawn undead Woodsmen to help you against the trueborn protectors








Spoiler: The mines



The mines are an area at the very back of the dark forest. These are ancient and very dark. The first sign that you see as you approach the mines is a small 1 block crack in the wall. You walk through this in a small cramped room with an npc in one corner. Rocks and gravel adorn this room. The new npc is called Hercules. He says several voice lines:


Spoiler: Voice lines



[Hercules]: You have finally arrived humble adventurer
[Hercules]: Leave now while you still can.
[Hercules]: Tread deeper into these caves and see your worst nightmares


After these lines a new menu opens. He sells several items such as an op sword and a new item knows as the miner's light. This gives some form of night vision and is the only way to see inside the deeper portions of the cave. As you travel deeper in the cave, several mobs spawn that you must fight. In the center of the mountain there is the thorn arena I spoke about earlier but is much darker and worn. When you step inside you speak to a new npc to begin the gladiator trials. I will write more about this in the spoiler.


Spoiler: Gladiator trials



This is a new challenge. When you speak to the npc you are given the choice between the difficulty and the number of waves. This gives more coins based on how many enemies you have slain and there are also rare drops you can sell only to the new merchant. However, to receive these rewards, after the challenge, you must fight another player (like the coliseum) but with only iron armor and an iron sword. This can be done in 4s,2s, and solo with the difficulty scaling accordingly an the coins split.


Here is a map for reference


Spoiler: Image



View attachment 2090184

















Spoiler: Good ****post



Debunking the midas spoon. So people think that the Midas spoon is the best weapon and it so good for dungeons and omg so expensive. I will debunk this. This will require an in depth investigation in these spoons.
First: How were these spoons made?

This spoon shoots gold every time u use ur mana and it is made of pure gold. This means that a lot of gold is coming from somewhere and we dont know where. So, the first suspect is an interdimensional portal that shoot out the gold. Now this is a stretch but we must look at it from all angles. So let us say that it is in fact a portal. Where is this gold coming from. It can be fit to assume that this gold is coming from a melted pool and it solidifies when passing through the portal. However, where is this pool of gold. Everyone is too broke to have a pool of gold. Now lets assume this gold comes from magical means and that this gold is infinite. Now this has a chance of happening. We know many people like dupecical and myntrix use glitches and dupes. What if those are just cover-ups for this pool and they have access to it? Now this would be bad as inflation would break economy if there is infinite pool of gold blocks. I am sure that dupecical and other people with access to this would be richer so lets assume this isnt true. If this is true wow ur broke to have infinite gold and not being able to afford a 1b midas.

Now, let us assume that this gold is coming from the spoon. This means that the spoon is very concentrated gold and that it expands some of that gold and shoots it out. Sounds like something most of us know. This means that tiny fragments of gold are being lost. Therefore spoons actually have durability and one day when you shoot it you will find there is no spoon left. Now you have a stick. Whats a stick worth? I calculated it below


Spoiler: Value of stick



Lets say you get a coin every time you get a girlfriend. Now lets say this stick is worth the same amount of coins as you got from all these girlfriends. Assuming the average iq of a skyblock forumer, the value of a stick is:
0


Spoiler: Was I not subtle enough?



Let me say it again to u kids that didnt get it:
View attachment 2090243
that is 0. Meaning 0 coins.


Given that this is the most probable outcome, let us assume it is true. So now in like 20 years your spoon aint gonna be worth ****. Sell it to some non before they see this. Idk about u but I rather kill things with a sword than a stick.








Spoiler: Bad ****post

As you all know, there is currently a user going by the name Epic_Boi_YT on the forums, making suggestions for skyblock, often based on Fortnite.

Many people disagree with these suggestions, including myself, and find him very annoying.
Considering there is no one who plays Skyblock whit his name, it is quite possible that these are just ****posts (and pretty terrible ones at that), however there is also a possibility that he is completely serious.
My recommendation is, if you see a post by him, there are two things you can do:

title: Profile viewer (Voidstats) devlog (v0.93, W.I.P)
body:
Hello!
Finally done! Sorry for the late update, but the rewrite took longer than expected!

I'M NOT RELEASING IT RIGHT NOW, THIS IS JUST AN UPDATE ON HOW IT'S GOING

Quick status update on how my application is coming along for those who were interested:

Changelog:

Rewrote the entire codebaseto be more readable, and easier to spot/fix bugs
Almost no new features were added this week (and a half) because I was rewriting the entire project

Improved text quality even more
Added shadows to the player model 
Will be toggelable in the future if you don't like it

Added a weapons tab where you can see every weapon the player has
You can also select any of these weapons to see how much damage you deal with each one

Improved the pet system and changed it's location
There is now a seperate area for pets.
It only shows the user's active pet, but this will be changed in the next update.


Added a display for all the players online in Skyblock and some of the modes
Will (probably) be customizable in the future

Divided the gradients for more customizability
Added ferocity stat
The program will now automatically load the last saved profile
Added a lot more backgrounds (see spoilers)
Made the buttons smaller because they were giant 
Bug fixes:
Tuxedo not showing the correct texture (no texture to be exact)
Cached textures not saving as a .png file.
Every skill level was too high (1 level each)
Mythic pets now actually work and don't crash the pet system 
Wrong icons for dungeons
Updated some of the pet's description to include ferocity
Bows not being recognized as weapons
Texture proxy not working
Tier boosting pet items (tierboost, vampire fang) not working
Textures with random damage values (???) not displaying





Spoiler: Future plans:




End goal: Publish the application to the Microsoft Store
I know this isn't the most ideal place where people would want it, but it's better than a sketchy executable (can't sign it because I don't have the budget for that).
I will do more research into (maybe) finding a better place, and I thought about steam, but my application isn't something steam would approve, and it's too expensive.

Make the GUI customizable so you can choose where to position each "module".
Make customizable themes so you can choose your own colors, which the application will save
Add handy utilities like a talisman optimizer
Damage prediction
Accurate(ish) stats

Optimize performance






Spoiler: Backgrounds:







































Video showcase: 




Thanks for your support!

So if we take 1 year (365 days) and divide that with 1 skyblock year(5,4 days) we get 67,5 and if we multiply that with 100 we get 6 750
So in 100 years it will have been 6 750 sb years

title: Why the leaked farming update shouldn't be implemented.
body:
Why it sucks 

so there's this image floating around of a new farming system where players race each other in the amount of crops 
First of all, making it only accessible to a select few is just a bad idea, that's why they changed the skeleton horse pet from position to amount of candy earned. 
This is a lot worse as it allows players to make more stonks
if there are 100 of these events in a year then only like 500 players will have access to these rewards, 1 extra farming level and +2%, that's an extra 6% more chance for extra crops. Pretty broken in my opinion, and if they can stack in the near future if an omega sweat comes and gets farming 200 they'll be able to get a stable 15m from selling carrots the npc. 


How to fix it 
don't restrict all players. 

Make it accessible to all without having to nolife your computer just to get extra coin 

lower the rewards

+6% extra crops every event (idk when they happen) is really broken 
adding permanent stat buffs isn't really a good idea when it comes to this. 

maybe add a special pet or something that can be upgraded if you do well in the event? IDK 

tl;dr 
farm bad, farm op, nerf farm

body:
Hey guys
Is there anyone who got hacked by this? If so did u get your stuff back?
I've been messaging with support on and off in the last 6-7 months, but sadly they are not willing to give my stuff back even tho both they and me have concrete evidence about the theft. Im not 10 year old so im not gonna cry my eyes red about it, kinda moved on, but still its sad that you've invested half a year prior to that into skyblock and one day to another you are ripped off with 300-500€ worth of stuff and 1k-2k hours of playtime.

title: [Skyblock Math] What is the heaviest item in Hypixel Skyblock? (And inventory) [WIP]
body:
Disclaimer:
Many, many people have done this before.
I'll try not to copy off of them, but if I am, please tell me so I can reference them.
Kg = pound, by the way. Deeeeeeefinitely. (misinformation is fun)
Additionally, this was written mostly prior to the 0.9 community center update (at around Pets the update dropped) so I'll be making changes if you point them out.
Thank you, and onto creating a black hole.

Hello again!

Welcome back to Skyblock Math with Dumplingsushi - the previous posts are in my signature.

This week, we are breaking the laws of reality finding out the heaviest object AND inventory possible in Hypixel Skyblock.

But we already have a problem.

In Skyblock, every item's mass is the same. How do we know? They
- Move the same ways when thrown
- Take up the same space (at least, most of them do)
Therefore, we can safely say that everything weighs the same.


...


...


...


But that's boring. Let's use the heavier, real life weights instead.

Heavy collections:
Cobblestone = 2515 kg/m^3 (I'll stop saying m^3 after this is done, but this is necessary so no one gets confused.
Ice = 919 kg/m^3
Obsidian = 2600 kg/m^3
Iron (Block) = 7 873 kg/m^3
Gold (Block) = 42,549 kg/m^3
Iron (Ingot) = 874 kg
Gold (Ingot) = 4727 kg
Porkchop = 272 kg (Animals are a special case - their drops absorb all of their weight) (Yes that's how it works in real life too)
Diamond (Block) = 3 514 kg/m^3
Diamond (Regular) = 390 kg
All types of wood = 800 kg/m^3
Coal =25 kg
Redstone dust = 1 kg (Guestimate)
Flint = 2 kg
Dragon fragments = 900 kg (Though it depends on the scales) SIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIGH
Super enchanted Egg = Not even enough to matter - only around 75 kg





Some suggested contenders:
Yeeti sword
T12 Perfect
Wood singularity + Foil
Mastiff armor
Pigman Sword
Backpack of Gold
T11 Gold minion



We'll talk about the rest of the inventory later.

Right now, it's all about the heaviest item.

Yeeti Sword What? You're literally throwing stuff.

The recipe for the Yeeti - I mean Yeti sword is pretty complex and expensive.
It requires 9,830,400 ice and 819,200 iron ingots, plus a Hilt of True Ice, which we'll just calculate as another ice piece.
9830401 * 919 + 819200 * 874 = 9,750,119,319 kg.

T12 Perfect (Chestplate)

Tier twelve perfect armor is the best defense set in the game.
However, since this is a single item, we're going to calculate the chestplate.

One T1 Chestplate has 8 enchanted diamond blocks. We have to tier that up 11 times, costing another 44 enchanted diamond blocks, or 52 total.
52 * 25600 * 390 = 519,168,000 kg. That's less than the Yeeti sword.
The rest of the set is also pretty heavy.
(176 + 24) * 25600 * 390 = 1,996,800,000 kg. Even though it's close to the Yeti Sword, it's still not the best. (Besides, we can't use it due to it taking up more than one slot.)

Scorpion Foil + Wood Singularity

A wood singularity is a strange item that can be anviled onto a wooden sword - and the heaviest wood sword in skyblock is the scorpion foil.

One log is 200 kg, and we need 320 of each enchanted type, plus the two enchanted stacks in the scorpion foil.
(320 * 6 + 128) * 160 * 800 = 262,144,000 kg. Dang, not even close to t12.

Full Mastiff armor (bork)

Mastiff armor not only requires a lot of resources to make, but those resources are also naturally heavy.
This site shows the material requirements.
You need:
245760 logs
20480 diamonds
102400 gold ingots
And 2048 wolf teeth (not counted)

(245760 * 800) + (20480 * 390) + (102400 * 4727) = 688,640,000 kg.
This means it's slightly better than the T12 perfect chestplate alone in terms of weight. Not good.

Pigman sword + Stack of enchanted pork

This item seems to keep popping up in this series, but it's never quite the best.
A porkchop weighs 300 kg. There are 25600 in one enchanted cooked porkchop, and 48 of those in a Pigman Sword.
272 * 25600 * 48 = 334,233,600 kg. That's better than mastiff armor, but not close to anything else.
If we turn it into a stack, we nearly reach half a billion kg.
272 * 25600 *64 = 445,644,800 kg. Still, that's worse than the T12 chestplate.

Backpack of Gold

This is obviously a Jumbo Backpack, since it can store the most items.
There are 54 slots in a backpack, and 64 items in a stack.
Enchanted gold blocks are, without a doubt, the heaviest base item in the game (Base item = Only crafted with versions of itself).
There are 25600 gold ingots in an enchanted gold block. The leather in the backpack is math ugh how can I not do it not heavy enough to be counted
54 * 64 * 25600 * 4727 = 418,214,707,200 kg. I've also calculated the mass - 104553676800 - and no it's not a black hole.

Yet.

However, there's a better option than a stack of enchanted gold blocks.

Before, we determined the weight of the Yeti sword to be 9,750,119,319 kg. What if we put those in the jumbo backpack?

9750119319 * 54 = 526,506,443,226 kg.

Now that's more like it.

T11 Gold Minion

Gold is notoriously heavy in real life. In Skyblock, one ingot is around 4727 kg.
A gold minion requires 364,592 ingots to become T11.
364692 * 4727 = 1,723,899,084 kg. That's around a sixth of the weight in the Yeti sword.

That means that the Jumbo Backpack is the best. Alright, the backpack is the heaviest.






However.

I don't know why no one has ever considered this before.

Maybe it's because they assumed that you can't hold it, and therefore doesn't have weight.

Still, the Gold minion is a minion.
Minions can collect and store resources.

Yes, that's right. Even though we can't pick it up, the Gold Minion T11 can store more items inside it and in its large storage, which also is made up of wood, another heavy resource.
Additionally, we can put up to 64 other fuels, 2 upgrades, and a hopper.

A gold minion has 960 storage slots, and the XX-Large Storage gives it another 1728.
Let's let the gold minion fill up all the way, and have it carry the full 2688 enchanted gold blocks.
We also have the XX-Large storage (unfortunately, confers no more weight than a Large storage), which is another 256 enchanted logs, each at 128000 kg.
We also have the Enchanted Hopper, costing 12800 iron ingots to make, each at 874 kg.
Then, there's the question of upgrades. Super compactors are obviously the best for this, as it's 7 stacks of enchanted cobble, and one enchanted redstone block.
Finally, we have the fuel. Plasma buckets are best for this - even though you can only fit one in, it's still better due to the sheer amount of resources in it. It requires 8 lava buckets, with 51200 coal (25 kg) and 480 iron (874 kg) each.
Let's add it up.
(4727 * 25600 * 2688) + (256 * 128000) + (12800 * 874) + 2 * ((7 * 64 * 2515) + 25600) + 8 * (51200 * 25 + 480 * 874) = 325,337,961,600

Did I just hear the laws of physics break?
You literally can place these down on top of each other. I don't care that Skyblock is a floating island, it should literally snap into pieces when you place these things down.

However, we can safely say that the single heaviest item that we can carry is a jumbo backpack full of Yeti swords.

Onto the inventory part.

First things first - the regular inventory and ender chest.

Due to the community center update, you have now have up to

The ender chest can have up to 405 slots, with the normal inventory having 35. This leads to 440 total slots.

526506443226 * 440 = 231,662,840,000,000 kg. This also would cost you 146,564,000,000 coins. We're just getting started, even though this is already far beyond what a normal person could afford. We're around 5 times Vanessa's net worth.

Did you know that you can also carry backpacks on your head, and put them in the wardrobe?

If we buy MVP+ for our Steve, they can carry up to 19 extra backpacks. Of course, now we need to figure out what the other armor pieces are going to be.

We've already figured out that t12 perfect is the heaviest armor set, so let's calculate the bottom three pieces.
151 * 25600 * 390 = 1507584000 kg.

Adding that to the backpack, we get a total of 526506443226 + 1507584000 = 528014027226 kg per armor set.

We can carry 19 of these.

528014027226 * 19 = 37937108000000 kg. 

Onto the pets menu.

For ... reasons, we're only using the first page of the pet menu.

There are several pets, but unfortunately there's none that can be crafted with gold.

Let's consider some options.
Zombie pet
Pigman pet
Wither skeleton pet
Wolf/Ocelot pet
Sheep pet

Zombie Pet

This is one of the more expensive pets, requiring 8 zombie hearts to craft, each of those costing 256 enchanted rotten flesh, each of those costing 160 rotten flesh.

Rotten flesh, like pork, absorbs the weight of the thing that it drops from.

For some reason, I can't find the weight of a corpse. It's almost like no one wants to weigh a dead person.

People can be so strange.

Let's just say that it's around 40 kg, and continue on with maths.

40 * 160 * 256 * 8 = 13107200 kg. We can also upgrade the epic variant at Kat to double the weight, as it costs another 8 zombie hearts. 13107200 *2 = 26214400 kg.

The egg is actually so light (~75 kg) that including it won't matter whether we include it or not.

Pigman Pet

A Pigman pet costs 8 enchanted cooked pork chops to craft, and another 8 to upgrade at Kat.

600 * 25600 * 16 = 245760000 kg. This is pretty good!

Wither Skeleton Pet

This is bound to be a decently heavy one. A wither skeleton pet costs 8 enchanted blocks of coal, and another 8 at Kat.

25 * 25600 * 16 = 10240000 kg. That's a 24th of the pigman pet weight.

Wolf & Ocelot Pet

Why is wood so heavy? It's literally 200 kg per block - then again blocks literally hover in this game. Riiiiiight.

For this crafting recipe, we need 16 stacks of enchanted wood.

16 * 64 * 200 * 160 = 32768000 kg. This is better than the zombie, but worse than the Pigman, which is still in the lead.

Sheep Pet

Mutton is the same weight as wood per item - 200 kg - and the crafting recipes are the same, except wood is now mutton.

Just to be sure, let's check.

16 * 64 * 200 * 160 = 32768000 kg. Yep, they're the same.

Griffin Pet

This one shouldn't even be able to float at uncommon rarity, it's that heavy.

Griffin pets are a very special type pet that use upgrade stones instead of Kat to upgrade their rarities. Those upgrade stones are freaking expensive, especially in gold.

The feathers and claws are, well, feathers and claws. They don't weight much. Ignored.

Onto the actual math part.

For each tier of upgrade stone, you need the previous tier to use it, and the previous tier of that, and so on. This means that for a legendary stone, we need to have used an uncommon, rare, and epic stone before we can even use the legendary variant. Annoying - except that this also means that we get a lot of weight. 

The total cost for the legendary variant of griffin (here) states that we need... *wolf whistles* [WIP] gold ingots to make the legendary version. If each gold ingot is 4727 kg, then

4727 * 3276800 = 15489433600 kg. How do you even carry these thin- *pspsps* What? Oh yeah, physics literally jumped off an island.

So the heaviest pet is the Griffin pet. What pet item should we add?

A Tier boost is one of the most expensive pet upgrades, but unfortunately it's not that heavy. We can see when the endstone protector rises up that it's full body is only around 25 blocks of endstone, which is around the same weight as cobble.

In the end, 2515 * 25 = 62875 kg isn't much, but it's an option.

There's actually a very unusual way to get more weight on our pets. We're only using mob drops if we can figure out the weight of the mob, i.e. a wolf talisman is the weight of a wolf.

Did you know that Jello's actually kind of heavy per square meter?

The exp share core can drop from any mob in the deep caverns. If we kill those giant slimes and get the drop, we get around 1000 square meters of jello, in an item. And one square meter is 1141 kg.

We also get to craft it using another 11520 gold, which further increases its weight.

1141 * 1000 + 11520 * 4727 = 55596040 kg. I believe we've found our pet item.

On one page of the pets menu, there are 28 slots. All we have to do is add the Griffin Pet and the item, right?

Not exactly - I've actually been forgetting this for a while. You can pinata your pet (the black cat's already a pinata) by stuffing it unwillingly with candies, and from that point forward will always have candies inside of it.

The best candy to use is the superb carrot candies, as they're the highest tier. You can get higher from the community center, but that actually just decreases the weight.

Superb carrot candies are very expensive, costing 2 mil a piece. The crafting recipe requires you to have 544064 carrots and 682.6 gold ingots. Carrots weigh around 70g - not much, but it's something.

We can pinata our pet with ten candies. (I hope you feel as ridiculous reading that sentence as I was writing it.)

(544064 * 70 + 682.6 * 4727) * 10 = 413111302 kg. The pet is now significantly heavier.

Let's add everything up and multiply it by the 28 slots.

(413111302 + 55596040 + 15489433600) * 28 = 15,958,140,942 kg in the pet menu.

Onto the accessories!

The probable best bet is to find an accessory with a lot of gold.

This may include:

Hunter ring
Red claw artifact

Let's start with the Hunter ring.

It requires an extremely high amount of gold, but unfortunately isn't tiered. Instead, there's just 256 gold teeth and a grizzly bait, which is just the weight of a wolf.

There are 32 enchanted gold ingots in a golden tooth - the wolf teeth actually don't matter, as in total it's less than a kilogram per golden tooth.

Therefore, per golden tooth, there are 32 * 160 * 4727 = 24202240 kilograms of gold.



In the Hunter ring, there are 256 of these.

24202240 * 256 = 6,195,773,440 kg. Decently heavy. We've only passed the heaviest weighed object (2,204,458 kg for the Kennedy space station) by a few orders of magnitude. Nothing too big.

The Red claw artifact is slightly different, as it's a tiered accessory. The final tier requires (listed here) 317,440 gold ingots, 92,160 leather (remember, the cow's weight gets sucked into the leather), 7944 wolf teeth (only around 3 kg), and a red claw egg.

Let's do the math. 317440 * 4727 + 92160 * 2100 = 1,694,074,880 kg. That's ok, but still 5 times less than the hunter ring.

Therefore, the Hunter ring is the best accessory for our purposes.

What about reforges?

Unfortunately, there are no really good reforges for our purpose, since the three accessory stone reforges are silky (spider web), molten (lava), and bloody (mmm), we don't have many choices that weight much.

Therefore, it doesn't really matter if we use a reforge or not in the long run.

Since the recent community center update, you can now hold up to 55 accessories with the largest size.

6195773440 * 55 = 340767539200 kg. This is fine - oh, and if the effects stacked, we would be getting over 3x combat exp with a combat exp boost III.

Onto the quiver.

Useless, as the best we can hold is around a stack of meter cubes of lime jello because of the slime bow.

Onto the fishing bag.

This can actually hold items that are heavy - not that anything's really wrong with jello.
The probable heaviest item is the enchanted cooked salmon, with 25600 regular salmon inside. You can also hold up to 45 stacks of items in the fishing bag.

One salmon weighs around 26 kg, so 26 * 25600 * 45 * 64 = 1916928000 kg. That's a lot of flesh. (link in signature smooth plug)

What about the sack of sacks?

Mining, of course, is actually the best for this. (gasp sign turns on) Foraging was second best, as you can hold a lot of logs, which are around 800 kg each.

Things you can hold in this that really matter:

Cobblestone = 2515
Coal (One) = 25
Obsidian = 2600
Diamond = 390
Iron = 874
Gold = 4727
Ice = 919
End stone (around half of cobblestone's weight) = 1250

Additionally, the sack costs coal to craft - 17920 pieces, to be exact. You can hold 20,160 of each mining item in it, so...

2515 * 20160 + 25 * 38080 + 2600 * 20160 + 390 * 20160 + 874 * 20160 + 4727 * 20160 + 919 * 20160 = 243,376,000 kg.

The foraging sack is close, but not entirely there. 4800 * 20160 + 800 * 17920 = 111,104,000 kg.

You can upgrade your sack of sacks 5 times, each giving you 2 extra slots. (If you do upgrade it first before anything else, I know where you live) In total, that's 22 slots.

22 * 243376000 = 5,354,272,000 kg.

Finally, we have travel scrolls.

We have MVP+ (oMG P2w TWaveL scWOlLs) already due to the wardrobe slots bonus, so we can consume every scroll (the only epic scroll that really matters is the hub crypts though)

What travel scrolls are there that need resources?

- Spooder den
- Hell
- Eternal darkness area where you kill people for their eyeballs
- Legal deforestation and animal petting zoo where you kill animals, along with a very very rich person who can summon rain yet lives in a shack in a forest.
- Prison server (Now with Technoblade jokes)
- Bigger prison server where you can also slice random jello blobs who just wanted to hug you (not their fault that they weigh over 500 kg)
- Place to tear up a farmer's crops
- Place to destroy a carefully crafted (pun absolutely intended) ecosystem
- Crypts containing dead people who were buried, showing that someone cared for them.

Skyblock is a fun and wholesome game!

Let's go in order.

The spooder scroll requires 128 enchanted flint, which we know weighs 2 kg per. The enchanted eyes of ender don't weigh enough to matter.

160 * 2 * 128 = 40960 kg. Hmm.

The scroll to Hell is just a bunch of ... dust?

That weighs literally nothing?

160 * 0.5 * 128 = 10240 kg.

Ah, here we go. The scroll to the zooper men area requires a lot of enchanted obsidian and end stone (which is just cheese).

We know that obsidian is 2600 kg per, but what about the end stone?

Well, it says here that a cup of shredded cheese is 4 ounces. This means that in total, there are 16904 ounces in a cubic meter of cheese. (479 kg)

We need 48 enchanted obsidian and 80 enchanted end stone to make the scroll, so...

48 * 2600 * 160 + 479 * 80 * 160 = 26099200 kg. Much better.

What about the gold mine prison server scroll?

You need a lot of heavy materials for this one - 48 enchanted iron and 90 enchanted gold. Iron is 874 kg per ingot, and gold is 4727 (I will never forget that number after this thread)

874 * 160 *48 + 4727 * 160 * 90 = 74781120 kg. Saaaaaaay... What's the weight of the gold mine, anyways? (Might do that next)

The deep caverns scroll is less expensive in terms of weight, requiring only 48 enchanted redstone dust and 90 lapis lazuli. For the redstone dust, I'm just going to assume that it's around 0.75 kg per (since it's dust). The Lapis is also slightly heavier at 3 kg apiece.

48 * 160 * 0.75 + 90 * 160 * 3 = 48960 kg.

The barn is a peaceful island where a farmer lovingly created his ranch, planted crops, and terraformed the mountains to hold more seeds. Then, every early game player comes along tearing everything up and slaughtering all of his animals. This game is fun and lighthearted!

The barn scroll is relatively cheap as well, costing a small 48 enchanted carrots and 90 enchanted potaters. Both of these... uh... huh... one sec. *googles What kind of food are carrots and potatoes* Ah, here we are. Both of these vegetables don't weigh much and are around 100 g each (0.1 kg).

128 * 160 * 0.1 = 2048 kg. Pretty disappointing.

The park is deforestation area number one in skyblock, but luckily it's a magic(k)al park with infinite growing trees and a bunch of people who want your cash for their gain.

The actual scroll is only 128 enchanted birch logs.

128 * 160 * 800 =  16384000 kg. Nice.

Finally, we have the hub crypts scroll.

The crafting recipe is moderately expensive, and requires 90 enchanted obsidian and three revenant viscera (which essentially weighs nothing).

2600 * 160 * 90 =  37440000 kg - that's our heaviest one.

There are also other scrolls we can use, but they aren't crafted.

What about...

The trade menu?

Hear me out, I know it's not very conventional. You aren't holding the items in there. They're not even yours.

However, with a booster cookie, you can have the opportunity to buyback backpacks full of yeti swords from the trades menu, adding another 540 yeti swords to the pile at 28431348000000 kg.

I think that's it. *ahem* TALLY TIME

title: New ideas for Slayers
body:
Slayers are getting a little bit boring because it's just calling Maddox, killing wolves, spiders, or zombies and claiming exp.
Solution : A new Slayer Mob
Let's keep on grinding these slayers.

1: The new boss
The new slayer boss could be a skeleton boss, I introduce to you the Spectral Bowman. Every slayer boss has a place where you kill runts to fight the boss. In the wilderness, there is a place where skeletons spawn, I suggest revamping the place to look like a pervious training ground of archers and knights and keeping the skeletons there. The player kills a certain amount of skellys and fights the spectral bowman. The place where the skeletons spawned could be turned useful instead of just dead weight. The new area would also have a place underground similar to the crypt in the graveyard. This place is where you can fight stronger forms of the skellys above ground but it also minimizes the amount of mobs you have to fight before fighting the slayer boss, similar to the crypt ghouls.

2: Possible drops
A new armor set would be introduced that is helpful especially when fighting skeletons and this new slayer boss. It would be called Knight's armor. There are two stages, apprentice knight armor and royal knight armor. Apprentice knight armor require Slayer level 3 to wear and is a rare drop (about 1/25). Royal knight armor requires slayer level 5 to wear and is an upgraded form of apprentice knight armor. In order to upgrade the apprentice armor to royal armor, you would need to obtain the Hardened stone that is a 1/100 Spectral Bowman drop. Combine the apprentice piece with one hardened stone and you obtain the royal knight armor.
A new bow which is a PrayRNGesus drop from the Spectral Bowman. It is called the spectral bow (creative right), it has +200 damage, + 75 strength, +14% crit chance. Similar to the mosquito bow stats, it is a little worse but has a much higher crit chance.

2b: Armor perks/abilities
Shrug it off: 2% chance to deflect hits while wearing Apprentice Knight Armor, 5% chance to deflect hits while wearing Royal Knight Armor. This minimizes damage to only 30% damage for the hit if it is deflected.
Toughened up: 7.5% chance for arrows to bounce off your armor if fired at you. Only applies to Royal Knight Armor.

Skilled flight: 25% chance for the arrow to fly faster and deal 20% more damage. Applies to Spectral bow.
Barbed arrow: If pufferfish is in quiver bag, arrow stays in the wound and causes 1% loss of health per second over 3 seconds. Only applies to Spectral bow.

If you have any suggestions, leave them below.
