title: 1 year and 10k posts in the Skyblock Forums
body:
Well, here it is, the big 10k posts. Nearly a year ago a younger and more innocent Zhirst when i Still had a roblox pfp had said this:




(I took this today)
Background History
I foolishly said I would go for 10k posts, and like the fool I am I did hit 10k posts. I never thought that I would spend a year on a forum site, or a year in a specific sub forum. The skyblock forums. The young 2019 skyblock forums, ****posting was a rarity, and scam posts ravaged the land, I would hand an L to every scam post that had entered my vision. It may sound toxic but 2019 Zhirst was a lot nicer and naïve than I am now. I even carved myself a little name by being called in lobbies and getting partied by people asking if I was the real Zhirst. It was a simpler time. You had people like @Slayre or multiple members from DND roaming around. November 2019 arrived which would be the month in which I would receive my first (and currently only) Forum ban. Early 2020 arrives and in February so does a forum update, multiple people including me didn't really like the new update, following this I had quietly disappeared for 2 weeks. Returning I had seen people like Quaglet and @MlecznyHuxel99 explode in popularity which would soon lead to the new era of the forums, or current day forums as I call it (I separate the skyblock forums with 2 eras, old and new). With the early days of the new era I had dropped my gimmick of saying or posting the picture "L" because I got bored, people started whining about being toxic, and scams seemed to die down for a bit after money trading. Although scam threads are still present. After returning I had also noticed that most of the people that I used to talk to had started to leave and/or disappear.

Useless Fun Facts:

1. My name is pronounced Zhurst
2. I technically broke a rule joining when I was 12, but i turned 13 a month after so it technically balances out
3. I used to go by Coolchristo (very glad I came up with Zhirst)
4. I used to enjoy skyblock
5. I used to be a moderator in Skyblock Gods which is like a Top ten guild now (and then went to skyblock forceful then quit cause I got bored of Skyblock), but yea I used to moderate it, although I'm not really associated with the guild anymore you should still probs check them out.
6. I've been scammed more than once, why yes I am an idiot

Now the reason you're here


Spoiler: Reveal










Well, that's all i wanted to say. You can ask me other stuff if you want to. But anyways here is to 10k

title: Good Catches, Great Catches, and Coin Catches
body:
Good Catches, Great Catches, and Coins are all things that almost everyone has gotten if they have fished, but there is a problem with them. They Suck. Most of the catches aren't worth it, the only ones that are worth it are Hunk of Blue Ice, Grand Experience Bottle, Titanic Experience Bottle, Guardian Pet, and Squid Pet (The fairy gear is useless and more of a flex, so I didn't include it). That is only 5 out of the 26 available Catches. The coins that you can catch are useless; I can get more with a Raider's Axe farming Enderman, Zealots, or Crypt Ghouls for 5 minutes than I get out of the coin catch which is a 3% for less than 10k coin, and less than 1% for 10-20k coins.
My Proposal is that the admins buff the items or amount of items with fishing levels. For example, if I catch an enchanted iron at fishing level 1, I only get 1 enchanted iron, but if I catch one at fishing level 26, I can get 3-5. Coins also scale the same way.

title: please dont make farming contests real
body:
The beauty of skyblock is that you can get so far without competition.
I used to play sweaty games like League where all that matters is getting ahead of everyone else and I HATED IT. I love skyblock because all you have to do is play and you are guarenteed a high position within the communnity. You don't have to constantly follow the meta, you don't have to tryhard competitions if you dont want to, and you can just relax and play skyblock. This is because skills are capped at 50, slayers at 9, etc. Caps make everything less stressful because you know that you'll eventually get there if you just play.

Now... you have to sweat farming. Really??? And from the image I noticed, its literally top 5. Not top 5%, but top 5. That's disgusting. Out of over 100k active players, the top 5 are guarenteed to macro. wtaf were the devs thinking on that one??? Not only are you forcing everyone to sweat farming (because obviously so many people are going to try to get the top spot), but by making the bracket so small you pretty much force everyone to sweat for absolutely nothing.
_________________

And this goes back to something that I noticed a lot recently -- the devs are forgetting why they do/don't do things.
Remember how spooky events used to only give the rewards to the top 1? Yeah they had to get rid of that because it wasn't fair to people who sweated their *** off just to get absolutely nothing. But apparently they must have gotten some new devs that haven't been playing the game for that long, since they CLEARLY didn't learn anything from that ****show.

Another example is the new tier of overflux and rev. To be clear, I do like these additions. However, we were going to have a slayers v2... what happened? It gets scrapped and finally now you're bringing the stuff out? Why did it even get scrapped in the first place then? Do you guys even remember slayers v2???

and my last example is with new farming changes and the builders wand. Macroing has historically been one of the biggest problems in skyblock. They had to make it so that killing mobs on your island doesn't give combat xp... but now they made it so that you can literally afk farming by holding down 2 buttons, and then made farming contests where only the top 25 farmers get loot. DID YOU GUYS LEARN ANYTHING FROM THE PAST YEAR? No you haven't. 
__________________

I appreciate a lot of the devs' work and I love the game but it really does seem almost like the old devs are gone and replaced. So much is being added that clearly shows that they learned nothing from the game's past.

I guess that no one read this whole thing but thanks a lot to those who did, and here's a tl; dr for those who didnt:

tl;dr
at least make it percent based not position based. Position ranking aren't fair at all when macroers exist and the playerbase is so big.

title: Skyblock Idea, The Shielding Sword
body: I just had an idea about making a new sword in skyblock. It would be called the shielding sword. You would get it from the dark oak collection at collection 8 (instead of the exp that you would usually get), and you would craft it with a golem sword, two stacks of enchanted dark oak, and 3 enchanted iron blocks. The recipe would be so expensive because I thought it would have a unique ability called Summon Shield. It would be an ability that would be activated after right clicking it, the ability would cost 75 mana to use and would have a 15 second cooldown. The ability would summon a wall of particles that wouldn't let and mob get within 3 blocks of you for 5 seconds. If the mob can hit you from outside the circle then they would only do half damage. I think this sword should be of epic rarity if it were added into the game. Also, the stats of the sword would be a +175 damage and +50 strength sword. It would give +50 defense while holding too. Sorry I don't have any pictures, I just had the idea and didn't know how to model it. Thank you for reading! Please comment feedback if you have any suggestions.

title: Update on Skyblock API Viewer

Does anyone still remember what it is? I bet everyone probably forgot tbh. Anyways, this isn't really a real "update", and I just want to say that the Skyhistory API has been changed first of all. Please read the Skyhistory spoiler if you want to know more about the change. I also am working on an armour viewer, the only problem as of now is the NBT decoder, as I can't find a good working one for PHP. The project would also be switched to use NodeJS instead of PHP in the near future (if I am not that lazy), and making a lot of things would be easier for me. Finally, I made a updater.sh file to update to the newest version of the project when run and automatically migrate all the cache/history files. Thats all I updated, expect more updates in the future as I just completed CS50x which took a lot of time. Hope you guys are having a nice day/night and stay safe.

Link: http://xworldtechnology.com/skyblock/
Github: https://github.com/nullminer/Skyblock-API-Viewer



Spoiler: Skyhistory



http://xworldtechnology.com/skyblock/history.php?uuid=<UUID>&timestamp=<TIMESTAMP>

<UUID> is the UUID of the player who you want to query, and the optional field <TIMESTAMP> is the timestamp of the player's profile history that you want to query. If you leave <TIMESTAMP> empty, the API will return the list of timestamps that has been archived. Errors are now also better, they are now in JSON format.

UUID_INVALID means that there was no <UUID> field given
PLAYER_NO_HISTORY means that the player has no archived profile history
TIMESTAMP_NO_HISTORY means that there is no history at the requested timestamp



Please leave a like if you support this project! Thanks!

title: Spooky Festival strategy
body:
As you all know the spooky event has been updated. The new update makes things like the skeleton horse pet and higher candy score items much more accesible. The new update implements new spooky mobs that spawn in massive quantities in certain parts of the map at correct times (7pm-7am). My strategy abuses this by utilizing the new ability on the bat pet (2x damage to spooky mobs) and a pumpkin launcher.

THINGS YOU WILL NEED:
sword (preferably AOTE for quicker movement)
pumpkin launcher (approximately 1000 ammo)
jingle bells
legendary bat pet
full bat person set (as many wise pieces you can have for the AOTE teleport ability)

STRATEGY: 
So the entire point of this strategy is to find a lobby with as few people as possible (usually it is good to search a couple minutes before the event starts). Between the times of 7am and about 6:40pm you need to farm crypt ghouls (farming revenant slayers during it but it will slow you down). When it hits 6:40 you want to start going to the wilderness. You should be at the bridge to the wilderness at 7pm where you should use your jingle bells to attract as many mobs as possible and kill them using your pumpkin launcher.at about halfway to the fairy pond there is a huge witch spawn area where you can farm them. You should farm until they despawn which is when you should return to the crypts. All you have to do is repeat this and you should have a guaranteed skeleton horse pet.

GOOD LUCK TO ALL...

title: The Farming Update Isn't As Bad As You Think
body:
So on Minikloon's Twitter an event based update to farming was leaked where only five people can get the best rewards. The best of these rewards is a 2% increase to crops gained and a +1 to the skill cap on farming. Many people are saying these rewards are too exclusive but heres why they are not.

In the leak five other events are shown next to the one Minikloon was hovering over. This means at least 25 people (There may be more events hidden or not developed yet) can get the best rewards from the event every year. Now these rewards are very obviously only good for a farming 50 player. There are less than 1000 people currently at farming 50. It will only take around 6 months for every farming 50 to have gained these rewards at least once. That really isnt too long. You also have to realize that a lot of farming 50 players may be inactive or uninterested.

Tldr: These rewards are very exclusive but they're meant for a just as exclusive group.

title: There's a barrier obtaining glitch going around.
body: To obtain these, turn on touch screen mode in your esc gui > controls screen, take 2 enchanted books that can be combined (eg prot 1 and prot 1) and put them in the slots of an anvil. Then, take the anvil inside the gui and put it into an open slot in your hotbar. That will combine the books. When that happens, put the combined book in the same slot where you put the anvil. The book will be put back where you took it from, and a barrier will be in the spot where you put the book. Youtube clip showcasing this:

title: Tank: An Analysis, A Proposition, and A Cry for Help.
body:
Hello everyone. I'm someone who is quite opinionated and I see a lot of threads about Tank and that it is the worst. Gold star to you guys. But I feel like people don't take a proper look into why it is the case. I've wanted to tackle it for a while. This is a warning that this is a fairly long read. Also there isn't a tl;dr. Don't look for one.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Spoiler: Disclaimer



As a start to this thread (Which will likely be buried quickly because if it isn't a meme thread, a sh*tpost, or a flame war, threads instantly die), I want to add a disclaimer that I am by no means the best player. I am Tank 23 with Catacombs 22, I work full time and don't get to play a lot, and even when I am home, I play other things a lot. I don't use the absolute best gear that you can, I don't use the best pets, and I certainly don't do things efficiently, as if I did, I would be playing Healer instead. This is all in my opinion, looking at it from my perspective and my experience in games with balancing, as well as my experience as a tank in games.
This thread is meant to be an objective look at the role of Tank. The class that has seemingly been ignored and forgotten. Overshadowed in every aspect. And ever since they made some changes to help with aggro on most mobs, it has not been touched. The only thing it has gotten was a pity buff of 30 seconds CD off the Ult, but that really doesn't affect anything. However, is this really the fault of the admins just neglecting the class? Well, technically yes, but it is also far more complicated than that.



A look at Tank.
---------------------------------------------


Spoiler: Fall Without a Rise



First of all, let's go over what Tank as a class is. The idea behind Tank is to be a wall that your teammates can rely on to help in tough situations that they wouldn't be able to survive. Always leading the charge, not afraid to step out first and pull all the mobs to themself so that everyone else can free-fire without worry for them dying. With many ways to ensure that everyone can be safe, Tank is a class for the people who want to be the beacon of hope. At least, that was the idea.

Ever since F3 when people were finally able to deal with Shadow Assassins without getting destroyed, Tank has had virtually no purpose. People are more interested in grinding XP and stats as fast and as efficiently as possible (Topic for a different day), and simply put, Tank has no place in that playstyle. Everyone was able to one shot and clear rooms themselves with ease, and so came the meta of 4M1H/5M. F4 only helped reinforce this, as Spirit Sceptre made Mages even MORE efficient with their clearing. Plus as people grinded more and more (Once again abusing strats to farm XP as fast as possible), they got strong enough that they could tank all the Spirit mobs without needing to cheese with Decoys, even further eliminating the need for a Tank.
F5 is what I think marked the moment where Tank now has a foot and a half out the door. With a combination of Shadow Assassin Armour, Livid Dagger, and -what is in my opinion, one of the most absurdly poor decisions by the admins (MORE ON THIS LATER)- Dwarf Turtle Shelmet, Berserkers were all of a sudden able to do absolutely everything a Tank could do, while dealing far more damage. I don't feel like this was bad, as it brought Berserkers to a point where they could potentially compete. Then F6 brought Necromancer Lord, which has better stats outside of dungeons than T12. Again, not inherently bad.

What all this meant is that ANY class could have armour on par with Tank, and have stats on par with them, all while dealing far more damage. Necromancer Lord allows you to have a personal escort of mobs, and if you make that Super Tank Zombies, well you basically have a Tank on you at all times that manages to draw aggro better WHILE DEALING MORE DAMAGE! If you've ever read Solo Leveling, this to me is very reminiscent of that.
So where does the purpose of Tank go from here? People no longer need you to survive, you aren't able to properly pull all mobs. More often than not, I am asking for a Mage to come help me with mobs because I can't clear them fast enough. The only utility that people care about is healing, and Healer does that in spades, WHILE DEALING MORE DAMAGE!! For people who want some fun healing numbers, here.



Spoiler: Healers are nuts



So, I will be using the main forms of healing that they have, the Healing Circle. From level 0, this circle heals for 2% of the players max HP/s, or the equivalent of a Mana Flux. From here, this healing is increased by the Healer's Renew Passive, which increases all ability healing by 50%. So now the circle is healing for 3% Max HP/s, which is the same as a Plasma Flux. Also, with the Healing Aura passive, any players within 8 blocks of the Healer receive an extra 1% Max HP/s, so that is now 4%. Assuming that you are using a Zombie Heart, this is all DOUBLED to 8% Max HP/s. If they have a double healing item, that is 16% Max HP/s healing. And this ability is on a 2 second CD. FROM LEVEL 0.

Every level you get, Renew gets increased by 1%. For every 5 levels, Healing Aura gets increased by 0.1% and Healing Circle gets increased by 0.5%. I think you can see how quickly this gets out of hand. At Healer 25, your circle will be Healing for 4.5% Max HP/s innately, increased by 75% via Renew to 7.9% Max HP/s. Healing Aura is healing for 1.5% Max HP/s, making it 9.4% total. Doubled with Mender item to 18.8%, and then potentially further doubled or more to other players via their items. Basically, around 20% of your Max HP/s. On a 2 second cooldown. Did I mention it deals damage? Oh also I think these numbers can all be doubled if you are the only Healer, but I don't play Healer so I'm not sure.



The issues with Tank all come from the fact that Dungeons is not designed with Tank in mind. I think the Admins tried, but it missed the mark, and they have dug themselves into a VERY deep hole with it. At the same time, the player-base has pushed it this way, getting upset when anything potentially even touches Mages negatively. Hell, Midas Staff is just Tank's ability except with a much shorter CD and far more damage, but 100mil so justified(?).



Breakdown of Tank
-------------------------------------------------------


Spoiler: A Rusty Jigsaw



Let's look at Tank's kit now, because oh god, it is NOT pretty to look at.

At Level 0, Tank gets 100 HP and 50 Defense innately. They also receive 25% Total Defense per the first part of Protective Barrier. The second part of this is that when you get damaged below 50%, you gain an Absorption Shield equal to 10% of your Max HP. On a 90s Cooldown. Oh and there is a higher chance you get targeted by mobs when you aren't getting blasted by Skele Masters.

Seismic Wave is a wave that goes in a line, dealing damage to mobs it hits. It deals 20k + 10% damage per 50 Defense, which this scaling is probably the best thing going for the class. But then it is plagued by terrible hitboxes, the wave stopping the instant it hits any block (Had it stop on a carpet a few runs before I started writing this), the fact that it can't hit enemies more than 1 block above it, and a 60s Cooldown. Now if you use an Earth Shard, you get a whopping 10s off this, which doesn't make the most significant distance considering you are mostly using the ability to clear out stray mobs that your mages missed while gathering all their loot and coins. I'm not going to bother with Super Heavy removing 5s per piece, as I have seen next to no people running it. Doesn't mean people aren't, but personally I haven't.

Now when you think of Ultimate abilities, you think of a big game changing ability. Archer has arrows galore to absolutely melt any target that dares take reduced KB. Mage becomes Thor incarnate and rains hell on everything. Berserker goes full Austin Powers and has what Reaper Scythe should have been when it was originally released, and Healer gets the clutch save and top-off to everyone to collect their Play of the Game award. Tank gets an emergency "Oh **** there's a lot of mobs here" button. I had so much more excitement when I saw the name of the ability considering I am a big fan of Log Horizon, but it feels so boring to use considering I only ever use it when I am the one in danger. The taunt on it is just as pointless, as Jingle Bells does the taunt, just without the 2m30s CD. Not saying the CD should be changed, but it just feels so bad to use in majority of situations. I can only think of one or two times where I used it in a truly clutch situation, and even then, it was to save myself, not someone else.

Well, what is the scaling's per level? All this seems pretty solemn, but surely it gets good scaling's for your dedication right?? Right???







Disappointing is a cheap word for it. 200 damage feels meaningless when the wave scales harder off defense, 10 Absorption HP is actually laughable, and the .2% Total Defense just seems laughable when you look at the fact that the only mobs that seem to be a threat are mobs that deal True Damage. Also 1 Defense per level. 1 F**KING DEFENSE PER LEVEL.

This doesn't change at ALL throughout the levels. No reduction to Cooldowns, no boost to your HP, nothing that truly seems to matter in ANY sense. It feels like it was all an afterthought. Like the entirety of Tank as a role was pieced together after everything was made. And this feels so ****ty, because even before classes were announced, I was super excited to play the role of Tank. I had the T12 Reaper Mask ready, got my Legendary Turtle, and did the math to figure out what reforge would be best for everything so that I could be the wall my team would need. And quite frankly, my guild still lets me tank for them, but we all know that I am not necessary there. I'm not the saviour I hoped I would be.



Items will save us?
--------------------------------------------------


Spoiler: Band-Aid Fix?



Very often, when situations like this arise, the easiest answer is "Well just give it some new items. It worked for Berserker, just do it for Tank." I think that putting a band-aid fix like this is not only lazy, but I feel more harmful in the long run.

Earth Shard is really the only Tank exclusive item that you even see, and it is still overshadowed by better weapons, simply because you can already quick cast your ability, and the 10s off the cooldown doesn't really matter. Stone Chestplate and Metal Chestplate are useless because everyone splits up, and Healer already covers the damage issue when you are all grouped up. Super Heavy is alright, but the stats it gives don't compare to the stats that Necromancer Lord gives, so why go it?

Unless the items are made so that they can literally ONLY be worn by Tank, other classes will use them. Perfect has been used by Mage for about as long as people realized that T9 Perfect is accessible at Cata 19. Mender Fedora is a Healer item, but everyone will switch to Reaper Mask anyways at Cata 33, though odds are we have a Mender Superbrain that gives 1500 HP and 2 trillion regen per second, so who cares about that. Necromancer Lord is now being used in the place of Perfect simply because it's better.



Spoiler: Dwarf Turtle Shelmet



Time to talk about Dwarf Turtle Shelmet. I hate this item. It is everything I feel is wrong about SkyBlock bundled into one stupid upgrade. And no, it's not just me being salty about the fact that my Legendary Turtle is now worse than an Epic variant with the Shelmet on it. It's the fact that it is something literally every class can use to HUGE benefit. Pet items should NOT be this powerful. Giving immunity to KB has historically been very powerful (See Slime Hat bug), and should have downsides to picking it as your big buff. Did you want to have a lot of EHP with lots of Defense on top? Did you want very good damage reduction at a cheap price? Did you want to become the immovable wall that doesn't even flinch at 5 mobs hitting you?

Well why pick! Now you can just put the anti-KB on whatever you want, and get the other perks while you are at it! Hell, why not give your Berserker one, because extra Crit Damage isn't very helpful. Hey, Mage won't notice the 100 Intel from Textbook missing, why not let them get it too! Healer might miss out on their Aura Healing because of mobs, better give them the option of it as well, considering everyone in dungeons at this point already has at least Mana Flux, so Bubblegum is useless.

It is so infuriating to see that something that was intended to be very limited -but very strong- be given to anyone who wanted it. I went with Turtle because I felt it was the best choice because of the anti-KB. Combine being stubborn, bitter, and very busy with work (Tire season yay), I don't have the time to be able to change, and I don't want to change. I know that Blue Whale w/Shelmet is far better. I don't care. I know that choosing to die on this hill will not change anything, because they can't just remove the item. I don't care. This is what I am passionate about. And I think Shelmet is one of the biggest mistakes Admins have made in this entire experiment with balancing and MMOs.

I am going to cut it off here, because I will be here all day otherwise.



Any item that has been added that has even slightly catered towards Tank, is either far below optimal, or is used by every other class more effectively. There is a reason that when people ask "What should I get as Tank?", people just say "Just switch to Healer".

But this really isn't something that can be fixed. Because of the fact that damage reigns supreme, weapon abilities have to be that otherwise they just don't matter. Because Tank armour doesn't have abilities that aren't centered around their team, it either is an ability that doesn't help much, or it has no ability whatsoever, making it even MORE appealing to other classes. And items? Mana is something that is scarce for me personally, as I only often need to use it for Jingle Bells. It can be a concern with my Ornate, but I have enough Intel on that to cover (Also in those situations, Healer usually ults). So having even more items to clutter my hotbar and make it so that I struggle even MORE with mana is not what Tank is about for me, though I could see others enjoying it, so I'm open to it.

No, in my opinion, what Tank needs is a rework. The issue is reworking it without changing its name to Bruiser. I can't say I am the best at balance, but I will do my best.



The Proposal
--------------------------------------------


Spoiler: Class Passives



I feel like the passives have good intention, so I want to try and keep it fundamentally. I'd say that the permanent XX% Total Defense is okay, but I think that it should also gain either some extra HP per level, or True Defense every other level. True damage is something that should be feared by all, but I feel like Tank should be a bit less scared.

In regards to part 2 of Protective Barrier, it also seems okay, but it often feels like it appears for no reason. Instead, make it so if a certain amount of damage is taken within a time period, THEN give the Absorption shield. You could also lower the CD to about 60s, or have it get reduced every 2 levels or so.

As for the Taunt, it just feels completely pointless. If I need a mobs aggro, I am NOT leaving it up to chance. Jingle Bells is this passive but in a convenient form of "Yes, you get the aggro". This should be replaced with something I feel like has been suggested for a while, and that is a thorns-like ability. My brother came up with the name Vengence. Contributing to the damage without tripling up on the Taunt aspect, this would make fighting mobs not feel like a complete waste of time. Additionally, any enemies damaged by this get affected by a new debuff: Vulnerability. This debuff would make it so that any damage incoming to them is increased by a % amount while they are affected. You can make it so that the level of the debuff is increased every 10 levels. Numbers could be toyed with.





Spoiler: Dungeon Stone Abilities



Oh Seismic Wave. The potential you had. Especially now that you are essentially improved on Midas Staff, I feel like you feel almost out of place here. I don't see any way to improve this without making it far more powerful, so I'd recommend a different ability. A simple one would be what I would call Shield Bash. You hit an enemy in front of you, knocking them back. If they hit any other enemies when they land, they take additional damage and are stunned for a brief period (FIX STUN PLS). Make this a relatively low CD, around 15 seconds or so.

As said earlier, I loved that the ult is a reference to a show I love. The character in Log Horizon who plays the Tank role is one of my favourite characters. But it just doesn't feel... like an ultimate ability. It should be impactful, it should be a game changer. So my suggestion is not to remove it, but to give it an upgrade. Taunt all enemies within 10 blocks, but now, for the period that the ultimate is active, any enemies that get within 5 blocks are pulled into you. Instead of being completely immune, you take HEAVILY reduced damage (In the realm of almost invulnerability). This way, you can still proc your passive of Thorns. At the end of the ability, you deal a circle of damage to all enemies, scaling off how many enemies were pulled into you.





Spoiler: Ghost Abilities



I mean, I don't think much needs to be changed here. Other than making Stun Potion work. Please. It's great that they get to look like they ARE confused, but they aren't actually.



I understand that it is not perfect. There is lots to adjust, and I don't have the ability to code anything at all to test and make this work. It is all concept. I just wanted to piece together a kit that felt like it had meaning. I had the idea of the Ultimate for a while now, and I wanted to build off of it and make something that feels like a proper class. Criticism is always welcome.

To the Devs
-------------------------------------


Spoiler: Showing my respect



As a closing, I wanted to speak directly to the people who make this for us.

Admins, you guys are far too underappreciated for what you do. Any time there is new content, it is met with "w0w worst update ever", followed by "omg where is content?" 2 days later. People rush through everything you work so hard on, and only try to find ways to exploit it to be efficient. And I hate seeing all these threads that say that you have no idea what you are doing, when really, you know better than anyone else what is done, or what needs to be done.

We aren't going to agree on everything. If we did, I'd be no better than a blank puppet. I admire the work you guys do so much, and even though there are things I strongly disagree with (Shelmet), I respect the hell out of all of you working on this absolute monster of a project. There is a reason there is only one other real Minecraft MMO, and the entire server is about only that. It is a huge undertaking, and you guys have learned so much along the way.

I don't expect Tank to ever be the best. Hell, I don't ever expect it to be better than the worst. But I love playing Tank. I don't want to watch it die out because it seems like there is no idea where to go with it. You guys are taking a break from Dungeons after F7 to allow people to catch up, and to work on other projects. If there is ever a time to look into Tank, I think then is the best time. Who knows, perhaps you have something in line on F7 that makes me look like a complete clown. I hope that you do.



I want to thank everyone who took the time to read this. It is my passion for this game put out for you all to read, and while I expect that there will be disagreement, I am still happy that I was able to do it. Even finishing this up is getting me emotional, which is silly considering who I am. But I am very grateful to you all.

-Amooseable​

title: Spiders den sucks!
body:
Particularly anybody who's done Tarantula slayers has hated this island, but some people like me hate it even more. In this thread I will tell you reasons why I hate the spider's den and what I would do to improve it.


Reasons:
1. The layout of this island is horribly built and consists of too many holes and pitfalls that make your slayer grind even worse
2. I don't know why people love hitting other people's slayer bosses but it's so annoying to me because I don't get the combat exp and sometimes people will aggro the boss to chase them and bring them to a far away place, kill it, boss drops digested and I have a 2-hour breakdown.
3. Gravel on this island seems to never appear even though there is practically over 1000 spaces for gravel to spawn (rough estimate)

What I will do to improve it
1. Make this place not have as many holes and pitfalls as well as more places for spiders to spawn
2. If you know, both Revenants and Svens have two different places to do bosses while Tarantulas only have one, which makes the Spider's Den a nightmare because Tarantulas give profit (I am writing this during the Aatrox event) the most and don't have the annoying critical hits like Revenants and Svens do. I suggest making a high level area for Spiders somewhere in the hub (maybe hidden in the mountains) so that some people can both go to the lower level area for gravel and collections and high level area for slayers (similar to Ruins and Howling Cave)
3. Make gravel more frequently to spawn. I easily spent an hour getting 50 gravel because gravel spawns like once every 69 seconds. This is important for the noobs out there who are grinding minions so this would be a great help to them (might as well make creeper minions easier to obtain lmao)

That is all. If you have any other opinions or suggestions, feel free to leave a comment!

title: Please fix golems
body: Golems, also known as Endstone Protectors, are incredibly broken at the moment. Anyone with a midas staff and a few bonemerangs in elegant tux can kill it in about half a second. This is not too much of a problem other than it means anyone who doesn't have about 200 million coins to spend on killing a golem can't do any damage with even people who can deal 100k damage per hit only getting 3rd or 4th place. All this is not too bad, most people can put up with it, but the worst part comes in most of these people dont actually bother to kill that many zealots and maybe get a few crystal fragments out of it at most. I feel this is unfair to players like myself who have to melee the golem and have 100s of zealots contributed can't ever get more than a few 100k dmg, or even sometimes (in my experience) none at all, meaning the last hour of their time that they spent killing zealots is relatively wasted. I propose two solutions: the first one is just making golems immune to magic damage (damage from mage weapons, such as the midas staff), however this one probably isn't the best option so my second proposal is simply that golems health is increased massively, to maybe 15 million or even 20 million, allowing melee players to get damage in before the golem is basically one tapped by someone with a midas staff or any other method, while still allowing people with such weapons to get their own damage in.

title: Very disturbing thing I saw a month or 2 ago.
body:
I am a new player to skyblock, so I see things every day that are confusing and use them to learn more about the game. However, ever since I made this account to report a bug I found a few days ago. But when I made the account I could not stop thinking about something very disturbing I saw a while ago. This may trigger some people so be warned. This is not graphic or anything and most likely a rng thing but still shocking. I see these spinning characters every now and again, which I still have no idea why they are a thing or how they are triggered but they circle you like a hallucinations and do 2-3 spins. It's a player model with a skin and name usually. I don't usually catch the name because it appears for a second also meaning I can't screenshot but 1 time when I did I was shocked. The name was Derek Chauvin, and even worse in a police skin! If I am not mistaken this is the man that killed George Floyd and caused mass unrest among the USA. I have theories as to why this could have occurred but all seem to be preventable. First is that there is a pool of skins and already existing names that code chooses from and spawns the ghost. Or similar like takes some Hypixel players name and skin. All of this being so rare that it seems impossible.

I would really like a response for this. It is surprising that the most popular server in all of Minecraft that has all age groups can allow that to be in the game.

PS. I don't want to sound like a "Karen" but I think this should be brought up.

Edit: 
Thank you for informing that its anti-cheat, but I think its still pretty bad that they use other cheater names which usually have slurs or are inappropriate for the server. I think they should make filters for that or manually remove it.

title: why increasing the skill level cap isn't that bad
body:
Excuse me admins, but what the ****? (25 Positive Reactions)

 
Minutes ago, Minikloon posted this (now deleted) image on his twitter. The admins broke one of their key promises. To not go beyond Lvl 50 skills. You are literally trying to kill your player base at this point. The other perks are fine, but the only thing that this Skill change will...




hypixel.net





So assuming the farming update leak (thread linked above) isn't faked and isn't changed by the time of release, that means farming will now have a cap of 51. The other rewards, the event itself, and everything else the update has to offer aside, I want to focus on the skill cap increase. Based on that thread, I'm guessing it's the popular opinion that a skill cap increase is bad, but why is that? I really don't see why a skill cap increase is so bad.

The main issue I see with this is people who want to max all their skills having to grind more. Yes, an extra skill level means a couple million more xp needed to unlock, but why is that bad? Skyblock is an endless grind. With a constant flow of new updates, new content is frequently being added, which means you need to grind more to be truly maxed out. I don't see how needing to get new dungeon weapons or needing to recombobulate all accessories is any different from increasing the skill cap.

When new weapons were added, people didn't complain about there being new stuff to max out, they complained about other things, like power creep happening too early into dungeons. If you weren't complaining about having to max out a livid dagger after maxing out an aotd, why are you complaining about having to get farming 51 after getting farming 50? The need to grind is no different from anything else.

Imo, you really shouldn't be playing skyblock to max everything out unless 1) you're fine with new stuff like this being inevitably added, or 2) you set a goal for yourself that isn't maxing everything out. If farming 51 is added, set a goal for skill avg 50 instead of skill avg 50.125. If not, you're already playing the game to grind. Adding another skill level isn't any different than adding new accessories to reforge and recombob. If you're gonna complain about having to do more grinding, then plead the admins to never update the game past the current point.

title: idea: the event update(30 positive reactions)
body:
firstly before i start a few things.
i wont be think very much about grammar and spelling
many of these ideas come from other people but they r not complete ripoffs since i have taken them and changed them
i wont be using spoilers since i think it gets messy idk why

2020/08/03

umm.. the admins will be releasing a update where you elect NPCs...
Could I get a creative mind??!!!!

well.. same thing the admins seem to be doing something in style with my Olympic Games idea.
 THE EVENT UPDATE
this update is a bit of a mix of diffrent smaller updates and we will be starting whit they mayor system.


 MAYORAL SYSTEM
recently in the lobby remake there was an important change most people didnt notice/ care about. this was the house where seraphine sits. before she was mayor. but this has now been changed to clerk, and outside of the building worker emma talks about the uppcoming election. here is my take on it.

every 4 sb years ( like 1,5 weeks irl) there is an election. its works like this: the election is just like other evnts but it only happens once every 4 years, and it last for a full season. every 4th year during the full spring season ( yes other events like traveling zoo can take plce during this time) 3 or 5 randomly choosen candidets will be standing on display in the town hall. all of them will be providing certain boost at about the same strenght. if you r online during this event only have to go to the town hall, look at the stats provided and then choose the one they like the most at a npc in the corner of the room. when the season is over all the votes are counted and the candidate whit the most votes wins. as soon as the election is over the boosts a candidate has offered are applied. these will then last for the next 4 years. the buffs can be litrely anything, it could be that all potions last 10% longer or that you earn 5% more exp from all skills.
as i said earliar ther will be 3-5 candites ( not that it is diffrent from time to time but it deppends on how many possible people there are to be choosen from)
so there will be an amount of diffrent posible mayors im thinking maybe 10, and lets say 3 can become candites, so it will work a bit like dark auction and traveling zoo. if there are more possible mayors there could be up to 5 candites.

so here are the possible mayors. ( fell free to suggest more )

SPEEDER:
speeder loves speed and wants evr1 to experince to felling of running around the lobby.
gives 50 more base speed and a 10% speed increse. also makes the speed cap 100 higher. whooooooooooooooooooosh

ROSE:
rose is a simple balanced pereson that doesnt like picking sides she does a bit of evrything and tries her best to help others. the only thing she doesnt like is wierdly cosmetics and flowers. its said that this started when she was a kid and her parents forced her to always wear roses, and even named her rose.
Gives a 5% exp buff for all skills. ( maybe 10% if thats to low)

STAN:
always works hard and loves grinding, will specialize in one thing and then grind for days or even week for hours on end. has 3 skills maxed and over 300k zealot kills.
increases minon speed by 15% of their base speed. ( is not affected or affects any minion fules, so if a minion as e charcoal it will work 35% quicker)

MORGAN:
a powerful mage that when not runing for mayor. farms dungeons, has one of the highest mana scores in the game. once when playing f4 the secong before the dungeon started all her teammates got kicked, she solod it in less than 10 minutes.
gives a 10% stat boost to all players in dungeons ( after all other buffs) ( this incluedes all stats) and another 10% mana buff in and outside of dungeons.

DAVID:
An archolegist that has been exavaiting dungeons, seems to have uncoverd the dungeon loot system.
increases dungeon loot by 10% ( not sure how it would work, but made in a way so if you for examlpe get a recomb evry 50 rounds you now get it ( on avrege ) in 45 rounds)

RURGION:
A dwarf helped found the farms in the mountain and revolutionised dwarf society. loves farming.
20% extra fraing exp and 10% more crops.

TANYA:
a barve warrior whit maxed combat and foraging. level 25 berserk ( as of rn will probably increase cuz she clears dungeon 5 hours every day) in her wardrobe she has every single warrior set.
10% more meele dmg.

LIGHTEYE
hER arrows will pierce through your heart as She jumps tree to tree. Be wary that at any moment, She can strike.
+50% arrow damage
+20 aiming ( also works in dungeons)

BRUCE
Believes that all problems must be solved by walking into them, so his skin is as hard as dragon armor.
+100 defense
+50 HP

k, so i will add more but dont really have the inspiration for it rn i would be thankfull if people suggest more.


 THE OLYMPIC GAMES
So there also as been another recent update most people havent cared/ know about: coluseum is closed, it was one of the most useless fetures mostly causing lagg. the admins are working on fixing this. but i have an idea:

the olympic games happen evry 4 years ( 2 years from the ellections ) and any can particapate. this is how it work:
the event just like the mayor system takes place every 4 years during the full spring, so more people can participate. when the event starts there is displayed 5 challeges ( and one joke challenge( it still gives the same bonuses but is dumb))
they last for the full spring and when its over the winners claim there prizes. ill explain how the prises work in a sec.
but first the how does the challenges work.

 The Challenges
so when the olimpic games begin there will be 5 challenges displayed ( and one joke challenge) ill be giving some xamples but there is toons of possibilitys.

DO THE MOST OF IT CHALLENGES.
cutting spruce wood
killing zombies
defeating scarf
defating sven packmasters
farming exp
mining coal

you get the point that kind of stuff and there is so many more possible.

JOKE CHALLENGES.
place the most jerrys.
go trough the most portals/jump pads in lobbies.
you get the point, the reason is so that newer players can get a chanse to get toons of money if they just grind. And it would be funny having a bunch of people in lapis jumping in and out of portals for 12 hour straight.'

THE REWARDS:
all challenges ( including the joke one) will give equal rewards working like this.
( the amount of money you get can be changed)
first place: omlympic cup, gold block says your name how much you did that task and first place. you also get 50m coins
second place: iron block, says all the stuff on it. 30m coins.
thirs place: emerlad block ( idk same stuff ) 20m coins.
top 100: gold nugget, named olimpyc medalion, whit your name your placement and how much of it you did. also 10m coins
top 1k iron nugget, same stuff 5m coins.

this is for all the evnts meaning there will be toons of money given out.

THE AWARD CERMONY
( the winners will during the award cermony be npc) the winners will stand on pedistals and for each of the diffrent competisons there will be an parade whit npc that have got parts of there skin on. the winners can then claim there prizes at the event master at any time.

THATS IT
k so im finnished now, im happy for likes but i would prefer comments so that i can improve this.
also sorry for using this: ( ) alot.
the last part didnt really fell complete but i dont knwo what more to add.
ty for reading have a great day

title: Allow players to see item names inside backpacks
body:
I've been scammed a few times with this method, the first time being completely dumb. The second time, there was a dude with one backpack in his inventory, 5 locked slots with nothing in them, a combat sack, and one piece of dirt. Nothing in his echest. The only backpack in his inventory had an elegant tuxedo, He screenshared with me showing me that there was indeed an elegant tuxedo inside said backpack.

I go with it, and trade. I got dyed leather armor. He had no extra armor in his wardrobe either. Maybe a bug with the combat sack or dirt block, I don't know.
My point is that we should be able to see the names of the items inside a backpack without the use of modifications. Texture packs also like to not work when there are items in a backpack. 
*Looks like an elegant tuxedo, is leather armor*




Texture packs like to not work when there are items in a backpack, I tested this with an actual tuxedo.

I lost my legendary shadow assassin chestplate over this, we need a fix.

title: [Lore Debunk] Why Leaflet is the 2nd best armor in the game!
body:
Here is a debunk to why Leaflet is technically the 2nd best in the game 

So, in order to start the debunking process, we need to estimate the amount of leaves per skyblock hub!
Google claims that there is around 200k leaves per tree.
There is currently an approximate of 104 trees in the Skyblocks hub and an additional of 3 ancient trees as well.

We can assume that ancient trees can have double the leaves of an average tree.

So, some simple math:
(104*200k)+3(400k)= 22 million leaves per skyblock hub

And as far as we know, how many skyblock hubs are there?
1225 hub servers.

If we multiply 22m by 1225, we get 26.95 billion leaves throughout skyblocks.

Why isn't there global warming yet in skyblocks?
This is because of the 26.95 billion leaves that prevents global warming which could end up destroying skyblock's environment.

Assume we have a war against leaflet and every other armor possible, who would win?
Well, 26.95b/24 = 1,122,916,666.666667 sets of leaflet armor possible

What can we see from history?
Quantity is always superior than quality.

One example can be in WW2, where Russia won against German's blitzkrieg through sheer numbers of T34 tanks compared to the heavily armored and complex design of the German tanks as well as a high budget cost.

Russia's low budget cost, cheap to make T34 tanks managed to withstand and advance through the German forces which proves our point of leaflet armor being the best in mass quantities!

Well, that is all so far for the debunk!

title: How To Reach Mid game (requirements, tips, money making methods)
body:
Welcome to this thread about how to get good at Skyblock! ​This thread applies to early game players struggling to enter the mid game, But how exactly do we enter this stage of the game, allow me to list a few requirements so you know the goals you need.

Requirements​1. Over 200 fairy souls, fairy souls are extremely important as they can provide a massive stat boost with giving over 400 health, 200 defence and 50 strength, meaning this is very vital for a early game player.

2. Talismans, talismans are also another extremely important aspect of the game, as they provide various stat boosts, talisman are also very useful to have, as you can choose which stat you want to boost by reforging the talisman to your liking. You will need 30+ talismans to be mid game.

3. Armour, for armour your gonna have to have either ender armour, with gp5 and p5 or dragon armour as for dragon armour its recommended to use unstable or young for your first set as they both provide 2 important stats (speed and damage), you can basiccly use any sort of armour as long as you get decent health and defence as well as damage (decent being 600+ health and 200+ defence)

4. Weapon, for weapons you will need one of the following, maxed raiders axe, aspect of the dragons, leaping sword or maxed aspect of the end, other wise your gonna need to be dealing over 13k damage enough to one tap zealots.

5. Minions, for minions your gonna want to have over 17+ minion slots and all your minions that are working being over tier 7, not much else to say about minions

6. Slayers, for slayers i may be wrong but you should be slayer 4 4 4 meaning revenants, svens and taras are all level 4 which is quite a common level for slayers.

7. Networth, networth isnt very important but you should have a networth of over 5mil+.

8. Skill average, sa is very very important as it provides heaps of stat boosts, so for sa you should have a skill average of over 17+, recommended is over 18 sa, correct me if im wrong.


So we just went over all the requirements but how would you reach those requirements? Well there are heaps of youtube videos about it but ill lists a few tips and tricks so dont worry.


Tips​1. For fairy souls i recommend watching time deos video on all fairy soul locations or fairy soul way points.

2. For talismans you can either purchase them off the auction house or creating them through multiple collections such as emerald collection.

3. Armour, make sure you have a reliable source of money such as zealot farming, potato farming or coco bean farming just make sure you have one to allow easy access to this armour.

4. Weapons, not much to say but again make sure you have a good money making method so you can purchase them.

5. Minions, to unlock minions alot of people upgrade them to tier 5 or 7 by purchasing the resources of the bazaar.

6. Slayers, really something you learn over time or quickly not much to say.

7. Networth, be rich lol.

8. Skill average, this is important so usually you should get mining, fishing, alchemy and enchanting to level 16 then get foraging to level 20 as well as farming to level 20 then combat 18 this will level your sa to 18, to level up farming make sure you set up a full pumpkin farm for easy farming levels, combat just farm rev tier 3 or enderman.

So most of use want money making methods as they are important so ill quickly list a few.

Money making methods​1. Potato farming, to set one up you want to have full potato farm, this farm can provide around 1mil an hour, recommended way to farm it is through using a replenish hoe and a personal compactor 3000.

2. Zealot farming, this farming is very overrated and can give around 1mil and hour sometimes 2mil it depends on your luck.

3. Coco bean farming, i myself have created a afk coco bean farm so if you want i can make a thread about it, it makes around 1.5mil an hour.


I hope you enjoy, ill be listing more money making methods really soon. Please leave a positive reaction it would be appreciated, have a great day!

title: My Version of the Sadan Boss Fight
body:
this thread is irrelevant lol
Boss Room
The Boss Arena will be a circular shape, similar to Livid and Thorn's Boss Rooms. Sadan will sit on a throne in the middle, surrounded by 4 Eternal Flame campfires that will play a pretty huge part in the Boss Fights

The Boss Fight
[Opening Speech]
[Sadan]"Well it looks like you adventurers have finally made it down here"
[Sadan]"I'll admit, even though i've killed a Wither, its impressive that you've managed to beat Thorn and Livid despite their immense powers"
[Sadan]"But let me warn you, adventurers. You've made a mistake challenging me"
[Sadan] "Let me show you the power of the Necromancer Lord himself"

[Winning Speech]
[Sadan]"Looks like i underestimated your capabilities"
[Sadan]"I thought you'd be worthy of my True Power"
[Sadan]"Oh Well..."
Phase I


Spoiler: Boss Stats




Health25000000Spawn LocationThe Catacombs - Floor VISpecial BehaviourInvincible unless the Eternal Flames are put out
Beating a Sub Phase in over 90s will make Sadan deal 5%more damage in the next Sub-Phase(Phase 3)



In this phase, Sadan will charge, dealing Huge amounts of Damage towards the nearest players and shoot fireballs dealing True Damage at farther players. Mobs named Sadan Followers will spawn and try to swarm the players. Unlike other bosses, Sadan is invincible against all damage, and only is vulnerable when all 4 Eternal Flame Campfires are put out. Campfires will ignite themselves 20 seconds after being put out. Once Sadan reaches 15000000 HP, he will teleport back at his throne and summon his Forcefield, meaning that Phase 2 has started

[Phase Transition Speech]
[Sadan]"You adventurers were stronger than i thought"
[Sadan]"But i wont let you have the advantage!"
[Sadan]"My Spectrals will take care of you"
[Sadan]"Go forth, my Spectrals, and obliterate those who oppose the Wither Slayer"
Phase II
During this phase. Sadan will remain stationary at his throne and to advance to the next phase, the players will need to defeat a wave of Spectrals in under 2 minutes or else Sadan will revert back to Phase 1, with a 10% increase in damage.
All Spectrals has 33% Magic Resistance


Spoiler: Undeads




MobsHealthSpecial AbilityDefiled Spectral5000000Poisons you for 2000 Hp/sFiery Spectral8000000Ignites players dealing 1500 Hp/s and slows them downEnder Spectrals10000000Teleports at players and deals 10% more damage than other SpectralsArachnid Spectrals2500000Is the fastest of all the Spectrals. Shoots webs at players every 10s, slowing them down by 20%



If you managed to beat the horde of Spectrals in under 2 minutes, you will advance to the Final Phase.

[Phase Transition Speech]
[Sadan]"Looks like my Spectrals aren't strong enough to hold you adventurers down"
[Sadan]"But dont underestimate someone who isn't afraid to lose everything to prove who's best"
[Sadan]"I will now merge with my Eternal Flames and be stronger than ever"
[Sadan]"Now, its time to show you my True Power."

But if you didn't managed to beat the horde in under 2 minutes, you will be greeted with a special message and Sadan will revert to Phase 1

[Special Message]
[Sadan]"You fought well but it looks like you're too late"
[Sadan]"I'm back and this time i'll defeat all of you with ease"
[Sadan]"This is where your journey ends"
Phase 3
In the Final phase, Sadan will regen back to full health and will go through 5 Sub-Phases every 5m HP Sadan loses, each Sub-Phase representing one boss fought before. Spectrals will also still spawn, although at lesser rates than Phase 2. 
Sub-Phase 1
In the first Sub-Phase, Sadan will try to run away from the player while shooting Fireballs at players, dealing True Damage. Every 25s, he will teleport to the center and shoots Fireballs at every direction, each Fireball dealing 2x the damage. After he loses 5m Health, he transitions to Sub-Phase 2
Sub-Phase 2
In Sub-Phase 2, Sadan will spawn 4 Spectrals, each has 8mil Health and representing a Dungeon Class. While the Spectrals are alive, Sadan will recieve -50% Damage. Every 30s He will shoot Soul Sand projectiles at the Player who deals the highest damage to the Spectral. After he loses 5m Health, he transitions to Sub-Phase 3
Sub Phase 3
Sadan spawns 4 invulnerabe Spectral Guardians and each will try to shoot a Laser Beam at the players. Sadan himself will try to melee players, targeting Healers. After he loses 5m Health, he transitions to Sub-Phase 4
Sub Phase 4
After Sub-Phase 3, Sadan will become invincible and his Spectral Undeads are replaced with Spectral Bulls, Spectral Chickens, and Spectral Wolves. Every 5s, a Spectral Sword will spawn at the center. Hitting Sadan with his Spectral Sword will take down 2.5m Health. If a player misses, the Spectral Animal's damage will be increased by 8% each time
Sub Phase 5
In his final Sub-Phase, Sadan will produce 3 Clones of himself, each having 5m Health. Killing the wrong one will Heal the other Clones by 25% Max Hp and increase their DPS by 5%. After his Health drops to 0, the Boss Fight is finally over

[Ending Speech]
[Sadan]"You finally did it, huh. You've finally beat me"
[Sadan]"Look like my time here is over..."
[Sadan]"But beyond these doors lie unimaginable evils known as Withers"
[Sadan]"I mean, i've beaten one before, but i dont know if you got what it takes"
[Sadan]"They've been growing stronger and stronger since i first fought them"
[Sadan]"I'm warning you adventurers, you will be ripped apart by these evils"
"Sadan's body explodes into a fiery mess and his throne is destroyed. The Door behind the throne opens and the portal to the next floor opens. You adventurers, unsure of what to do, reluctantly travel to Floor VII"

Boss Loot


Spoiler: Boss Loot



Spectral Battleaxe(Bedrock)
Spectral Battleaxe is a Legendary Sword that is only obtainable in Bedrock chests in F6. It is primarily used by Berserkers
Stats:
+350 Damage
+225 Strength
+40 Crit Chance

Item Ability: Spectral Strike
Every time you kill an enemy, this sword gains +1 Damage and +1 Strength. Stacks dissapear after 15s
Max Stack: 100
Terrabrand(Emerald+)
Terrabrand is a Legendary Sword that is only obtainable in Emerald/Obsidian/Bedrock chests in F6. It is primarily used by Tanks
Stats:
+275 Damage
+150 Strength
+250 Defense

Item Ability: Terra Shield
Gives you and all nearby players an Absorption Shield that protects Players from 5 hits and deals 25% of the players DPS to enemies that hit the player
Mana Cost: 400
Cooldown: 10s
Undying Staff(Obsidian+)
Undying Staff is a Legendary Sword(Stick) that is only obtainable in Obsidian/Bedrock chests in F6. It is primarily used by mages
Stats:
+180 Damage
+50 Strength
+500 Intelligence

Item Ability: Undying Barrage
Shoots a Zombie Head at enemies that deals 15000 Ability Damage, slows them down and decreases their Defense by 25
Mana Cost: 150
Deathly Whisperer(Emerald+)
Deathly Whisperer is a new Legendary Bow that is only obtainable in Emerald/Obsidian/Bedrock chests in F6.
Stats:
+265 Damage
+160 Strength
+100 Crit Damage

Item Ability: Whispering Death
Shoots 3 homing fireballs at the targeted enemy, dealing damage based on how many enemies were killed before being used
Mana Cost: 300
Cooldown: 5s
Eternity I Ultimate Enchantment Book(Gold+)
Eternity I is an Armor Ultimate Enchant that decreases damage taken from all sources by 4% after killing 5 enemies for 5s

title: Clay minons v snow minions
body:
There are always these fights about clay minions and snow minions. 
Clay minions are better for the starter-mid game minions, because of the low cost. It's about 400k for each t11 clay minion, and not 1 mil for each snow minion. You'll also need a super compactor 3000, because their almost useless without one. You don't NEED a enchanted lava bucket, so I'm going to keep those out. 

Here's what I'm trying to get clear- Clay minions are so much more cheaper, about 1 mil each minion, while snow minions will cost an extra half a mil. There craftable, they're easy to get, and they make almost the same amount of money compared to a snow minion. 
Although snow minions will be the better one over time, clay minions are so much better for starter to mid game. 
But I guess Skyblock is always about spending a butt ton of money to get slightly better stuff. 
What do you guys think

title: Calculating The Time It Would Take To Get 99,000,000 ink sacs
body:
So you may we wondering, why do you want 99 million ink sacs? Well it's simple. It's for the memes.

There's only 1 way to get inc sacs that doesn't include the bazaar and that's fishing. The fastest way to get our sacs is to go fish in the park.

Assuming we use full shark armor, legion V, a legendary dolphin pet, etc. we can get a 100% SCC which is really good for us. Though we will need to use spiked bait so no bonus speed (tell me if I'm wrong).

From my personal experience in the park with rain I was able to get squid 19 in 20 sea creature catches and assuming we can get 1 reel every 5 seconds then we should in essence get 1 squid every 5.25 seconds.

Best case scenario is that we get 3 ink sacs per squid. However night squid exist too and can give up to 27 ink sacs. From my experience I've gotten 1 night squid every 15 squid so that means we get roughly 5.5 ink sacs per reel. Now time for the division.

60/5.25*5.5 = 62 ink sacs per minute
Additionally 1 squid spawns roughly every 30 seconds and if you get a friend to kill it for you give you the loot we get 68 ink sacs a minute

Now lets say we have some friends that kill our squids for us and they have a level 100 legendary squid pet. Now we basically get 136 ink sacs a minute!

99,000,000/136/60/24/365 = 1.38 years to acquire 99 million ink sacs.
Not bad. It's a respectable speed. If you sold this all to an NPC that'd be 198 easy million coins.

This was incredibly stupid. Why did I do it you may ask?
To simply have fun which is what the forums should be about lol.

Thanks to @M00N & @Dumplingsushi & @RemButMasterWarlord for helping refine the calculations

title: SkyBlock - Jerry Event ~ Question about gifts lasting through waves
body:
Can you leave presents on the floor or will they despawn?

So I've had a had a thought...everyone loves to use the cannons in the Jerry event and most people don't want to get off till the event is over. That is understandable...but a question that I have not found a satisfactory answer to is that, at the end of each wave a bunch of presents spawn from every pile of presents that you managed to save from the magma cubes. These presents sit on the ground and can only be picked up by the player who can see them. (Each player who deals 100 or more damage gets their own set of presents.) 

The issue that people like we what an answer to is, can we hog the cannons for the whole event and leave our presents on the floor the whole time and pick them up when the event is over and its pointless to sit on the cannons anymore?

The answer is YES, you can sit on the cannons for the WHOLE event and your loyal presents will be there waiting for you for at the end of the event. No one an pick them up and they will not despawn. 



Spoiler: Proof



      




However...

Be careful...if you disconnect or leave/change lobbies, your presents will vanish and you cannot get them back.

So, armed with this knowledge..Go, and hog the cannons to your heart's content.

title: [Idea] How to add legal armor dyeing (Bits/Fire Sale) {Effort Post} [16 positive reactions]
body:
So what the heck am I talking about? 
I am suggesting to make ether a bits based dyeing system or based off of fire sales(maybe exclusive rank only cosmetics). Why would it cost gems, bits or a rank. This would be a 100% cosmetic update and Hypixel is like most companies for profit. This would boost their sales at no cost to the player base.

How dyeing would work
Everyone wants to dye their armor different colors because well its cool and some people don't like the color of their armor. Here are a few ideas on the how to make a system work. First I am going to lay out a few ideas on how you would actually change the armor's color.

Their could be an item when combined in an anvil changes the color of the armor piece to a pre set color or a player selected color
A pre set color would set the armor to that color
A player selected color would allow the player to choose what color they want. You can buy an un-dyed armor dye and then select the color. (Maybe: once the color is selected you can't change it)
This would work like combining any item in an anvil. armor + item = new color item.

The second way that dyeing armor could work would be a cauldron that when opened has a unique Gui that allows the user to select the color.
This could be per placed in a location(I would pick the flower house because its very related)
This could be an item bought that allows people to dye armor

How would a player be able to use these items
In this section I will talk about each type of item could be obtained and used. Starting with the most "expensive": Fire sales

Fire Sale: per selected item dye
This item could be set for what armor piece it goes on. For example you can put the Pink Superior Dragon Helmet dye on a sup helmet or it could be called the Love Superior Dragon Helmet dye. This method of having armor colors linked to a fire sale exclusives head skin is very nice because it allows the devs to make cool changes to armors while having them be matching.
 This item rather than being for just one armor piece could be sold as a set.
Or it could be for any armor and it changes the color. 

Fire Sale: user selected item color
This would work in a similar fashion to the per selected item dye. You can buy it thought the fire sale and apply it on an armor piece. The major difference here would be that it wold not be for specific armor pieces but rather for any armor that can be dyed.

Bit Shop: Selling armor dyes in the bit shop could be both per selected dyes or user selected colors(Or even both)
This wold be very similar to the current enrichments. There would be a dye in the bit shop and when clicked on it would open up a dye menu with a more expensive custom color selector and cheeper per selected colors(both ideas can work)

Bit Shop: Selling the dyeing cauldron in the bits shop.
The cauldron would be used to select custom colors for your armor. Might might even cost a pretty penny(like reforges)

Rank exclusives: The cauldron could be a rank exclusive item that you can buy or it might even be placed in the flower house.
It wold cost money to select the color.

Free but limited by rank: The cauldron in the flower house could be used to have limited access to color changes. This would be like rune crafting where you can kinda do it but you are restricted. Defaults would have access to a small amount of colors.

How to prevent scams?
A prevailing issue with endless amounts of player selected colors could be how people tend to scam. To over come this issue with potential scammers the ah and the trade menu will show the armors true color and it will have a tag on what the dyed color is too. Another solution to this would be to have it when selling on the ah(and maybe trade menus) the color of the armor resorts back to its original(standard) color. Trade menus should have the color removed unless trading with your coop mate because you don't just casually drop your sup chest for them to try on.

TLDR: Legal armor dyeing. Buy from bits shop or fire sale so Hypixel makes profit. Read the actual thing if you want to see how that could be implanted.

Feed back is appreciated. Also plz give reactions

Edits(probs misspelled things) :
Edit 1: had a not in the wrong spot
Edit 2: asked for reactions.

title: Tic Tac Toe is the hardest puzzle (satire)
body:
Tic Tac Toe. A childhood game that we learned to respect, growing up. With the release of dungeons, the Admins thought it would be a good idea to bring back our favorite game as a puzzle.

Countless famous members have failed it, leaving us to question, are they really that smart?

Today, I am going to prove to you why Tic Tac Toe is the hardest puzzle.

1. Tic Tac Toe has a total of 255168 possible possibilities with less than half of them being that you win. This means it is a <127584/255168 chance to get it right which can be written as <1/2 chance to get it right. This is less than a coin toss making it hard.

2. When playing Tic Tac Toe, you are playing against a robot. Robot's are programmed to do things whether good or bad. In this case, it is programmed to beat you. This is bad. Robot's are smarter than us.

All in all, TTT is the hardest game and if you even live to disagree with me, I will find you. then pat you on the back for actually having a brain

title: [Suggestion] Necromancy Overhaul
body:
Hey there!  xTear here!
I've been pretty absent from the forums, but I'm making my return with a mega-thread about an absolute overhaul to necromancy. Now, what is necromancy? Well, at the moment, pretty much nothing because it's so useless. Right now, there are like 3 good souls to summon, Sup LA, FA, and the Exalted Inquisitor. However, I was unhappy with those choices pretty much an hour after release and decided to start drafting up a much better version for souls. This was what I came up with:


Spoiler: Frozen Adventurer no.1









But... as cool as that was, it got pretty much no reactions except a few likes. So, I decided a few days ago to start compiling a huge suggestion thread with different mobs (A LOT OF THEM), easy buffs/changes to current gear, and a few menus to make things cleaner/have better QoL. All of these have received very positive feedback, so, I decided to reach out to the forums community and see what you all think! I will split this into 3 categories, mob changes, gear changes, and QoL. This is because I feel like necromancy is the most underrated and overlooked skill, and the amount of potential it has is incredible. Without further ado, enjoy.

Let's start with the mobs! I put ages into making these, and I hope you like them!


Spoiler: Common Mobs







yeah I only added one, you guys don't care about commons you wanna skip to the good ones





Spoiler: Uncommon Mobs











(again I made less of these because you prefer to see OP ones)





Spoiler: Rare Mobs









and now to all the cool ones,


Spoiler: Epic Mobs
























Spoiler: Legendary Mobs




































Spoiler: Mythic Mobs




















Spoiler: Supreme Mobs (yes i added supreme ones lol)













Whew! So I basically just redid the mob soul info thing which previously looked like this,


Spoiler: old info description









to look way better, give more info, and also give abilities to many of the mobs you would think would do something. This way, nothing is useless anymore, and the abilities you think would work, actually work.

Moving along to gear changes, you may have noticed that the mobs which I edited had this new cool feature saying "Left click to add to Soul Inventory" or "Left click to add to Soul Bag" (I haven't made up my mind yet on which I like more). This Soul Inventory is a viewable menu in your skyblock menu, which has a various amount of slots. (Default 3, upgradable to 9 for 100k per extra slot). From this menu, you are able to save, store, and rearrange what souls you want and where you want them. Different items still are limited by how many souls they can individually store (with the exception of having Sadan in your necromancer item, as it increases the capacity by 1). When you move a soul from a weapon to your soul inventory, you can click them from your soul inventory and assign them to any necromancer weapon in your inventory with space available, or delete them forever (with a confirmation for epic rarity or higher of course!)
Next, I redid the summoning ring. In my opinion, the summoning ring was the most damaging item that could have been added. It basically made Reaper Scythe and Necromancer Sword absolutely worthless. For those who don't know, a summoning ring allows you to pick up mobs regardless of what you kill them with so long as it is in your inventory instead of needing to kill that mob with a necromancer weapon. As nice as this is, it buried scythe even more, and ruined the necromancer sword. I propose that the summoning ring still eliminates the need to kill something with a necromancer weapon, but I think it shouldn't be able to hold souls. Additionally, I made it a dungeon accessory. Here is my redone version.


Spoiler: Summoning Ring v2









For current Summoning Rings that have OP mobs in them that people want to use, it will continue to show souls, but you will not be able to summon them. Clicking on it to use them will only show its soul menu and prompt you to either delete or move them.
Next, I propose a complete redo to the necromancer armor ability. Instead of increasing the damage (pretty useless), it should give a full set bonus total buff to all souls stats by 10%. This way, the armor is useful. Additionally, upgrading with Sadan fragments (dropped from Floor 7 watcher) will make this set bonus +15% to all soul stats, and it will buff the armor to base mythic, which can be recombolulated to Supreme! I do think that the armor should increase the number of soul slots in different necromancer items still. That's a great feature that should stay.

QoL Changes:
1. Limit to a maximum of 8 souls spawned at once between all necromancer items.
2. Give Necromancer Sword a +50% Higher Chance to find Souls from Mobs. (1/100 becomes 1.5/100)
3. Give Reaper Scythe a +25% Higher Chance to find Souls from Mobs. (1/100 becomes 1.25/100)

And that brings us to the end of my latest post! Thanks so much for reading! What do you think about it? Feel free to leave a comment below! ​

title: [PETITION] Make Creative Corner Idea Threads be moved
body:
When Teddy introduced the Creative Corner, it was a place for artists to have their work recognized in a more organized way. However, this good intention didn't play out well, as most forumers don't know that this section exists, and even so, artworks taking several hours of hard work are moved to the second page by threads like "idea: light gray terracotta minion!!!!" The section for this is Ideas and Feedback (I'm a bit hypocritical here, this thread is technically an idea/feedback, but I need >1 people reading this so).
It'll greatly benefit everyone if these idea threads were moved to either the skyblock section or Ideas and Feedback section.

title: time to restart my journey as an ender non
Second profile removed
body:
So basically I have a main profile where I play most of the time, and a second profile I created just because I wanted to know how much time would I need to get a perfect diamond armor from scratch. (Basically I only log into that profile to collect the diamond minions and craft the armor).

Today I logged in and noticed that the second profile was gone. I have no idea what happened, I didn't break any rules. (I have never traded with that profile, I don't even leave my island).

All I had was the default island, and a platform with about 6 or 7 diamond minions, all diamonds where used to craft perfect diamond armor, none of them were sold / traded.

Also I don't afk, haven't found / used any exploits, haven't used any mods except Optifine, I haven't scammed anyone, nor have I traded with that profile.

And I don't think I was hacked, since my main profile (Which has way more stuff) is intact. 

Is there a way to see what hapened or a way to contact the staff and clear this up? I don't think I have done anything that breaks the rules on any of my profiles.

Thanks in advance.
