body:
As some of you may know, there has been a foraging method going around that allowed you to plant trees on your island and make up to a million foraging exp an hour. It involved placing saplings with a builder's wand and then farming the trees that grew.
Today, many of us awoke to see this message.




This was an unfair removal.
The builders wand did everything it was supposed to. Placing saplings was an intended feature.

Unlike Ghast Farming, which was macroable, this was not. It took effort to build the farm, plant, and destroy the trees. I see no reason for the admins to remove this as it is has pretty much the exactly the same effect as a Replenish enchanted hoe had on farming.

Bring back Sapling Placement.

Edit: I'm going to try to spread this as much as possible so there's a bigger possibility admins can see.
My message to admins: Please consider reversing your shadow deletion of sapling placement, it harms more people than you think, it invalidates hours of effort. A nerf would be better received.

Edit two: I'm going to add suggestions for nerfs here so that maybe admins will reconsider adding it!
@Sir_Bacon_2020 suggested to keep it in the game, but nerf the exp gain.
@Kashapo suggested to not nerf the exp, but instead make the saplings grow slower.
@Athyestic suggested that the trees grow according to the Terraria rules, such as: " There must be at least three open tiles between two Saplings or only one will grow into a tree. " so that there are not as many trees.

title: One of the new hardest items to get in Skyblock is a hoe.
body:
With the addition of the new specialized hoes/axes, farming most crops has become much easier. Nearly all of the crop types have a specialized tool, one of which being wheat. As of 0.9.11, you can get the Euclid's Wheat Hoe, of which there are 3 tiers.





The Highest Tier Euclid's Wheat Hoe.

Hang on, what are those haybale-looking items in this recipe? Those happen to be Tightly-Tied Hay Bales, which can be unlocked at 100k wheat collection. Each of those can be crafted from 144 Enchanted Hay Bales. Since the recipe requires 256x of the Tightly-Tied Hay Bales, the recipe requires 256 x 144 or 36,864 Enchanted Hay Bales. Including the 256 Enchanted Hay Bales needed for the 2nd tier, you would need over 37,000 Enchanted Hay Bales to craft this item. As I am writing this thread, Enchanted Hay Bales cost approx. 15,000 coins each on the Bazaar. Some quick multiplication will tell you that in order to buy all 37,000 Enchanted Hay Bales needed to craft this item, you would need over 550 million coins. For reference, most of the Legendary Ender Dragons on the Auction House are under 200 million coins. That's an expensive hoe.

Okay, so you probably won't be buying the materials to craft this item anytime soon. Instead, how about you manually farm the wheat. That shouldn't take too long, right? Let's go back to our 37,000 Enchanted Hay Bales. Each Enchanted Hay Bale is equivalent to 144x standard Hay Bales. In turn, each Hay Bale consists of 9x wheat. 37,120 * 144 * 9 = 45.1 million Wheat needed to craft this item. If you were to break 20 wheat crops per second, and on average you got 10 Wheat from each of those crops, you would have to spend over 2 and a half days straight farming for all this wheat. More specifically, this would take you 67 hours to do. And unless you are a high farming level, with a high level Legendary Elephant I feel like 10 Wheat is a generous estimate.

Basically, if you want the Highest Tier Euclid's Wheat Hoe, you'd either need to spend over 550 million coins on it, or spend close to 3 IRL days grinding the materials to make it. Either way, it's hard to get.

tl;dr: The highest tier wheat hoe would cost over 500 million coins to make, or take 2 1/2 days to grind for. Basically, it's expensive as hell.

title: Summoning Eye Stealers
body:
This has happened to me countless times, and now that it's happened Countless and 1. I'm saying something about this.

Today was like any other day, and I was just grinding Zealots, got a few eyes, lets say 3. And I wanted one more in this lobby, so I started to get lazy, and E-bow, while listening to music. Then I got a special, found it nowhere. And immediately asked who stole it. Nobody said anything. (Obviously) But at that time, I had been grinding for four eyes, for about 5 hours when I got my 4th. I asked again to receive these friendly messages. ( I understand that eyes are only 575k, (currently) but I really need money sometimes, and at this moment, I only have 1.3m.)
















I realize that my response to this guy comes off as toxic, and paints a bad picture for me. But, keep in mind, I was farming for like 5 hours today, and I was just done with people anyway.

So please, Simon, I hope you see this. And consider what you could change, or how you could fix this issue. Maybe only party members can pick up your eye, or eyes go to your inventory even if you aren't the one to kill the Zealot. Thank you for your time, and good night or morning, or evening to all.

title: The Story of Scarf [Effort Post]
body:
This is the 3rd part of my alternate timeline for the Hypixel Skyblock dungeons lore that will eventually be turned into a megathread (If I don’t get bored of writing these or nobody cares)
The Watcher: https://hypixel.net/threads/the-sto...-reactions-effort-post.3487549/#post-24884507
Bonzo: https://hypixel.net/threads/the-story-of-bonzo-5-positive-reactions-effort-post.3494435/

A bit of Scarf's backstory: Scarf was just a child when The Calamity happened. He had just gotten a red scarf from his mother whom he loved dearly. When The Calamity happened, Necron found him and took him under his wing and made The Professor teach Scarf the dark arts.

Scarf just killed a group of puny adventurers and put them in crypts to resurrect. He though to himself that this was a crazy idea but it might work. When the next group of adventurers came they thought it was going to be easy as some of their friends said but they had no idea what was coming. 

Scarf revived all of the old adventurers from their crypts and then realized that it was still just as easy for the adventurers. He also realized what Bonzo's problem was. The humans didn't ever have to fight the undeads, they just targeted Scarf or Bonzo. Scarf decided to try to learn an invulnerability spell, making a shield that fully protects him from the humans. It worked so he used it on the next group. The adventurers here were usually enough to kill Scarf, but they didn’t know that Scarf had grown stronger. Scarf's undeads turned the adventurers from living to dead in a few minutes as they tried hitting Scarf but couldn't. The undeads kept hitting the puny humans. Eventually, the humans realized what Scarf had done and tried to fight their way out of it. But it was already too late. The undeads were also now using the humans gear against them, magic, healing, archery and swordplay. All skills that regular undeads didn't have. The humans realized that this was the last thing they would do. Scarf abandoned the old undeads, as they came from a weaker group. He took the new adventurers and put them in the crypts. Now he could beat some of the parties that beat him before.

He started seeking revenge and told his master, The Professor, who sent his message further to Thorn, who said that he could be in the test fight that The Watcher tested the adventurers on before sending them to the boss room. Scarf was happy with that and went down to floor 4 and put a weaker copy of himself on his floor. The Professor also passed the message to Livid who trained Scarf to be even stronger who now made 2 copies of himself and put one on floor 2 in the boss room, and one to be revived by The Watcher on floor 4.

Just a quick end note, I have one run on F3 where I wasn’t really paying attention to what was happening so the lore might start to be not so good anymore. I have never seen any videos of the Thorn fight or the Livid fight, but I have seen a few of the Sadan fight. It might be difficult to have good lore for Maxor, Goldor, Storm and Necron, considering those floors are not released yet. I have never even tried F4 or F5 in general cause I'm a noob. Anyway if you enjoyed it please give it a bump and a positive reaction. When I finish writing the lore for The Professor it will be linked here --->

title: entirety of skyblock summarized in one sentence #2
body: Yeah that's right, we're doing this again boys, entirety of skyblock summarized into one compact, grammatically correct, run-on sentence with more commas than my number of wins in bedwars, also the reason why I'm doing this again is because from the last time I did this, there's been a lot of updates and stuff so here we gooo: so you may have heard of this minigame called hypixel skyblock, it's a very well known minigame with an extremely active forums and stuff like that, so, hmm how should we go about this summary, well first let's go over skills yeah that sounds right, so skills are basically this set of leveling systems where you do certain tasks to level up your skills; there are many types of skills like combat (stabby stabby mob, or pierce them with ice shards, or shoot arrows at them, etc just ruin their lives as a whole and you're good to go), mining (pickaxe break ores, that's literally the simplest skill), foraging (tree chop chop), fishing (magical fishing mechanics; fish up mystical sea creatures and stab them, or just fish up pre-killed fish, that's fine too), enchanting (do some enchanting stuff like anvil-ing and yeah), taming (level up pet stuff I guess), farming (get crops, easy), alchemy (brew some potions that are completely useless since there's the god potion item), runecrafting (get glowy rocks, make cooler glowy rocks), carpentry (do the second half of the term "minecraft", just like 14 million times), and dungeoneering (do dungeons), probably more and I'm just unaware of the update but it's like I'm going to go on google and check or anything, no, all of this is coming from my brain, my very small and limited yet somehow still functioning brain, anyhow, we are going to go over the islands now, so we begin with the private island, where people spawn, chop down a tree for foraging level one (that one tree is something you'll never see again, that is NOT A NATURAL TREE), maybe break some dirt, bridge to the other island, talk to some villager boi, meet your first slave, get the materials for your first cobblestone generator (water bucket and lava bucket, two essential items for the original skyblock map SIKE, you can buy them from a merchant for like 32 coins), ignore said materials for the cobblestone generator, walk into the portal, and then you log onto wynncraft (yes, I had to put a Technoblade reference here, otherwise people lose interest assuming they haven't done so already, which is pretty dumb since this is only like, what, 20 lines of run-on sentences, nah, this is fine), and next we will go over the hub: an island full of NPCs, most of which are useless (be honest, who's ever talked to that one NPC, yeah you know who I'm talking to, I see you reading this post, NPC, you can't hide from me, go crawl back in your house where you belong, that's right, you're useless, man, no one likes you), and tons of completely normal original skyblock items and mechanics such as wheat plots that infinitely plant more wheat, same thing but smaller versions for potatoes and nether wart, an enchanted forest filled with regenerating trees and log piles (some of which spawn with rails and ladders), a coal mine location with tons of free rocks and tiny black fuel units (all infinite by the way), and other places which we'll go over, but this was simply a summary of the hub, oh yeah we're spending the next eight paragraphs on the hub, yes I plan to make this thread EXTREMELY long so buckle in your seat and watch, so let's do this chronologically first, when you jump through the portal from your private island (you can actually save the bridging part and just do /hub, it's really easy in my opinion), then you are told to talk to 12 different villagers which are scattered through the map, you can go over to the builder's house place and claim your first weapon, a golden sword which upon right clicking, you get a small speed boost at the low low cost of HALF YOUR MANA (only for the beginning, once you get more intelligence, you'll have more than 100 mana, it just consumes 50 mana which since I'm a math major, I was able to run extraordinary calculus related mathematical calculations and discover that 2*50=100 therefore it's half your mana so does that answer your question for the three people who wanted to know), uh where was I, oh right so you talk to the 12 villagers which I'm not happy with the location of one of them, you know how there's a small pond between the auction house and graveyard and how there's a small area there with a few benches (almost put a question mark, that would ruin my plan), well it turns out that there's a villager there that you have to talk to so that's pretty dumb I would say, anyway, once you talk to all the villagers, you get a few hundred coins, then you can talk to George the Pet scammer (seriously he buys a legendary ender dragon for like 500 coins shake my head), then talk to Kat (she's underage so shut up about her jeez so many weird people), then you can do many other things, there's a ton of side quests here which I'll just call them whatever I want since they don't have a real "name", so firstly, the banker quest, you put coins into the man and boom you're done, then the auction house guy, you just talk to the Auction Master or his 4 identical friends, and boom you're done, then you can go over the forest where you get 10 logs and give it to the lumberjack who gives you an iron axe that can give you apples upon breaking logs, then you can go to the graveyard, talk to the bartender first, then kill 10 zombies or so, talk to him again, then he tells you something about you being good at fighting aka hitting slow, easy-to-hit mobs like 4 times in a row, then introducing you to Maddox I think, then his drug store, then you can go to the coal mine where you can mine 10 coal, talk to the blacksmith, get a random reforge for 10 coal, and other than that, I'd say that there's not much else to do on the hub for now, but since I'm only going to cover the hub once, might as well talk about everything, so you may notice that in the hub and most of the other islands, there's a ton of fairy souls, which you can press on to collect, then each 5 of them, when talked to Tia the Terrorist Fairy, you get stat boosts that total to around +4% speed among other things, in the wilderness, another thing in the wilderness is the Dark Auction, owned by an illegal smuggler named Sirius, hosted by him and his two bodyguards Bob and Bob, they sell tons of random stuff including a golden sword with great money capacity, a flower placing slave, several glowing books that are totally recyclable, a few useless animals, a golden shovel I think, a few player heads disguised as stat boosters, and other things, also there's the Community Center which is slightly less illegal, it's run by this clerk named Seraphine (who used to be the mayor, got demoted, probably because a couple investigators were able to catch her red handed after seeing her yoga room in her house), and every few months or a year in skyblock (I don't remember), they have 4 or 5 (I think 4) mayors that you can elect to be the new mayor, all giving special buffs or events, including fish girl, fish girl v2, rich guy who added like 100 billion coins to the economy, mining boy, dungeon boy, mythologic griffin girl, and more to come, now let's cover the other annual events, including Oringo the Travelling Pet Trafficker (this is a joke but not really, either way, admins please don't ban me), who sells random pets for massively compact stacks of foodstuffs or wood and items and of course, tons of coins, then there's the Fear Mom guy, I have absolutely no clue how to spell his last name (maybe Mongeror or Mongreror I have no idea), who sells some random stuff for candy dropped from horsemen, bats, and other mobs, also there's that one Jerry event thingy too where you have to help support Jerry and his duped stan accounts and also their massive gift piles (that you can't damage yourself, pretty mad), from an annual invasion of magma cubes, magma humans, and several larger magma cubes that take exponentially longer amounts of time to kill, also if you get yourself a snow cannon then it's literally a guaranteed top 5, meaning you get a free like 1 million coins from the event (maybe not 1 million coins but still you get PAID), and then there's the baker guy who gives away free cake to everyone (the cakes used to look pink but now it's a dull red, also I'm talking about the SPECIAL tag thingy, I have no clue why they changed the color, it looks weird now, speaking of things being changed to look weird now, can we take a moment to remember tarantula armor before it was changed to just being normal black leather armor, the old half chainmail thing looked cool now it looks bad), so yeah, I think that was the hub, I think I should mention a few more locations then we're going to start talking about the other islands, first thing I want to talk about is the one tuxedo guy who sells overpriced black leather armor, then the blacksmith guy and his friend who sells overpriced player heads, also the other girl person there who handles all the rune stuff, I don't know her name, also there's a few merchants who sell around 640 of each item per day, the Bazaar where you can buy and sell tons of stuff, the Builder who has an anticlimactic house, a redstone guy underneath him (which doesn't really matter since redstone is very limited on skyblock), and the wool weaver who now sells glass and terracotta and stuff, and I think that's about it for the hub, probably a few other things like the fisherman, Sirius's brother, that one dude with the hacker skin who sells you a reduced time personal bank item, etc but I'm going to ignore those since they're not important, so next we will go to the coal mine, go through the slimy launch pad, and go to the gold mine, where you can mine cobblestone, stone, iron, gold, and coal, meeting four new NPCs, the Janitor who's only good for his 100 coin Telekinesis enchant (0 anvil uses), the lazy miner guy who lost his pickaxe, tells you to go get it, and doesn't even care about it after you find it, then there's two merchants who sell gold and iron, a fancy sword with trashy enchants, gold armor, and chainmail armor, then you get mining level 5 and you go right on over to the deep caverns, where there are multiple floors starting with the Gunpowder Mines, where you battle invisible creepers that do 0.2 damage, mine everything you found in the Gold Mine, and then go to the next floor, the Lapis Quarry, filled with Lapis Zombies that seem fine but then they laser damage you for half your health and then spawn directly inside of you so yeah, you can also get lapis here, hence the name, next you can go down to the Pigman's Den, where there are many many pigmen who act weird since not only do they agro onto you when you hit them or their friends, but you also get attacked by them when you mine redstone near them, which is somewhat flawed as well since universal anger is a thing (when they're beating up some other guy, that other guy leaves, so they're like "oh we're still mad" so they beat you up for no reason), and you can, of course, get redstone here, next floor is the Slimehill where you can fight slimes that deal 10 blocks of knockback and have trash hitboxes, and you can mine emeralds, next is the Diamond Mine place thingy, where you can mine diamonds and fight stupidly overpowered zombies and homing bow skeletons, then below that there are diamonds, diamond blocks, and obsidian but in exchange, more stupidly overpowered zombies and skeletons to beat you up, and yes, you can get lapis armor and miner armor from here, both of which aren't amazing but aren't terrible either (just too rare for what they're worth), and then there's the lift operator dude who lets you go from floor to floor upon unlocking them, you can also get superboom tnt in the gunpowder mines for much cheaper than you can in the dungeon hub, which I'll talk about later, anyway, and while we're on the topic of the gunpowder mines, fun fact, you can shoot arrows blindly and if you have aiming on your arrows, they'll hit the invisible creepers, so that's pretty nifty, I would say, also that's all for mines, the rock pet I'm going to cover later in the pets section (assuming I remember to talk about pets), so yeah, next OHH I FORGOT the community center, I only covered the mayors and I forgot the magical steroid cookies that cost real life money to be bought, otherwise you use the bazaar but not like that's an option for ONE HALF OF THE AVAILABLE SKYBLOCK GAMEMODE OPTIONS, anyhow, the cookies make it so you can 1) fly on private islands, 2) not lose coins/potion effects on death, 3) get bits now and then, 4) allows you to do /ah and /bz from anywhere (access auction house and bazaar), and a few other things I'm forgetting, also these cookies caused SO MUCH drama on forums, people were like "ooh hypixel is promoting irl trading omg", yeah, so speaking of bits, there's also a bit shop where you can buy a ton of different items with bits, things include Kat Flower (reduces Kat upgrade time by 1 day), Builder's Wand (basically build things faster), God Potion (24 hours of all potion effect buffs), and more, so yeah, now let's talk about the graveyard, so you kill some zombies, they can drop potatoes and carrots occasionally, then you can go to the spider's den, where here, you can find many different species of spiders, silverfish, skeletons, slimes, and occasionally (once every hour), a Tarantula Broodmother miniboss spawns on the top of the den and drops a spider related talisman (the boss is pretty overrated, you can probably one shot it with your fist if you're good enough), and you can do tons of slayers here which I'll talk about later (assuming I remember to do so), then from this Spider's Den, you can go to either the End or the Blazing Fortress, so let's cover the latter first since the End is a very expansive topic, so the Blazing Fortress is the embodiment of hell but it's forty times less scary, once you get decent equipment then you have nothing to be scared of, once you are in this nether location, you'll meet several new mobs, including the upgraded Zombie Pigman (we met them earlier in the Pigman's Den, except this time, they're clothed), who can drop flaming swords which are utter garbage since they just have a built-in fire aspect which no one likes, also you can find and mine glowstone, netherrack, nether quartz, and nether wart here, also there's some Wither Skeletons that have a chance to drop enchanted coal/charcoal (going to cover enchanted stuff in a bit, again, assuming I remember it), and a few of these Magma Cube things that seem fine but then they shoot fireballs at you even after you decapitate them (wait hold on, how do you decapitate something that only has a head), and there's also Ghasts that spawn during the early morning, also there's a boss that spawns here called the Magma Boss, spawns every 2 hours I think, and it's the hardest boss in the game, extremely difficult to kill and requires maxed dungeon equipment to even scratch, and it drops overpowered items, SIKE it's literally weak, people kill it with a couple homing bat bombs, and they drop some useless items, also they used to drop Ember Rods (remember these) which are known for two things: one being one of the OG endgame weapons and two being the leading cause of your entire storage room to be exploded, but now it's discontinued, you can't get it anymore, anyhow, I think this is a good moment to talk about minions since I forgot about them earlier (yes, look at this essay structure, it's terrible), so minions are slaves unpaid workers who work for you 24/7 and generate their corresponding resources, there are many types of minions that can all be unlocked in their unique methods, generally you need to collect a certain number of the resources to unlock that corresponding minion, exceptions include the Flower Minion (obtainable only through Dark Auction), Snow Minion (obtainable only through gifts), Revenant/Tarantula Minion (obtainable through slayer levels), and yeah, minions have 2 minion upgrade slots, 1 fuel slot, 1 automated shipping slot, 1 minion skin slot, and an inventory that can be extended by leveling up the minion, and doing so also increases the minion's speed, hence, amount of items outputted, and upgrades include stuff like diamond spreading (around every 10 resources collected, it will give an additional diamond for free), compactor (compacts items to block form), super compactor 3000 (compacts items to enchanted form), flycatcher (increases speed), minion expander (increases speed except you need more room for your minion now), etc, also you can use orbs that buff minions within a certain radius, but these external buffs only work when the minions are loaded in, meaning you need to have someone afk on your island for these buffs to work, and other buffs are from certain pets, which I might as well talk about now, so pets are small companions that are generally floating heads that give certain buffs to the player, you can craft most of them and others are obtained through rare drops or buying from Oringo or Sirius or Diana, and all of them besides the Griffin pet can be upgraded (assuming they're not the legendary rarity) to the next rarity by using Kat, giving certain materials and coins then waiting for a few hours or days, and yeah, a few notable mentions include the Ender Dragon pet (obtained through EXTREMELY rare drops from dragons), Phoenix (extremely extremely rare drop from any mob besides zealots I think), and of course, the best pet of them all, Jerry pet (grants negative intelligence and absolutely no buffs), so yeah, that was it for pets, I think, oh right, you can craft most of them using two different items, the enchanted egg (used for crafting common/uncommon/rare pets), or the super enchanted egg (used for crafting epic/legendary pets), so yeah, where was I, oh right, so we covered the Blazing Fortress, now let's cover the End, which is a massive island filled with, of course, endermen, and also featuring several NPCs, one that wants you to race for a youtuber's foot, one that wants to sell you overinflated materials and books (seriously, remnant of the eye for several hundreds of thousands of coins, you gotta be kidding me), and there's a ton of mobs including, as I said, endermen (comes in different types, 4.5k health endermen, 6k health, 9k, or 12k or possibly 13k I don't remember and these guys are called Zealots which we'll get to in a second), overpowered endermites, homing bow wielding watcher mobs (they wear the summoning eyes on their head yet they don't drop them), and obsidian defenders (super fast annoying little mobs that give you wither effect and useless rare drops including a shirt named after some heavy dark rocks that can be bought from the auction house for 2 coins), and of course, there are blocks you can mine here, namely endstone and obsidian, both of which have a chance to be glowy, meaning you can mine them for rare items including mana 3 potions, archery 1 potions, coins, ender pearls, enchanted ender pearls, telekinesis 1 books, and end stone geodes (and other things probably), the latter being a reforge stone which we'll cover in the dungeons section, and also, these endermen I mentioned earlier have a chance to drop pets, 9k endermen being able to drop rare-legendary endermen pets, now Zealots, these guys are helpless mobs that are stabbed by fast children wearing dead dragons' skinsuits or other skinsuit wearing humans shooting ice spikes or exploding arrows or dangerous balloons, plus, Zealots have a 1/420 chance to spawn a Special Zealot, which has a 100% chance to drop a Summoning Eye, which can be used to spawn in Dragons (or sold to the Bazaar for around 600 thousand coins), now Dragons are bosses that spawn in the end, given 8 summoning eyes placed in the end portal frames, a random dragon can spawn (16% chance to spawn an Old, Protector, Wise, Unstable, Young, or Strong and a 4% chance to spawn a Superior), and once killed, depending on what placement you were for damaging the dragon and depending on how many eyes you placed, you can obtain fragments, dragon armor pieces, or things like the Phoenix pet or the Ender Dragon pet, and during the fight, dragons can either stand still and get killed by humans, rush toward nearest people, strike everyone with lightning, or shoot fireballs at children, also end crystals can spawn which heal the dragon for like 0.3 seconds until people shoot them with homing arrows and get crystal fragments, used to craft catalysts (triples minion outputs, they're one of the fuels that can be used in minions), and besides the dragon fight, there's also a different fight that can take place, a relatively new miniboss called the Endstone Protector, an iron golem that has 5 stages (fun fact, I actually told forums and the wiki about these 5 stages before anyone else did, so that's pretty nifty I would say, and yes, this was during the time when all staff said was something like "there's a new miniboss in the end" and no other information, so me spending 20 minutes figuring out how this miniboss works was pretty cool), anyway, yeah so the miniboss has 5 stages, each requiring a certain number of zealots to be killed, until finally it spawns, and it has a chance to drop End Stone, Enchanted End Stone, Endstone Flower thingies (endstone rose I think), and the two massively rare drops, Tier Boost Core (used to craft Tier Boost which can upgrade a pet to the above rarity), or the Golem Pet (epic or legendary), and you can also gain a larger chance to obtain these RNG drops if you killed zealots, the cap being at 100 zealots contributed (it's a very small increase in the chance of getting the drops), and so that was the end, now let's go over the forest quickly, so once you go to the Park from the Hub forest place, you can find multiple layers of floating islands, Birch, Spruce, Dark Oak, Acacia, and Jungle, where you can collect all these types of wood, items like the Jungle Axe and Tree Capitator can chop down multiple logs at a time, oh and so in the Park, there are many NPCs or quest thingies, in the Birch section, there's Charlie who wants stacks of each type of wood then just continues to say something like "I forgot what I was going to say", and there's also a woman named Vanessa who lets you buy rain for money since Hypixel understands the true purpose of cloud seeding (for more info on cloud seeding, go here), then there's a pond area where people fish, so then in the Spruce section, there's a floating island/house, home of the Melon Viking (his name is like Melancholic Viking, but I never knew how to spell that so I call him Melon Man, otherwise I call him Depressed Viking), and this dude has a quest for you where he's like "help me remember the sea" so you destroy his only source of warm air with a magical bucket of water, then slap a fish into his furnace, then twerk sneak in front of him around 20 times then he makes questionable noises and behavior then he becomes a Joyous Viking, allowing you to access his shop, where you can buy some book thing, a paper scroll, an iron axe, a player head disguised as a drug, and maybe some other things that I'm forgetting, anyhow that iron axe is called the Raider's Axe, a sword/axe that gives +15 coins per every mob killed (with exceptions), and it's comparable to an Aspect of the End, now then, let's go on over to the Dark Thicket AKA Dark Oak Wood forest place, where you can find yourself a campfire cult owned by some dude (named Ryan I think, I don't remember), and he wants you to burn yourself (or at least your legs) for extended periods of time, then give him extremely compact pieces of wood, then you get a custom player head that heals you while burning, which will never be useful since when are you going to be burning for a long time, exactly, never, so that's only good for its reforge boosts, which I'll go over in a bit (I think I went over it already but not in depth so, yeah), then the acacia forest place where you can meet an old dude who sells a tactician's sword and a wood singularity or whatever, then there's a mine place where you can mine gold ores for shiny rocks, used for a quest that I'm going to talk about in 4-786 seconds, depending on how fast you read, so once you climb up another floor, there's the Jungle Island, where there's an NPC called Juliette which I'm not a big fan of given that they copied that one literature guy, anyhow, it's a classic love story where the player needs to pay them over 10 million coins worth of items, including a very compact and hot bucket of lava, a flower slave that I mentioned twice earlier, a blade filled with hundreds of thousands of emeralds, and you have to wear one of those overpriced tuxedos I talked about a few lines back, then once you fuel Romero and Juliette's love completely, then you get a rock as an award, granting you a small chance to gain double damage, which I'm going to be honest here, given that it's a 1/100 chance, it's pretty cool when you deal double damage, except this one time I had seemingly gotten double damage like 5 times in a row, then I realized that it wasn't my luck being good, it was instead my brain being dumb and not realizing I had hearts rune on my weapon, anyhow, that's it for the forest thing, also fun fact, you can see the end island from where Juliette is, so that's pretty cool, also yeah, that's it for the forest, now there's one more chain of islands, the farming islands, so once you go through the portal from hub going to the Barn, you'll end up on an island filled with Pigs, Cows, Chickens, Carrots, Wheat, Potatoes, Melons, and Pumpkins, then you can go to the next island called the Mushroom Desert, where there's now Sheep, Sugarcane, Cactus, and (of course) Red/Brown Mushrooms, and then there's this unfinished portal thing made of sandstone, no one knows what it is, staff probably forgot about it too (lmao this is a joke), so yeah, then we are done with the islands, now let's talk about a different hub called the Dungeon Hub, but before we talk about dungeons, I'm going to talk about a few things I missed, so firstly, skyblock has a unique method of creating enchanted versions of items, for most minion related resources, you can "enchant" the items, basically combining 160 of them in a crafting table to get one enchanted corresponding item, and there are exceptions, sometimes it's not 160 and instead it's more or less, so keep that in mind, also SLAYERS, a mindless grind of 3 different mobs, zombies, spiders, and wolves, where you start the quest using coins, you kill a certain amount of the corresponding mob type, then you spawn in the boss, and then you kill the boss, then you repeat this around 15,000 times, then you get +2 health regeneration, so yeah, I think that that's all I really need to talk about, I'm going to safely assume, OH WAIT RIGHT I FORGOT fishing, so basically fishing is custom in skyblock, it's been–uh–adapted to resemble real life fishing, meaning you can pull out massive iron golems, guardians being ridden by bow spamming emperors, literal yetis, snowball spamming snowmen, frozen default minecraft characters, silverfish, sharks, chicken jockeys, other guardians by themselves, small self reproducing hydras, some green guys who steal presents from orphans, and a ton of other weird water creatures, all from a 1x1x1 water source, see, this makes perfect sense, so yeah, there's a ton of fishing stuff in the game, that was literally my point, next runic stuff I think I should mention, so you may see some mobs with purple names saying "Runic" in front of their normal tag and health bars, this means that once you kill them, you can get runes, which as a general rule, runes are completely useless, only keep the legendary ones, blood runes, and slayer runes since those three are the only runes that people care about, so ye, also a few things I want to specify, there's also some healing balls called orbs, healing sticks called wands, healing weapons called ornate zombie swords or normal zombie swords, a diamond sword obtained from the deaths of an average of 3368 zealots being murdered, then the dragon that is spawned also being murdered, uhmmm, there's also a few other things but I don't feel like talking about those, this was honestly just added to see if there's actually a limit to the number of characters you can have in a skyblock post, turns out that there doesn't seem to be any, therefore time to go over DUNGEONS except wait, PLUMBER JOE, sells underpriced sponges that clean up your water sources, okay now DUNGEONS, so dungeons are a decently new addition to the game, you basically get to survive and explore through complex labyrinths, filled with unique mobs (including zombie guys, skeleton guys, zombies that throw bones, ninja guys that shoot wither skulls, occasionally a strange hedgehog that has millions of health and can one shot basically everything, a few minibosses including more furries wearing dragon skinsuits, etc) then a magical boss fight at the end of every floor, preceded by a miniboss fight involving a floating eye, then once you finish the floor, depending on how well you did, you get prizes, in order from least expensive to most expensive, you can get a wooden chest (free), golden chest, diamond chest, emerald chest, obsidian chest, or bedrock chest, and you can get rare items including shadow assassin armor, adaptive armor, and more, so yeah that was dungeons, also I think I should talk about a few other things, like baits (can enhance your fishing), talismans (can give specific buffs and can be reforged to give other stat buffs), and oh right I forgot to mention the dungeon hub, so the dungeon hub is where you get to go do dungeons from, there's also a whole racing system built by the amazing build team (thank you guys for that), and there's also a blacksmith NPC who lets you use many things, starting with essence crafting, where you can upgrade specific equipment in order to get stars on them, maximum of 5 stars, which basically just improves their performance in dungeons, additionally, there's a way to sell dungeons stuff for essence, and of course, there's reforging, where you basically put in an item (or your entire talisman/accessory bag), and reforge them to get certain buffs and a prefix on the items, also, there's advanced reforging, where you use a reforge stone and some coins to get a different exclusive reforge, then you can also buy some dungeons buffs using essence, okay I think that that covers it all, oh my gosh that took me like eight hours not even kidding (actually, more like three hours), still this took me a long time, so I would appreciate it if you guys liked this thread or bumped it or something, ughhh okay anyway, one last thing I should mention, that is glitched items, so throughout skyblock, there have been many bugs causing glitched items to come into existence, these include null, banners, lucky blocks, placable backpacks, end portal frames, unnamed runes, horse armors, name tags, and more, if you want to check out some of these, be sure to visit an official island with these on display, TimeDeo has quite a few of these, SuperRedHulk1 used to have a TON of these (before he got wiped), and I'm fairly certain that the helper Centranos is currently working on his museum (Dark Treasury), so be sure to check those out, also I think this is a good time to plug my discord and my guild (jk jk, unless you actually care, in which case, check my signature), so without any more further ado, thank you for reading, and if you somehow read this entire thing, then go drink some water, take a walk, what are you doing with your life (don't ask that to me though, I won't be able to answer), so yeah, also if I forgot something, then I will kindly ask you to be quiet do you know how much pain I went through so yeah, hope you guys enjoyed and have a nice day.

Raw Materials: 370240 rotten flesh

title: Slayer Update [IDEA]
body:
So this idea is pretty simple, you pay x2 the slayer price to get the exp instantly and not have to go and kill it, but to unlock this, you have to kill the slayer tier an X amount of times. So basically lets say you just started playing, to unlock the feature to pay double to bypass the slaying part of it you have to kill that tier of slayer boss around 50 times, this is to prevent 10 minute playtime boys to just get donated 100mil and get slayer lvl 9 in like 2 minutes.

So after you kill it an X amount of times [set by admins ig]
it would be
-50k for killing a tier 4 rev and 500 exp
-100k for 500 zombie exp
This would be DOUBLE the price to level up which is already pretty expensive, maybe be even more than double, this might upset lvl 9 slayer people but I find it as a cool idea that many people would wanna see in the game, ofc you wouldnt get any drops from the double prices either so thats another downsight, I feel this is balanced but thats for the admins to decide.

Eh, its not like this is gonna be read by more than 10 people so I am just wasting my time here.

title: Idea: The Earth Staff/ The Earth Bow
body:
The earth staff is a item unlocked at Cobblestone XI. It is crafted with a legendary earth shard in the middle of a 3x3 crafting table, and Ench cobblestone around it, but above the earth shard, there is a spirit wing or bone, if you use a spirit wing, it will turn into the Earth Staff, if you use a spirit bone, you will get the Earth Bow.

The earth staffs stats are
130 Dmg
250 Intelligence

Ability: Rock of the Earth
You throw a rock, causing a square in a 6x6 area to dmg your enemy for 1000 base dmg, scales with intel
Cooldown: 4 seconds


The Earth bow Stats are
100 dmg
50 str
40% crit dmg

Ability: Increased Rock

Every piece of cobble stone in your inventory will be get rid of, but double the stats of your bow.

let me know your thoughts!
P.S each item has the same special ability, increases your defense by 100 for every 1000 hp you have (stacks up to 5 times)

title: My personal opinion on the whole "pay to win" drama
body:
Although this is my opinion, I'll try to be as unbiased as possible. However, this is an opinion afterall. You can disagree. This is by no mean representing any one/group other than myself. Don't go after others with full on toxic internet raging kid mode on. This is a gamemode on a server on a kod's favorite block game afterall.

Update 0.9 - The Community Center Update
The update dropped almost 2 months ago, it offered a new building in the hub complete with new NPCs and features. Community projects, and 2 new currencies - Bits and Gems.
Bits are earned via playing the game while having a booster cookie active. However, the booster cookies can only be purchased via gem or over a million coins in the bazaar. (the first one is always free).
Here's the controversial part - Gems. Gems can only be earned via real life currency or fishing for hundreds of hours. It is the first official currency in skyblock to be able to be purchased with real life money. This one is a red flag for a lot of players in the community.
Why?
Players have many different arguments as of why gem is a bad addition. I've chosen the most common/interesting ones:
Gems are an easy way to earn millions of coins with just a few bucks. You can skip hours of grinding with money, it's just unfair to free to play (F2P) players who grinded for hours to get what pay to win (P2W) players can get in a few minutes.
It's a violation of Mojang's EULA of no pay to win in multiplayer servers. (This actually doesn't violate EULA due to skyblock being a PVE game) 
This new addition is going to set Hypixel toward more microtransactions and ingame purchases in the future and will have a negative long-term impact on the server.

There are counter-arguments as well:
Purchasing gem for millions of coins doesn't make you good. Sure you might have the best gears, but you'll have low skill levels. You still have to grind for all the skills, the essential part of skyblock is still there.
Gem is very effective at stopping black marketing by providing an official way to exchange real life money into skyblock wealth.
Gems provide extra revenue for Hypixel to hire more developers and staff to improve the server and push out skyblock updates at a faster pace, it'll have a positive impact in the long run.

Here comes my opinion. If you can't take different opinions than yours, then stop reading right now.
I personally think that this update does more positive than negative. Sure it does make F2P players feel unfair, but it stops many problems that had been plaging skyblock for so long like blackmarketing. It also helped to bring more developers to skyblock, which was much needed. Before gems, skyblock only had 2 developers and updates were coming out at a snail's pace. Now with more developers, updates and QOL changes are rolling out much quicker to keep skyblock alive and growing. This gem update is just like the pit club in The Pit gamemode. Sure it does offer some advantages, but ultimately nobody really cared that much.

What are your opinions? Put your constructive opinions/criticism in the replies. I'll be reading them all.

title: Rouge Sword vs. Tailsmans
body:
Which one wins? Obviously, you want the two-fer if you can get it: "The rouge sword is surprisingly OP if you reforge your tailsmans correctly." But if you have to choose, it's rouge sword by a landslide, right?

For one thing, no one in the history of forums has actually written "rogue sword." It's "rouge sword" every single time.

For another, there's something delightful about the fact that it's *a yellow sword* that we're calling "rouge."

By contrast, the only funny thing about "tailsmans," as far as I can tell, is if you imagine someone who only ever calls "heads" for a coin flip. ("Heads? Psh. I'm a tailsman myself.")

Skyblock should 100% lean in to this. Create a "red reforge" that turns rogue swords red and changes their name to "rouge sword." (It should be in the Bank I collection: once you have collected 100 Bank I books from dungeon chests, you get a free red reforge.)

Please make this happen.

I hope you all have a great day!

title: Why The Devs Were Wrong To Disable Sapling Placement. (130+ positive reactions)
body:
As some of you may know, there has been a foraging method going around that allowed you to plant trees on your island and make up to a million foraging exp an hour. It involved placing saplings with a builder's wand and then farming the trees that grew.
Today, many of us awoke to see this message.




This was an unfair removal.
The builders wand did everything it was supposed to. Placing saplings was an intended feature.

Unlike Ghast Farming, which was macroable, this was not. It took effort to build the farm, plant, and destroy the trees. I see no reason for the admins to remove this as it is has pretty much the exactly the same effect as a Replenish enchanted hoe had on farming.

Bring back Sapling Placement.

Edit: I'm going to try to spread this as much as possible so there's a bigger possibility admins can see.
My message to admins: Please consider reversing your shadow deletion of sapling placement, it harms more people than you think, it invalidates hours of effort. A nerf would be better received.

Edit two: I'm going to add suggestions for nerfs here so that maybe admins will reconsider adding it!
@Sir_Bacon_2020 suggested to keep it in the game, but nerf the exp gain.

title: [Tip] Best tool for each category
body:
This is a thread to show you what to get (Regarding tools) :

Sword : Pigman Sword (or Techno Blade, as I like to call it.. )

The best sword in the game... It has the best ability for a sword and also deals a devastating blow when it's a critical hit. Put hot potato books to maximize this weapons' damage to make it even better.

Pickaxe : 
Overall : Diamond Pickaxe

This is the best pickaxe to get your hands on... To get the max. potential out of it, enchant it with Efficiency V, Fortune and Experience III, Smelting Touch and Telekinesis. Great for getting XP, mostly when equipping lapis armor

As a drill : Stonk

You might be thinking : Hey, this pickaxe "stonks" (ba dum tss)... Maybe, but it's an insane tool to get several stacks of cobblestone when equipping the miner's outfit. Seriously, this might be the Super Compactor 3000 farmer's best friend.

Axe : Jungle

When enchanted with Efficiency V and Telekinesis, this fills Minion Storage farming satisfying... Idk why, but the fact that you mine several wood logs at once is so great

Shovel : Flint Shovel (Trihard made me remember it's better than golden shovel)

The flint shovel has everything the golden shovel has, and always gets flint from gravel... No more putting gravel and have luck to get flint (If only I could get one in UHCs)

Hoe : Rookie Hoe

This is a real deal : Get it from the merchant and put Harvesting V on it... Unlike any other hoe (your neighbourhood hoe included xd), it has a 50% chance to get double crops, and it's great for sugar cane farms, since you can get up to 8 crops (AFAIK) with it

Since this thread was necro'd, I'll update this, here's the changes :
Best Sword : 50mil Midas
Best Axe : Treecapitator

title: [Idea] Additional drops for pumpkin/melon dicer and Coco Chopper
body:
I really love this farming update. But I was also disappointed with how bad the axes were compared to the hoes. The hoes grant 100-200% extra drop chance for their respective crop and go up to mythic if you recomb them. Meanwhile the pumpkin/melon dicer only give 5% extra xp, have epic rarity and the ability to get random extra drops that dont even count towards your collection. So there is no reason to get both axes unless you want to farm both for xp. And dont even get me started on the Coco Chopper, that thing is literally useless. Just get replenish on pumpkin/melon dicer.

So here are my suggestions to make them better. First of all, the extra drops should count towards your collection.
Secondly I think there should be more really rare drops, here are a few examples of what im thinking off:

Pumpkin Dicer rare drops: 
- Farming Stone (reforge stone): Used to apply the sweaty reforge to hoes/axes. Gain +2/4/6/8/10/12% farming xp
- Carrot treat (pet item): Used to upgrade rabbit pet to mythic rarity. Buffs the minion speed and farming xp perk to 40%

Melon Dicer rare drops: 
- Fertilizer Stone (reforge stone): Used to apply the fertile reforge to hoes/axes. Increases Chance for double drops by 6/10/15/21/27/35%
- Mammoth tusk (pet item): Used to upgrade elephant pet to mythic rarity. Buffs the extra drop chance perk to 60% and adds extra perk that doubles the reforge of the tool you are currently using

Coco Chopper rare drops: 
- Dicey Stone (reforge stone): Used to apply the dicey reforge to tools, gain +2/4/6/8/10/12 magic find and increases the drop chance for rare items of the 3 jacob axes by 10%

title: How to fix the problem when you get the items for a quest but it dosen't finish
body:
I'm sure there have been people that have 1 posted about this or 2 had this problem but sometimes for quests like collect nether wort, cactus, or cocoa beans.
if you a gathering these things with ANY WEAPON OR TOOL WITH TELEKINESIS is will not count those resources for that quest you need to take them either with your fist or anything else that doesn't have telekinesis.

So for warrior's quest and intermediate farmer (< two quests) you can not use a telekinesis item or weapon for the nether wort, cactus, or cocoa beans. this is the way it worked or me. if it does not work for you I recommend either post a bug report or just deal with it. ty have a good day

title: Should essence be added to bazzar??
body:
Well I haven’t heard any1 talk about it and I’m surprised, I think it’s a good idea but I’m not sure.

PROS:

1.Dungeons becomes more profitable.

2.You can’t get scammed by selling.

3.You don’t need lots and can sell the little you have.

4.you can star your gear easier

5. The essence shop will be more usable

idk if you have any thing else I should add tell me.


CONS:
idk



I see people saying some stuff and adding some stuff that would be bad. I’ll address them here.

in terms of lowering the price, no. Why?

more people can sell=lower price
More people can buy=higher price

lower price+higher price~same price

but...
Rn you can’t buy essence and use it in dungeons shop, so there for it will ACTUALLY make the prices go up.

Som1 else said you can but yourself through dungeons, no just no.
Firstly you can buy already stared items, but yes it will give you acces to some buffs but then.. honestly you won’t become good at dungeons with catacombs 12 just cuz you have all essence buffs maxed. And by that point you will have spent so much on essence that you will be doing dungeons in unstable.

another good idea multiple people said was having another npc sell it. I think that’s a good idea since essence isn’t a item.

yet another idea som1 said was having it so that you have to obtained the essence, that would also be good cuz then you have to grind, even if it’s a little, at least something to buy.

another of my own ideas is maybe having a catacombs req but each essence.

all these 3 ideas won’t be on bazar but I do think that the box would function similar


if an1 would want to make a kind of screen to se how it would look like feel free to post it and I’ll add it if it’s not something stupid like a apple renamed to tomato.

That’s it. I’m lazy. Bye.


have a nice day

title: What happened to the original 'DanTDM's bath water?'
body:
Back in 2019, dantdm made a couple of vids in hypixel skyblock before eventually discontinuing the series. In that series, he built a bathtub into the 'bathtub' and swam in it. After that, he used a bottle to collect water from the 'bathtub' water source, turning it into a water bottle. He later put it up on ah and dubbed it 'Dantdm's bath water.' The auction was won by a player named sewn for 15 million coins. I checked out sewn's sky.lea (https://sky.lea.moe/stats/sewn/Blueberry) but the water bottle seems to no longer be with him.

Does anyone know what happened to the original 'DanTDM's bath water?' Is it now in the possession of another player? Was it used for brewing and lost? Is it no longer in skyblock (e.g. thrown into the void)? Or is it just in one of his chests in his island? I would love if someone could help do some digging.

The video in question is here: 



A player known as sewn is seen winning the auction for 15 million coins at 11:21.

title: New Talisman [IDEA]
body:
Ok so I'm not good at making visuals of the ideas. But, basically this talisman would scale to your farming level. So each farming level would give you +1 speed giving a total of +60 speed when you are farming 60. This would be a rare talisman or maybe uncommon. Let me know what you think about this idea. And/ or what I could change about this idea.

Edit #1: Ok so I feel like the stats that this talisman should be changed to .25-.5 speed per farming lvl I'm to too sure yet. Also maybe it would give a 1% chance for double drops per farming lvl. I'm trying to not make this op so that way I have a chance at getting this actually added into the game.

Edit #2: So I was thinking about this idea and thought that maybe this talisman could be given to someone once they hit farming lvl 10. then kind of like dolphin pet and rock pet it could tier up at certain milestones. So at lvl 10 it would be a common talisman, at lvl 20 an uncommon, lvl 30 rare, lvl 40 epic, lvl 50 legendary, and at lvl 60 it would become a mythic. I know making it a base rarity of mythic has never been added but farming 60 is double the xp as farming 50 so it would be worth it to give the person it as mythic because of the grind it would take for farming 60.
Edit #3:

title: [IDEA] F8 Goldor Boss and Dialogue
body:
The staff is currently working on floor 7, so here is a boss idea of floor 8.



Spoiler: Phase 1



[GOLDOR] The end of the catacombs is near. I will not let you pass this time.
[GOLDOR] Minions! Kill these fools!

Goldor uses 5 minions to attack players. Each of the minions have 5 million health, but not all minions have the same attitude (One healer, one mage, one berserker, one archer, and one tank).

It is suggested to kill the healer first as it can heal Goldor himself and other minions. ALL teammates should participate in this phase.





Spoiler: Phase 2



[GOLDOR] What??? My minions are unstoppable!!
[GOLDOR] Well guess what, you all have to attack me!!!

Players actually kill Goldor himself. He has 20 million health, so it is suggested that your damage is high (but not too high that you won't have enough defense). 

It is suggested that ALL teammates participate in this phase. 





Spoiler: Phase 3



[GOLDOR] Congrats on killing me.
[GOLDOR] I hate Livid so much, so I will honor Thorn with the power of my skeletons.
[THORN] Thank you SO much Goldor.
[GOLDOR] You're welcome Thorn.
[GOLDOR] Guess what guys. You have to make me laugh!

In this phase, you have to kill Golden Wither Skeletons which have 10 million health. Goldor's laugh meter starts at nothing, and when 50 Golden Wither Skeletons are killed the laugh meter goes to full.

A hyper cleaver is going to be useful in this stage since the Skeletons are close to each other.





Spoiler: Phase 4



[GOLDOR] You really made me laugh XD!!!
[GOLDOR] You really thought this would be the last.
[GOLDOR] I am reviving my minions, AND myself to make me the strongest.
[SCARF] Hey!!! Why did you copy me?
[GOLDOR] Hey!!! Be quiet.

This phase is basically a combo of phases 1 and 2. The minions have 50% more health than last time and will do 25% more damage. Goldor has 30 million health this time. It's VERY important that ALL teammates participate in this phase.

Once again, it is suggested to kill the healer before any other otherwise minions + Goldor will heal.





Spoiler: End fail



[GOLDOR] Who knew how keen I still am.
[GOLDOR] So long adventurers.





Spoiler: End



[GOLDOR] I'm very exhausted right now.
[GOLDOR] I can't believe Maxor wasn't strong enough.
[MAXOR] What do you mean???
[GOLDOR] I can't explain right now.
[GOLDOR] This won't be the last of the catacombs adventurers.
[NECRON] Congrats!



If you think this is amazing, be sure to leave a bump.

title: Why essence shouldn't be added to the bazaar, and my comprise.
body:
1. Because if you did add it to bazaar, who would sell it? Everyone would want essence, and no one would sell their essence, so no one would buy essence, until people would pay sooo much that it would be overpay.
2. If we did add it to bazaar: these things would happen:
2a. The price of essence would rise, as said before.
2b. It would be so easy to max out your stuff! The only way to get wither essence is through secrets, and through post-boss chests. Why grind post-boss chests, when you could spend 1 mil to 5* your sword.
2c. Also, If you wanted to sell your essence, because the price would rise with demand, you could make soooo much money from just farming f1 post-boss chests. Like the free chest could give you 60k in return, WITH A B.
The comprise:
People want to add essence to bazaar, so people won't get scammed.
I say, that you should add an essence option in the trade menu, and then you can pay the according amount money per essence. This does not crash the economy, and people won't get scammed!
TL;DR:
Add an essence option in the trade menu.
Put your ideas down in chat!

title: BEST RIGHT CLICK MAGE SETUP ON A BUDGET FOR F7
body:
Floor 7 is right around the corner. Here is a budget guide to help you prepare for it.


Spoiler: Armour



Armour:

EHP will likely matter more than DPS since dungeon mobs will be significantly more diffcult than F6.

Precursor Eye: Reforged to Necrotic and enchanted with growth 7, Protection 7, rejuvenate 5, big brain 5, wisdom 5 and respiration 3.

3/4 Necromancer lord: Reforged to necrotic and/or loving reforge on chestplate and enchanted with growth 7, protection 7, true protection (for chestplate), rejuvenate 5, wisdom 5 and feather falling 10 (for boots)

Recombobulate all pieces of armour and fuming hot potato book them.





Spoiler: Weapons/Utility



Weapons/Utility:

Spirit Sceptre: Reforged to heroic, 5 starred, recombobulated and Enchanted using god book with smite 7 and ult. wise 5

Ice Spray Wand: Obtained from F6 at epic rarity and recombobulated to legendary. Reforged to heroic, 5 starred, and enchant with god book and ult. wise 5

100 Mil Midas Staff: Reforged to heroic, 5 starred, recombobulated, and Enchanted using god book with smite 7 and ult. wise 5

Florid Zombie Sword: Reforged to heroic, 5 starred, recombobulated, and enchanted using god book

Wand of Restoration: Recombobulated

Frozen Scythe: Reforged to heroic, 5 starred, recombobulated, and enchanted using god book with smite 7 and ult. wise 5

Plasmaflux Power Orb: RECOMBOBULATED (if possible)

Warped Aspect Of The End: Recombobulated, and enchanted using god book and ult. wise 5

Fabled Giant's Sword: Reforged to heroic, recombobulated, and enchanted using god book with smite 7 and ult. wise 5

Make sure to fuming hot potato book all weapons





Spoiler: Pets



Pets:

lvl 100 sheep pet (Legendary) with textbook
lvl 100 baby yeti pet (Legendary) with dwarf turtle shelmet
lvl 100 wither skeleton pet (Legendary) with textbook or dwarf turtle shelmet





Spoiler: Accessories



Accessories:

Recombobulate and reforge every talisman/accessory to demonic or bizarre, and enrich them with intelligence.





Spoiler: Final Adjustments



And lastly, say goodbye to your bank.

title: [Idea] Fisherman NPC Quest (New talisman)
body:
Hello Guys,

Today i would like to discuss a new Idea of mine which would be a Quest given by the NPC's found in the lobby. This is similiar to the Romeo and Juliette Quest

What is the Quest?

The Quest would be given by the Fisherman NPC, he would ask a question being "Hello young one," "May you please speak to my fellow friend (builders NPC) and ask him this question," "Where would i find a block of treasure?" You would then go to the Builders NPC and the following conversation would start, "What do you want?" "Oh your from the Fisherman NPC," "I have no idea what his talking about?" "Maybe speak to the Armourer NPC, he might know of this treasure block." You would then go to the Armourer NPC, The following conversation would begin, "Welcome young one", "I heard why your hear," "Ill make this quick, speak to the adventurer He would know of this Treasure block," You would then go to the adventurer, he would say "Ahh you, you must be the one, the one to finish what i started," "You know that emerald block, in the graveyard young one?" "Well your gonna need to go there, and break that block with this, and bring the item back to me" You would go to the emerald block on the Graveyard with the pickaxe, the block will then go to your inventory, and to avoid any bugs the block would remain there however the pickaxe would break but the block would be in your inventory, then you would go back to the adventurer NPC, and give him the block, "Wow thank you young one," "For doing this favour i will reward you with this," He would give you a miniture emerald block and ask you to give this to the Fisherman NPC, When you give this to the Fisherman NPC, the following thing would happen, "Hello again," "Wow thank you young one, for finding me this block of treasure i would like to give you this present" He will give you a small Sponge hat talisman called, Spongeython.

Talisman Perks

The talisman would be called Spongeython and would be a rare talisman.

Perk, the perk would be every new level for a skill, 100 fishing exp would also be granted.



This was just a small idea i had and wanted to make this maybe possible, it probably wont be but please bump this to help me and let me know if you approve or if i should make some small edits. Have a wonderful Day!

title: [Guide] Common question of the New Mayor. What should I do? |Full Slayer Guide/ 5+ Positive Reactions|
body:
Many people have been asking whether to do rev or svens for the new mayor.
Here's a comparison of the two


wolf tooth --> much more expensive
rev flesh --> 0.1 coins and no one wants it

Sven drop
=Extreme Rare=
Overflux --> Pig pog money 33mil - 40mil (Price currently dropping because of new mayor)
=Rare=
Red claw --> Ez 500k
coture rune --> ez 100k-200k
=Not So Rare=
Crit 6 --> ez 500k
Spirit Rune --> 17k on ah
=Common Drop=
Hamster Wheel --> 20k to bazaar (drops 4-5 from a t4)
=Guaranteed Drop=
wolf tooth--> 22.6 coins per
Time per boss/ 2 minutes depends on your gear
good gear = 1 minute



Rare Drop From Wolfs
Weak Wolf Catalyst --> 49k per on ah
Travel Scroll To Howling Cave --> 13.5k on ah


=======================================
10/2/2020 Edit: _4ch suggested that when doing svens, you can use Full Hpbed wise + Manaflux + Voodoo + Prismarine sword(x3 damage in water).
it takes less times and easily kills pups.
=======================================

Rev Drop
=Extreme Rare=
scythe blade --> 700k - 800k maybe less
=Somewhat Rare=
Beheaded Horror -->15k - 45k (if lucky)
Revenant Catalyst --> 47k avg (on ah, according to HyAuction)
Smite 6 book --> 30k - 50k
Snake Rune --> 144k avg on ah
=Common rare-ish drop=
Foul flesh --> 25k per (sell at npc) --> Always drops two so 50k
Undead Catalyst --> 1k on ah
Pestilence Rune --> 500 coins on ah



Time per boss/ less than 1 minute if you are good/lucky
1.5minutes on average maybe

So compare the drops you can get from wolf 7 i think wolf is just generally better if you trying to get rare drops
But as in combat xp wise, you can kill a t4 rev boss faster than a t4 sven

In conclusion,
Go for wolf if --> Want to make profit/being able to use uwuflux
Go for rev if --> want combat xp and get no drops and burn money and get to use reaper mask and scythe


But people often forget tarantula
Which is also a good source of money-making method

Tara drop
=Extremely Rare=
Digested Mosquito --> 2.6mil on avg
=Very Rare Drop=
Tarantula Talisman --> 4.5mil on avg
Fly Swatters --> 500k
=Not So Rare Drop/Common Drop=
Bane of Arthropods VI book --> 20k - 50k avg on ah
Toxic Arrow Poison --> 128k /per stack to npc (Edit: you get 60 -64 every drop)
Spider Catalyst --> 25k
Bite Rune --> 8k - 14k avg on ah
=Guaranteed Drop=
Tarantula Web 0.2 coins per

Time Required to Complete a t4 Boss: 1.5minutes on avg, 1 minute if lucky

=Rare Drop from Spiders=
Travel Scroll To Spider's Den Top of Nest --> 27k


As above, Toxic Arrow Poison is actually a very common drop
So 25k for 128k-ish is actually a 103k profit
Which is better than t4 rev foul flesh that gives 50k at npc
And it the time required to do a spider is much less than svens

Gear wise:
Tara --> Full Tarantula set (More kills the better--> Get spider grinder)
Sven t4 --> Mana flux + Mastiff + Pooch \OR/ Radiant + Mastiff + Shaman + a friend if possible (takes 3 minutes to finish a boss)
Rev t4 --> Superior + aotd \or/ Strong + aotd + mana flux

EDIT: Risk Of Dying:
Tara t4: 0 chance of dying with a decent amount of kills on a tarantula set (full set)
Rev t4: High chance of dying on the crit ability, so move around as often as possible, requires high defence
Sven t4: Need to have the most amount of crit chance in order to not get slowly dissolve by the sven pups

All in all, my personal preference is tarantula, because I feel like it actually makes money and is easier to do upon all 3 slayers. But Rev is the best if you are grinding for combat xp. Svens generally is to just get to level 6 for the mana flux which can be used to do revs/taras, or to get to level 7 and get overflux and make big bucks.

Edit: Doing Tarantulas is my own personal preference. I don't recommend it for everyone because everyone has their own opinion and agenda for doing slayers. As I said above, each kind of slayers has its unique good part of it, I just find tarantulas better

title: [Idea] Combining Pets
body:
One of my favorite thing about skyblock has to be the pets. Not only do you get a companion, but you also become stronger in whatever you decide. And as I was thinking of how hypixel could bring more pets to everyone, I thought to myself, "Why not just combine them?"

Let's say you combine the Rabbit pet and the Elephant pet to get: 'Rabbiphant'.

As requirements to combine, both need to be legendary and maxed level. Lets also use a similar approach of upgrading pets with Kat. She will take both pets and take [x] days (just an example) to combine both of them... The 2 pets will become a brand new mythic level 1 pet (leaving it at lvl 100 might be fine). Of course, this would be a very late-game thing to do. I think that combining pets should also cost you money (the same way you have to do with upgrading them using Kat).

One of the abilities for this new pet would be, "Happy Stomp". Happy Stomp, gives you [x] defense for every [x] speed you have and will also make the jump potion give you [x] speed. (I'm using [x] because maybe they can buff abilities or leave the as they are now.)

For another example, let's combine Trunk Efficiency and Farming Exp Boost to create "Farming Trunk". This ability will let you gain more exp from farming while also increasing your chance of double crops.

To finish this, I know that this is a rough idea, but I think it would be a great way for Skyblock to bring more pets into the game while using already existing ones.

Tell me what you think of this idea and if you would like it or not. Again, this is only a rough idea so I'm sure there are a lot of places where it could be improved upon.

title: Some late-night ideas I had while farming for fishing
body:
New fishing island introduction


Spoiler: Vast Seas



This new island would have 5 different sections of fishing spot.
1. Cape of Shipwrecks
2. Coral Reefs
3. Volanic Islands
4. Kraken's Lair
5. Underwater Battleground





Spoiler: Cape of Shipwrecks



This would be the more beginner part of the islands. It requires a fishing level of 15 to enter. This would be the first treasure fishing spot, where instead of sea creatures you would fish for treasure. Spoiler for loot/mechanics below the 5 sections descriptions.





Spoiler: Coral Reefs



This spot would have docile and new creatures to fish up. A fishing level of 20 is required to enter. There would be a once every 6 hours event called the "Rave Event" which new and extremely rare creatures drop valuables Spoiler for loot/mechanics below the 5 sections descriptions.





Spoiler: Volanic Islands



This place would be more of a community golem/zealot grind. A fishing level of 25 is required to enter. Here you would fish up various dangerous mobs that you need special armor to beat (sup, strong, shadow assassin would be useless against these minibosses.) Once the players on the island have killed enough of these creatures, a very strong Lochness Monster spawns. It would be immune to anything but fishing rods, and it would do major single-target damage. Once killed, the loot it gives will distribute based on how much creatures you fished up to contribute. The island would need to kill 200 of these creatures, and you are ineligible for the rewards if you fished up less then 10. The more you fished up, the more loot you would get, up to two Bait Buckets. These would be like the summoning eyes for dragons, except it wakes up the kraken... (Also damage matters)





Spoiler: Kraken's Lair



Unlike dragon fights, there will only by one "type" of kraken: Woken. A fishing level of 25 is required to enter.The Woken Kraken has 100M hp and is immune to everything but fishing weapons. It will kinda sit there and take damage and attack players using three damages for its first 50% hp: Tsunami, Crush, and a true damage attack, drown. Tsunami will deal around ~30,000 damage plus another 10,000 per 1k hp the player has (so, a player with 3k hp gets hit for 60k damage) (ofc, defense helps) so you want a decently high ehp armor for killing the kraken. Crush deals ~40k but doesnt scale with health. Drown will deal 100% of the player's strength as true damage. The kraken is spawned with 16 bait buckets and weight is calculated like dragons. The next 25% of their health, they will use high single target damage that will 1shot anyone without special fishing armor in the earlier sections. A couple ideas were torpedo, waterspout, and naval mine (naval mine would be just an invis armor stand with a head that looks like a naval mine or something, a waterspout I dont really know how that would work but it would kinda suck players into it and deal damage, torpedo would just be another invis armor stand thing.) The last 25% of his health he summons strong and tiny mobs called "Kraken's spawn" it would kinda be like sven's pups, they dont do much damage on their own but together they drain people extremely fast. Loot from kraken below the 5 sections description





Spoiler: Underwater Battleground



This place would have more then 20 new very hostile and end-game sea creatures. A fishing level of 30 is required to enter this place. Description of mobs and loot below the 5 sections descriptions


Before we get to the loot/new mobs, please add something else to the fishing skill. More sea creature chance, more something.


Spoiler: Cape of Shipwrecks - Loot



Things you can fish up for treasure fishing: Bits (1-300 for a common drop, 301-1k for an uncommon, 1,o01-3k for an extremely rare, and 3,001 to 8k for omega rare kinda odds.) This would mean, finally, ironman profiles can obtain bits to spend. A pet item that gives 20% faster catches (so if you already have 100% scc and dont need souvenir, you can use this.) More coins, preferably 100k-200k as a more common drop, 200,001-500k uncommon, 500,001 to 1m uber rare etc just some coins to throw in, Rod Enhancers you can catch these maybe once every 2,000 or so catches. They will give an amount of sea creature chance 1-5, and fishing speed 1-20% faster. You can only apply one rod enhancer per rod, you can switch enhancers but they will be deleted kinda like how pet items work. You can catch a specific rare sea creature's bait bucket (for upcoming islands) MORE IDEAS TO BE ADDED. I am waiting for more feedback before adding ideas.





Spoiler: Coral Reefs



New Sea Creatures:
Hardened Clam (Level 20 fishing requirement): Drops Raw fish, Ink sacs, and rarely pearls. Pearls can craft a pearl necklace, which is an uncommon talisman that grants +1% sea creature chance.
Fiesty Crab (Level 21 fishing requirement) Drops: Lily pad, Raw salmon, pufferfish, enchanted bones, and rare crab shells that crab craft armor. This armor is like a mid-game angler set. Its full set bonus gives 20% faster fishing time.
Pokey Urchin (Level 22 requirement)Drops: Prismarine crystals/shards, pufferfish, and an extremely rare urchin gauntlet. It would not count as a talisman, but the more sea creatures you kill with the item in your inventory, the more stats you get TBA 
Blue-ringed octopus (Level 23 requirement) Drops: Ink sack, Raw fish, Rare Ink Singularity that is used to upgrade the ink wand to do more damage.
Deadly Jellyfish (IDEAS TBA, WAITING FOR FEEDBACK)
Sea Turtle (IDEAS TBA, WAITING FOR FEEDBACK)





Spoiler: Volanic Islands



IDEAS TBA WAITING FOR FEEDBACK





Spoiler: Kraken's Lair



IDEAS TBA WAITING FOR FEEDBACK





Spoiler: Underwater Battleground



IDEAS TBA WAITING FOR FEEDBACK


So yeah, I'm waiting for feedback for this to update it. If you like it, please give it a thumbs up, and any ideas if you reply ill credit you if I decide to add it. Thanks for reading!​

title: FLOOR 10 NECRON BOSS FIGHT PREDICTION! (please read, i spent over an hour on this) OVER 100 POSITIVE REACTIONS!
body:
Floor 10 will be like all the other floors, with a trap room and a lot of new puzzles. since Floor 10 is a Large dungeon, the speed score only goes down after 45 minutes.
when you get to blood room, The Watcher will say:

















When you beat The Watcher, it isn't the normal stuff that happens. The portal isn't there. Instead, Necron comes and smites The Watcher as he did with the Professor.








Suddenly, purple particles appear beneath everybody's feet and you suddenly get warped into a large cave, with Necron. There are fairies hiding behind rocks and you can kill them to revive a teammate.




















The ghosts of all the bosses from floors 1-9 appear floating around Necron.




Bonzo suddenly appears somewhere in the cave Necron lives in. He has 10 million health and a really buffed up Bonzo staff that does 5x more damage.
When you kill him, he drops a Super Bonzo Staff that can be used to shoot the ghost of Bonzo. If you miss, Bonzo gets revived again, and Necron says one of his "miss" phrases.




or




or




or the classic




When you kill a ghost, Necron says either




or




or




or








Once you kill Bonzo, Necron summons Scarf.




He has 15 Million health and all the attacks of the Mage, Archer, and Mage from floor 2, and he can heal himself once every 20 seconds.
He doesn't drop anything, but when he dies he revives himself completely, and the ghost of Scarf around Necron disappears. When you kill him again, Scarf dies for good and Necron summons the Professor.




He is still in guardian form and can strike lightning, because of the excess energy he obtained when Necron smited him in Floor 3.
He has 15 Million health, and all the attacks of the Guardians from Floor 3 and he can use Giga Heal once every 1 minute.
He drops a Dungeons item called a Guardian Laser which can be used to hit the ghost once.
If you miss, The Professor gets revived and Necron says one of his "miss" phrases mentioned above.
If you hit the ghost, Necron says one of his "hit" phrases mentioned above and he spawns Thorn.




Thorn bursts from his ghost shape and circles the cave. His ghost disappears. He has a new attack and he can shoot a fireball, lighting the ground that it hit on fire, which does the same amount of damage as the fire in Floor 4.




He then spawns his animals like he did in Floor 4.
The damage and health of each animal is buffed 5x.
When the Spirit Bear dies he drops a Spirit Bow, but Thorn gets 2-shot instead of getting 4-shot.
Instead of the crowd mocking you, Thorn shouts out insults every few seconds.
When Thorn dies, Necron spawns the next boss.

We dont know what Floor 5-9 bosses look like, so this will keep getting updated as new floors come out.

When you kill all the bosses from Floors 1-9, Necron says








he then jumps down and starts shooting wither skulls and punching you.
He has a whopping 1 Billion health, and when you get him to 1 health, he becomes invincible.












He then turns into a wither with another 1 billion health. When you beat him, he says








Suddenly, plants start growing everywhere.




Instead of chests, The Oracle gives you a selection of coins and a few other weapons, and sometimes, a nether star. All of them are for free.

If you lose to Necron, he says
